name: Cassandra Mackey
text: The staff is phenomenal there!! From the phone call to confirm I was coming to my appointment to the day I went into the office, they are so sweet over the phone and even nicer in person. I saw Dr.Moore and Dr.Kyatt they both were very kind, caring, and compassionate. They sat with me and explained all of my different options until I completely understood all of my treatment. All of the assistants, hygienist and all of the girls up front and the office manager were so great! The office manager worked with me financially, I was able to pay monthly which really helped. She explained everything in detail. This office is very thorough, professional, and empathetic. Definitely recommend to anyone needing dental work!!! I will never go anywhere else for my dental needs!

resp.text: I'm happy the team took great care of you, Cassandra. I hope you continue to have 5-star visits in the future! Keep smiling. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Vonda Moore
text: Worse dental facility ever. I started off with a really good hygienist and turns out she was the only professional there. I got a root canal and they acted like I was a car on an assembly line and same with my wisdom teeth. You’ll have to look up information on the internet to get real after care instructions because they don’t care. I can’t even count the cancellations. I took off work for a cleaning and guess what? Another cancellation. I don’t understand how they still have customers. I was as patient as I possibly could be.

resp.text: I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to expectations, Vonda. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the Patient Satisfaction team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: brooke gilliland
text: I love this place! Everyone is so caring and goes above and beyond to help patients needs. Dr. Kyatt and Dr. Moore are wonderful doctors! I would definitely recommend to my friends and family!!

resp.text: It's a joy to hear this, Brooke. I'm glad you've had wonderful experiences with the team and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much! - Krista, ADMI

name: kevin camp
text: Called with tooth pain.  Talked to a very nice gentleman who got me an appointment in the town I was going THE NEXT DAY!  Everyone from the receptionist at the front desk forward during my visit were EXTREMELY NICE!  Got my teeth cleaned and a filling done THAT DAY!  WILL BE RECOMMENDING THEM AND USING THEM GOING FORWARD!!😊😊😊

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Kevin. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Melissa Simmons
text:
If I could  rat this dentist a zero I would I am so horrified at the experience I have had at this place about a month ago I went in and had a root canal done and paid cash money to have it done fast forward to now I called them Tuesday and told them that I was having severe pain in that tooth and I need to see the dentist the lady at the front desk told me that I will have to see the Dentist that perform the root canal this is also the lady that try to charge me $150 for a toothbrush  When I went in to get my teeth clean and asked her why it was so much and she said this is how much we charge for a cleaning and found out later that she had added that $150 on my bill for A toothbrush she know I didn’t  want ((((scam)))the only available dates that they whole have will be next Tuesday I explain to her the severe pain that I was having and that I could not wait till next Tuesday because I didn’t know if it had became infected or what was going on she say I’m sorry but you have to wait till that day To me this is gross negligence I do not understand for the life of me why they could not let the dentist that is on call  look at it to tell me what is going on and why I am having such severe pain it is now Saturday and I am not even able to get out of bed because it hurt so bad it is making my head hurt and the side of my face hurt it has turned black around my tooth I am unable to eat or drink anything  and the sad part about it is it not even hurt this bad before I got the root canal and I paid all that money to fix a problem that is now not even fixed!!!!!!!!  And now I am going to have to pay out more money because I am going to the ER to try to figure out what is going on because I am in so much pain !!!!!!!!! I would like a full refund so I can go to a Dentist that actually cares and don’t just push you out the door after they have gotten your money!!!!!!!! I do not trust this place and I refuse to pay them another dime out of my pocket!!!!!! This needs to be fixed and it needs to be fixed now!!!!!

Update I am now running a high fever on my way to the ER!!!!!!!!!

text: The staff was very nice and helpful.  I found the visit was comforting , considering the reason for the visit. The doctor was very good at what he does.  I was given antibiotics for a week before he can remove the molar,  cost was $202.00 to remove the molar.  The initial visit and exray was free of charge. I would definitely recommend Aspen Dental of Gadsden to my friends

resp.text: I'm glad that you felt at ease with the team, Xavier. Thanks so much for sharing that you had a 5-star experience at the Aspen Dental practice in Gadsden. - Emily, ADMI

I don’t appreciate being done this away… they said the appointment was on Saturday… again..DUHHHH !!!.. this is no way to run a business… I texted the business while we were waiting…. Again.. “zip “… I am posting this to keep a opera on from wasting their time on a business that does people this way… …

text:
I have an abscessed tool, which is painful. I am still waiting on my stimulus check but have enough for the extractions. However, because I would not sign the full treatment plan, the tooth extraction was delayed more than 10 days. I felt that I was not important enough to receive immediate  care. I left believing that they are concerned more about the money than helping me. Now I am searching for another dentist.
Blessings, Jerry

name: randall gregerson
text:
The experience was great in almost every way. The staff and Dr. Kayatt are excellent.
My only complaint is that they do not strictly enforce the mask policy in the waiting room. One man was not only sans mask, but complained to the receptionist about mask policies. I know this seems petty to some when considering it's a dental office, yet, I must say that the location has a mask policy and should enforce it. Otherwise, it was a very good experience for a difficult and anxious procedure.

resp.text: Hi Randall, I'm so glad you've enjoyed your experience with the team. We appreciate your feedback about COVID/mask issue. I will pass this along to the team, but please don't hesitate to reach out to them to discuss any questions or concerns you have about your treatment plan. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Joanie Medlin
text: One star one because I can't give none. This is the biggest joke of a company I have ever seen! I called at 0800 am and made an emergency virtual appointment for my husband who was in severe pain with a broken tooth. His entire face and neck was swollen. They stated that we should receive an email prior the the scheduled time with instructions and if not then to call back. 45 minutes prior to the appointment, no email so I called. Was told that we wouldn't get an email but would get a call at the appointed time. No call. I called them again, they rescheduled for an hour later with a different office. We still did not receive any form of contact. We ended up in the emergency department. I will be reporting this company to the BBB. Absolutely ridiculous to even call this a business!!!

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Joanie, regarding your husbands appointment. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

text: Came in for my initial appointment and staff didn’t want to see me. I ask why and they say, “well your appointment was at 12:00”-look at my phone and it is 12:03! I’m glad they’ve got plenty of patients and don’t need anymore, especially for those Friday afternoons, my family won’t be back.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear this, Joshua. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience, so they can address concerns directly with the office: 1-866-767-0890. - Krista, ADMI

name: Jesse Keith
text: Aspen dental of Gadsden, AL is by far the best dental office I’ve ever visited and had work done The assistants Ashley and Britney are polite and helpful and know their jobs extremely well, the office manager Jaimie and her staff were so nice and made scheduling and payment options so easy without stress and I saved the best for last as the Drs Haight and Kyatt were so gentle and explained everything upfront were patient and thorough as to my options and made the procedure absolutely painless. I strongly suggest visiting Aspen dental for any of your dental issues. There’s not a procedure they can’t accommodate and are remarkable at all of them I’m sure if they’re as good they were with my procedure. Just wanted to give that office credit because I didn’t know it was possible to have a painless visit with this amazing outcome without taking out a loan but they’re actually quite reasonable on their prices too. Still can’t believe it!! Thanks Aspen.  10 stars, two thumbs up whichever, you tell me after your visit 😁💯

resp.text: This is wonderful to hear, Jesse. I'm so glad you felt the Aspen Dental team in Gadsden went above and beyond for you. Thanks for taking a moment to share the details of your exceptional experience! - Krista, ADMI

The dentist and dental hygienist was nice and not judgy considering the train wreck of teeth I was needing help with. I am thankful for them. Believe me!

People were pleasant. But my Lord at the cost. $9500 total and that's not even talking braces or anything that I do need.

I just don't believe any healthcare provider can be at a point where you HAVE to have certain things done you can't elect for the services you need. Basically said I had to do all or nothing.

text: I made my appointment specifically saying I was in severe pain and wanted the tooth pulled. Why have me come in early and then still not do what i came for?? On top of that the next available appointment to come back was a week away..thanks but no thanks I happily found another dentist that got me straight in and the tooth pulled.

text: Only giving one star so I can post this review. I made my appointment yesterday and explained what I was needing done. At this time I was informed that the advertising I had saw would not be available and it would be $338.00 for what was advertised at $50.00.  The girl doing the consultation didn't seem to care about my time or the fact that a national advertising price existed. She said the doctor made the price.  You would think it should be the same no matter what aspen you go to guess not. I called the corporate office and spoke with a customer satisfaction specialist guess we'll see what they say. The reviews about pricing all are true at this location.

name: Cheryl Laney
text: Went for bad tooth pain. Tooth needs to be pulled. I take blood thinners so  I cannot take Iboprofren.The dentist wrote antibiotics and told me to take Iboprofren.for my pain.Told her I can't so can I get something for my tooth pain.she said no nothing we can do. First time in my life ever been treated like that .I have had several bad teeth thru the years pulled  she is the only dentist that ever didn't prescribe meds for my pain until antibiotic could take affect.she said in about three days it feel better.Three days is lot  of hurting considering all my days before this. I will not come back.

name: Sarah Payne
text: Long wait time. After I was called back, I was put into another waiting room for another hour. X-rays was another wait. The dentist even said the woman taking the pictures should have been able to do it better. I was told there wouldn't be a fee because of my dental coverage then they tell me it'll be 50 dollars before my cleaning. I ask "for what?" And they reply fluoride and toothpaste. I've never been charged for fluoride at any other dentist office and a fee for toothpaste? I said that I didn't want either then. Then the clerk says she has to go ask the dentist if I don't have to purchase toothpaste. Thankfully she says they said it was fine if I didn't. Got my cleaning, then left. Will not be back.

name: Shavannah Sanivan
text: Just don't do it! Seriously! The office is dazzling and the people may be nice enough, but their company policies are for the birds. They give you a quote for services to be rendered and say what we quote is what you pay...but then you get billed for "things insurance didn't cover" just to see if they can get more money out of you. If you call them on it, you don't have to pay and they will write it off. The whole operation is just shady.

name: Tate Nance
text: Don't recommend at all. They care more about their "consultations" where they try to pressure you into buying completely unnecessary stuff, such as a $150+ toothbrush, than providing intimate dental care. The "dentist" does more sales pitches than actual dental work. Not to mention she isn't very friendly. Aspen just wants to drain your wallet. Find a family-owned, local practice instead of these corporate salesmen.

resp.text:
I'm sorry you didn’t have a positive experience, Tate. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and I would really appreciate the opportunity to speak with you. If you would like, you can call me directly at
844-296-0187 EXT 201152. - Julie, ADMI

name: Danette Wilson
text: I went yesterday for my first root canal. I was very nervous . The staff, and especially Dr. May, put me at ease, talked to me, and explained everything in detail.  When she told me she was finished,  i couldn't believe it! It was so simple and painless. I had no pain, and woke up today not even feeling discomfort. I recommend Dr. May and Aspen Dental to everyone, especially those who struggle with anxiety at the dentist,  like me!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing,! I’m so glad that you felt comfortable with the team, and I hope that you find it easier to continue letting us help with your dental needs.  — Dawn, ADMI

name: Brooke Copeland
text: first of all we were there for four hours it was our first visit and was just an initial visit. After my daughter was taken back she was treated rude and talk to you like she was nothing. That would ask her a question and interrupt her in the middle of her trying to answer it. But back to the dentist as far as they go I believe this is where all the title loans and the Advance Cash payment check stores have went to. My daughter's teeth are fine she needed a cleaning and 1 filling before she was getting her braces put on and instead of going to our normal dentist we decided to just get it done faster and go to Aspen Dental. Worst mistake ever all they want is money money money. My daughter's teeth are fine she brushes twice a day she goes to the dentist on a regular basis. They told her she had gum disease and needed to have a gum debrilement before she could even have a cleaning done. It was going to cost us $1,400 And we have the best dental insurance you can get. We get free cleanings and free X-rays and free fillings it's good insurance. These people are quacks and are money hungry and all they want is to charge you for stuff you don't need.

name: Emmalee Keef
text: I got text from this office on 12/27/19 that my appointment was at 10:00 I live 45 minutes away from Gadsden. We drove all the way down here to see a paper on the door that says they are closed. Which also we had a appointment to fix the problem yesterday and they didn’t fix the problem with a hour and a half long visit.

name: Lea Johnson
text: I had the best experience ever! They were so amazing! I had an appointment for Monday the 10th, but came in because I was experiencing TERRIBLE tooth pain. They fit me right in and Dr. Singh made sure I was completely comfortable before my procedure and wouldn't let me leave until I wasn't in pain anymore! He explained the procedure in detail and was very helpful! Very gentle dentist! The staff was very helpful and patient. They stayed an hour over closing time to give my root canal. I love Aspen Dental of Gadsden and will continue to go there!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Lea. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. The office will be so happy to read this.  — Kelly, ADMI

name: Cassie Rhodes
text: This is one of the best dentist offices that I have been to. If you don't have lots of money, no worries. They will work with you and allow you to make payments. Jamie, the lady who handles the financial part of the business is a sweetheart. She was so thorough and patient with me and all my questions. I learned that I am in the early stages of periodontal disease. The dental hygienist, Renae, worked through her lunch break to perform a periodontal treatment on me because I told her it was VERY important that I had it done before the next week. The dentist, listen, you will read reviews saying that she's rude, etc. My goodness, here in the south we tend to be big babies. She isn't rude, at all. She's just very professional and straight to the point. I am sure that she never intended to come across as rude to anyone that's just how she may seem but NOT rude, by any means. I, also, read a lot of reviews where people complained that they tried to force them to buy a toothbrush or only cared to make money. I have a feeling that all of these people, unfortunately, misunderstood a lot. They, too, told me about a certain type of toothbrush and gave me a pamphlet on it. There is nothing wrong with feeling strongly about a toothbrush. Electric toothbrushes clean your teeth and gums far more thoroughly than one that is not. I am sure that the dental hygenist, who recommended the toothbrush to me, doesn't pocket a dime for the people who purchase the toothbrushes. Please don't be misinformed or mislead by other reviews. Give them a try. I am recommending them to you, just like they were recommended to me by a coworker. I will be going back to Aspen Dental! :-)

resp.text: I'm so glad the team helped you have a positive experience, Cassie. I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Julie, ADMI

name: Patrick Brown
text:
As soon as I walked in this newer facility, the employees from the front desk attendant to the young lady who did the X-rays made me feel welcomed and glad I made the decision to come there. Ms. Catherine took her time to study my films and make out a plan that would benefit me the most for my dental health.
From Courtney to the district manager they all made me feel at ease.
I have to go back and comment to the X-ray girl. She had a very jovial disposition and had a very professional attitude while making my visit welcoming.
They set up a working plan to correct my issues while taking my time into consideration which is always a big plus to a working person.
In closing, I would recommend Aspen to anyone looking for a dentist and a place that makes you feel at ease and important as well

resp.text: That's so nice to hear, Patrick. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: Kym Maxwell
text: EVERY member of the staff from the dental assistant to the dentist to the office manager were amazing. I have EXTREME anxiety about the dentist, and they could tell, so they did everything they could to help put me at ease. There was one worker named Sonya and she was ABSOLUTELY wonderful, she was so kind and went above her duty to calm me down. I would HIGHLY recommend Aspen Dental to anyone.

name: Marty Jacobs
text: My experience here at Aspen dental was as pleasant as any dentist appt could be. The entire staff is friendly, informative, and not the least bit judgmental.  Everyone made me feel comfortable despite my anxiety, and I would highly recommend them (and have already) to my friends and family. Also the costs are significantly lower than other places I've checked especially without insurance, and they are more than willing to help you in any way possible.  I actually can't wait to go back!

resp.text: It makes me so happy to hear that, Martha. I'm glad you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have positive experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: David Dixon
text: I went as a new patient. I was in pain from a broken tooth. They got me in on the day after I called. I did sit in waiting room for an hour on an 7:15 appointment time, but at least they got me in. They did a complete X-ray and tooth evaluation on all of my teeth. I left there still in pain, but with some scripts for meds to help with the pain. I have another appointment for next week. I hope it doesn’t hurt until then. Thanks for getting me in on short notice as a new patient.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know, David! We’ll be sure to pass this along. — Dawn, ADMI

name: michelle Dozier
text: If I could leave NO stars I would.  I visited this location about a year and a half ago and everything was fine.  Had initial appointment where they did Xrays and evaluation and then had four teeth pulled the next day.  Was way overcharged compared to other dentists in the area, but because they were able to extend a credit line I paid the over priced services for relief from tooth pain with little money out of pocket.  Fast forward to today.  I have severe tooth pain that has had me away all night. I called at 7:30 this morning and the lady that took my call offered me appointments starting at 7:45 (which was the earliest appointment and I took it), and then just about every 15 mins increments after that for the rest of the day.  When we got to my name and information, she stated I was already in their system and would need to call back when the office opened to schedule my appointment.  I just called to schedule the appointment and they can not see me until late afternoon. I asked the lady could they not see me this morning, that I was in a lot of pain and had been up all night and she said no, that 2:30 was the earliest they could see me.  So I questioned why "new" patients could be seen as early as 7:45 am and every 15 mins forward, and walk in patients as their website says, can be seen this morning, but existing patients who have already spent a LOT of money with them are not able to be seen until later in the day.  She had no answer other then that is the earliest I could be seen.  Not to mention, even though it has only been a year and a half, I have to do all the exam and Xrays all over again just like a new patient, would not be treated that day for what was hurting and  would have to schedule another appointment to have any work done after the initial appointment.  So this place wants to charge me to complete new patient services, however does not want to give me new patient scheduling times.  I was willing to pay their ridiculous costs because I still have $3000 in credit with their finance company, but I refuse to sit her in pain all day while they schedule new patients in front of me............   Terrible, awful and ungrateful staff and services. Will not recommend and will advise everyone I know against them.

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration. Please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201706, so I can assist you with this — Dawn, ADMI

name: Jessica Harp
text: My visit was pleasant and more informative than any other dentist's office has been. I've had some horrible experiences with other dental offices and Aspen Dental is the dental office that is now repairing and fixing the horrible dental work I've received in my past. My first visit I received more xrays and examination than I've ever received elsewhere. They are very thorough and take the time to explain all of your options to you. The lady dentist I spoke with was so helpful in helping me make the right choice for the dental work that I need to have done.

resp.text: Thank you, Jessica, for sharing this outstanding informaton! I will be sure to pass it along! Tammy ADMI

name: Kaci Watts
text: My visit here was nothing short of uncomfortable and unprofessional. I arrived early for my appointment with my new patient paperwork, dental insurance card and valid I.D. in hand when I arrived. My appointment was scheduled for 7 a.m. and I was not called back until 7:40. After my exam the office manager told me they wouldn't be able to clean my teeth that day that I'd have to reschedule after my appointment was for a cleaning. Fast forward to the check out process and the office manager informed me for 2 fillings and a cleaning would cost me $370.00 (this is with my dental insurance) well turns out the only thing I would actually owe would be right at $60.00!!!! They tried charging me $135 for a toothbrush and $52.00  cancer screening I never even asked for! Very rude and inconsiderate of your time!!

name: Mary Harper
text: This is the worse dental place I have ever been to.. You get over charged for everything. I looked at the papers they have me and they charged me 3 and 4 times for the same thing, then told me that the teeth cleaning is charged for each quadrant of my teeth. This was never explained to me and I have never been to a dentist that charged that way, they did the same thing that other dentist do, and charged me for each quadrant of my teeth, said I had a gum disease, my gums are pushed up over my enamel on my teeth caused from me over brushing them, and brushing them the wrong way,, I did this when I was a child and brushed my teeth 8 to 10 times a day, because my Mom's teeth were so bad and I have seen her in so much pain from bad teeth, so I was over brushing my teeth. I was told that everything would be charged through Genesis Credit, I got a card from the credit company and never activated it... But they don't tell you that the charges are for your first visit only.. Then get the bill and for the few things they did my bill was $1013 and some change.. I went to only get a filling done on a tooth and the dentist was drilling out my tooth that needed filled and kept bouncing off my tooth he was drilling on and kept bouncing off my tooth and hitting a tooth behind the one he was working on, so now I have the tooth he kept hitting with the drill that has to be filled.. I was suppose to go back to get my 2nd cleaning and I was told I would have to pay them in cash for it, then found out that it had already been charged on the credit company, so there they thought they were going to get paid twice,, so Aspen Dental was going to make you pay 2 times for the same thing, as they did on my bill... I was told that the special mouth rinse and special toothpaste was included with the Oral B toothbrush kit, and looked on my papers and was charged 3 and 4 times each for the mouth rinse and toothpaste.. This is the worse dental place I have ever been to... And I have called the Customers Care line and am told they would have someone call me by tomorrow, I have been told this for several times, and the ones that call me tell me to call back if they haven't called me within 2 days, to call them back.. I have been calling them since right after I had my dental appointment and got the paperwork on all the charges and I almost fell over,, I was lied to by the employees, the dentist, and customer care... This is ridiculous... Aspen Dental is a ripoff.. Everyone I have talked to that has been there has nothing good to say about Aspen Dental in Gadsden Alabama.. I have tried to get this straighten out about being overcharged on what was done, and am always told if you don't hear back from me in 2 days, to call back, I have been doing this for months, and they have done nothing to resolve this problem... So my advice to everyone that is bringing about going to Aaron Dental in Gadsden Alabama DON'T USE THEM, THEY ARE CROOKS!!!!!!!...This is the sorriest place I have ever been to... I'm trying to get this straighten out or I'm going to turn them in to the Better Business Bureau, and see if they can do something about them!!!!!!

text: I made an appointment for getting cosmetic dental work done,  which would be a cash transaction.  On the day of the appointment,  I received a text saying that the appointment was canceled. I'm sitting here with cash business and can't get seen. This is a bad sign for me; i am taking my business elsewhere

name: Konnie Taylor
text: Came in knowing I had several cavities that would need to be filled. Was seen fairly quickly and the cavities confirmed but told I have an infection that needs to be treated before the fillings. Left with an estimate but no antibiotics, cleaning or fillings. I came out no better than I went in. Really was actually a waste of two hours of my day to be honest. I won't be returning.

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration Konnie. I am sorry the team did not address your concern and should have explained our new patient visit. Our new patient appointment includes x-rays and full comprehensive exam with the doctor and hygienist, to determine and discuss any treatment that may be needed. If you need any additional care in the future or would like to discuss the care plan you had received during your last visit, we’d still be happy to help. You can reach me directly at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526. — Kelly, ADM

name: Logan Holfelder
text: Great people, the day I went was little busy which probably explains why i was there from 7-10. They were only able to do my cleaning and had to reschedule my filling due to them closing at 12.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Logan, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Darlene Harcrow
text: The staff was GREAT, BUT the price was ASTRONOMICAL!!!!  The price I was quoted with my insurance was $6400 and that was without a partial.  I went to another local dentist in the area and with the price of a partial with my insurance, my out of pocket cost is $710. Apple to Apple comparison,  The only thing different was the local dentist was only pulling one wisdom tooth and repairing one of the other ones, the other 2 were perfectly fine with no cavities, but Aspen wanted to pull them all.  And Aspen quoted doing an entire deep clean on my mouth with 21 day round of permanent antibiotics in my gum, NOT, and the other dentist said it looked like only one quadrant may need to be deep cleaned but that because of a bad tooth in that quadrant, you could get a false reading, so we needed to pull that one and then access the deep cleaning at my next cleaning.  Was told by the local dentist that my teeth were in good condition just needed some cavities filled and 2 teeth pulled.    So great staff or not, the money difference is not worth the visit.

name: Rachel Bobbitt
text: Everyone was very nice, caring and considerate. Nice, clean and comfortable setting. The only negative thing I can think of is how long we were there. I would still return and refer others to Aspen Dental in Gadsden, Alabama.

text: Just front desk people. The rest is much better.

text: This office insists every consultation was free. We have to see dentist to get a price on dentures. They lie to you!!!!!

text: Just want to start by saying these people only want your money. This facility is very new and clearly they need to meet there quota to pay it off. Ok, fair enough I use to smoke so it happens. So I proceed to allow them to do the procedure but wait first I had to pay $180 before I could have any treatment which to my understanding was suppose to cover everything and my insurance cover the rest. Then we go on. They say one of my back teeth js decaying and needs to be uprooted. I allow it to happen because I had bothered me for years. In the most of pulling the tooth the dentist breaks the bone off that holds the tooth in process of pulling it. I told him multiple times before pulling it that I would soon be getting braces and I didn't want that to affect it. Well now that has caused issue with getting braces. So on, I have cavities. A total different dentist is doing this procedure days later. He and the women helping carried on the whole time and was more focused on there conversation than fixing my Cavaties. That being said he didn't fill the tooth the complete way so now I have sensitivity for sweet hot and cold things. The other day I get a bill from them. $172 it was. Going back to the gym disease. I had to "pay everything up front" before I could have the procedure done right. At least that's what the lady said. I just got off the phone with them. They begin to tell me the bill is only $126.??? So why did I get billed $50 more than that. Or better question why am I even being billed period when I supposedly had to pay everything that my insurance didn't cover up front.??? Absolute worst experience and place to go. Don't waste your time or your money.

text:
Had to go get new dentures somewhere else because they DO NOT GUARANTEE their services!   My dentures from them are horrendous.  Every time I went in it was said they supposed to look like that.  No they do not my new ones fit perfect!!!!
My new dentures sit inside the ones from tooth masters they were so big and didn’t fit. I have had them 10 months
They will not refund or fix them.  I got a certified letter stating they do not guarantee their services on dentures.    What company doesn’t guarantee their work?   The dental board will be called.  She tried to put white stuff all on it to just try to put a bandaids on it.   The roof of the denture as u can see her s big as a dime.  I kept choking  I’m so very disappointed

THIS IS WRONG ON SO MANY LEVELS

The smile of just my teeth are my new dentures.

After being told by my Primary Physician what damaged teeth can make you sick, I took that step. The staff provided a wonderful service, with great care. I'm constantly told by others, what beautiful teeth I have; the best part, they don't know there dentures. Also, their prices can't be matched.

text:
From the time I walk I walked through the door you had a good feeling.
First of all let me tell you that I am scared to death of dentist.  But Kelly will put all that to ease.  She will tell you step by step what is going on, what she is fixing to do. She even tells you what Dr. Drace is doing what he is about to. This way you know what to expect how bad it's going to hurt or not. You are not left in the dark about anything. She is a great comforter too. I am 59 years old and it was like I was a child in there. That's not how I was treated that is how I felt . Dr. Drace is awesome.  He is very gentle and you don't feel rushed with him.  I cannot say enough great things about this facility. Giving it a 5 is not good enough.  It needs to be given a big gold medal.

text: We were coming in from out of town and my crown snapped on my front tooth. They worked me in and even saw me early since we got into town earlier than expected. name: Randy Wedel
text: I was in Gulf Shores on a family vacation and chipped a tooth. Concerned that I might have cracked the tooth I searched for a local dental practice that could help in a hurry. Thanks to Google reviews I lucked out and found Dr Edwards and Doctor Long. I was in the chair quickly and Dr Long did a thorough evaluation and gave me three options. Since I was there I chose to have the tooth repaired. 20 quick minutes I was fixed and on the way back to the beach. Painless, professional, and very kind. Also thanks to Lu Lu for scheduling me in so quickly and assisting in the procedure. I can assure you If I lived in the area, these would be my dentists. Thanks again Dr Long

resp.text: Randy, we so appreciate the 5 STAR review!  Here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry we try to accommodate our emergencies so that they may enjoy their vacations!  We hope you had a great time at the beach!

name: Aubrey Bianco
text: The women at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry are kind, caring, and very professional. The office space is beautiful and clean, and they take responsible COVID precautions to keep everyone as safe as possible. They all had my best interest at heart during procedures, whether that was a simple teeth cleaning or tooth filling. Dr. Mary was even willing to fit me in for an additional filling the same day, even if that meant cutting her lunch a little short....oh, and not to mention, that was on all on her birthday!! I recommend these ladies to anyone and everyone visiting the island or living here full time!

resp.text: Thank you Aubrey for the sweet review:)  We appreciate you as a patient here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry and glad we can help!

name: Matt Mcclane
text: Absolutely amazing family of dentists. Always polite and very helpful have always got me right in especially if it’s an emergency I drive over an hour to see them every time. The only dentists I will use.

name: Sue Ann B
text: I would give them 10 stars if I could 😀!  I called with an emergency when I broke my tooth and they were able to get me in.  Everyone in the office was so kind and caring.  Kim took the time to explain everything they were going to do and stayed with me through the entire process.  Dr. Long was amazing and one of the best dentist I have ever been to!  She was able to repair my tooth and made sure I was comfortable during the procedure.  I would highly recommend them!  They represent the best of the best of Gulf Shores!

resp.text: Thank you so much Sue Ann! It was a pleasure to treat you here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Pat Nadolski
text: My husband and I spend winters in Gulf Shores.  On New Year’s Day I broke a molar and was very concerned about finding a dentist.  No worries, we were able to make an emergency appointment to see Dr. Mary.  What a positive experience!  Everyone was professional and best of all friendly, showing a genuine interest in getting to know a little about me personally.  I highly recommend this practice.  We will definitely return here for all of our dental needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, we enjoy having you as a patient here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Shelly Sharkey
text: An awful experience. Easily spent 45 mins in Dr Pamela Edwards office without ever even speaking to the doctor and basically just lectured at and sent away with no resolution. Called a different dentist the same day and within a week, my daughter has had a full exam, xrays and multiple apts completed and has her front teeth fixed and her smile back, which everyone deserves. I was just dumbfounded that the doctor wouldn’t even come out of her personal office to speak to us as a new patient in her office, and the condescending treatment by her assistant or hygienist or whoever she was, was mind blowing.  Let alone the issues to even get an appointment scheduled in the first place and then it was the “wrong type” appointment I was informed when we arrived. Don’t worry about my too complicated daughters case Dr. Edwards, it was easily resolved by another Dentist willing to take the time.

resp.text: Hi Shelly, We would like to apologize for your negative experience. We’re normally known for our exceptional patient care, and we regret that we missed the mark. My name is Bryan and I am the office manager. If you’d like to discuss this further, please contact me at (251) 500-1025 so we can work toward making this right.

name: Glenda Sickles
text: This dentistry office is incredible.  I'm a Snowbird in Gulf Shores, Alabama and had a bridge fall out.  Away from home with a dental problem...what to do?  Family Dentistry has an ad in the local paper that they  love winter guests and accept emergencies.  I was both!!  They gave me an appointment the next day, took impressions, pulled a tooth and in three weeks I had a new bridge.  Dr. Mary Edwards-Long is kind, compassionate, and all procedures were pain-free.  She is friendly and we visited like old friends.  Her assistants, Kim 1 and Kim 2, were equally caring and efficient.  The whole office was careful with Covid 19 practices in place.  I can highly recommend this dentistry office!

resp.text: Thank you so much Glenda for the stellar 5 star review!  We so enjoyed having you as a patient this winter here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry  and hope you stop by to say hello when you return next winter!

name: Jane Randolph
text: It was a great experience from scheduling an appointment to the actual visit. The entire staff was welcoming, they explained everything from treatment to cost. I am so glad I found them. This is one dental experience that I left feeling good about coming back.

resp.text: Wow, thank you so much Jane for the kind review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry!  We look forward to seeing you in the future:)

name: Amie McCully
text:
I am astounded by the absolutely stellar care & treatment I received from Dr. Edwards as well as her entire team. I have put off much needed dental work for years and am so grateful to be following through with this office.

I felt beyond at ease during my appointments which involve receiving crowns; all of my interactions with everyone apart of this team has far exceeded all of my expectations.

I am especially grateful for their professional/gentle/educational approach; very thankful for all their assistance in working with our confusing insurance issues!

I highly recommend Dr. Edwards and her excellent team; looking forward to their services in the future.  So happy to finally having all of my teeth & maintaining my smile!

resp.text: Wow Amie!  We so appreciate the awesome review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry!

name: Heather Jajeh
text: Love coming here! Dr. Pamela and Dr. Mary are excellent and love what they do. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Heather and we look forward to seeing you all again:)

name: Taylor Means
text: Dr. Mary and the entire staff at Dr. Pamela Edwards Family Dentistry are fantastic. Anytime visitors to our area need an emergency dentist visit, I recommend them and they always come through. Just yesterday, I had a major tooth ache and they worked me in immediately. Problem solved and feeling great! Thanks Dr. Mary!

resp.text: Thank you Taylor for the awesome google review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry and so happy you're feeling better!

name: Derek
text:
The absolute most reliable, friendly, and efficient dentist and staff you’ll not just find in Gulf Shores, but in Alabama. Period.

Doctor Mary, Kat, Brian (and the entire team) fixed my teeth and made my cosmetic experience actually enjoyable. They also made me feel great about myself, so I can’t thank them enough. The best in the biz.

resp.text: Thank you, we look forward to seeing you again.

name: Tamoya Thompson
text: If I could rate their office more than a 5 star, I absolutely would. I had a cleaning done and 2 fillings last week, and it was such a great experience. Nobody describes having to get a filling as a great experience, but from the minute you are greeted upon entrance right through the dental process was just absolutely great service right through. I would recommend here to anyone. Both Dr. Edwards's are amazing and their wonderful staff. I have more dental work to get done and I don't  plan on going anywhere else but here!! Thank you guys a million times!!

resp.text: Thank you, hope to see you soon here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry .

name: Carol Fountain
text: It was last Friday I saw Dr Mary Edwards. I was in a lot of pain from a problem tooth and my regular dentist was not open on Friday..Dr Edwards was a God-send to me. I was able to get in to see her right away and she and her staff were able to determine my problem, refer me to specialist , and give me an antibiotic prescription to get me by until I could be seen by my regular dentist in 4 days. Her office is warm and welcoming and I would switch dentists if my insurance would let me. Cannot say enough good things about the whole experience.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry .

name: Betty Kelley
text:
Came to Gulf Shores for family vacation.  First family drama was my bridge falling out.
I also have a terrible fear of dentists.  Thank goodness for Dr. Edwards.  They had me fixed by 10 am Monday morning.  They could not have nicer, more professional and caring.  I wish she was in my hometown. Dr. Edwards and her staff are the best!

resp.text: Thank you so much, we are here if you need us again at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Dana Given
text:
Just came from my first visit at Dr. Edwards office. Everyone was great; from the initial appointment phone call two days ago;  to check in today (even when there was a glitch with my insurance); to X-rays, teeth cleaning, and follow up with Dr. Edwards.

Very professional and friendly staff; respectful with the glitch - which got resolved while I was in the dentist chair; gentle and thorough dental care.

It’s always scary trying to find a new dentist when you relocate - but I can highly recommend this office - whose entire staff obviously cares about their patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.

name: Kathlene Smith
text: If you need an emergency crown replacement as I did,  this is the place to go! this is a family strong dental business and they treated us like family as well!  Thank you for your excellent service and care!

resp.text: Thank you so much Kathlene!  You are part of the Edwards Family now and we hope y'all have a wonderful trip!

name: Judi Farmer
text: I’m from out of town and went in for emergency help. Dr. Mary treated me and she is awesome! She diagnosed a cracked tooth and treated me on the spot. Dr. Mary and her staff were super caring. They even gave me a piece of king cake and a box of valentine chocolates when I left. What a super family team!

resp.text: Judi, we so appreciate the kind review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry !  You are part of the Edwards Family:)

name: Edward Williams
text: I was on vacation with my family when I chipped a tooth. Started thinking of a good story to tell my friends about how it happened. My wife said to call around to see if anyone could fix it. Dr. Edwards and her staff fit me in that day! Prices were fair and the doctor was fantastic. I was walking out smiling. Would recommend to anyone needing emergency or cosmetic treatment!

resp.text:
Dear Edward,

We are so happy we were able to help you in your time of need!  It was a pleasure to meet you and  your family.  We hope the rest of your vacation was wonderful and please stop by to say hello to us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry whenever you are back in the area!

name: Sarah Halford
text: We are visiting the area and my husband was incorrectly diagnosed by the minor med clinic after a week and 2 visits.  Dr Mary and her staff were able to see him right away, discover the real problem and get him on the road to recovery. The whole staff were knowledgeable and very caring. We will highly recommend their office to others.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Jash Yotes
text:
The Edwards run a fantastic dental practice - whether it's locals or out-of-towners with dental emergencies.

Pamela and Mary so thoughtful, intelligent, and excellent at making patients feel welcome & cared for.

They're great with locals, (I'm one, ha!) but they've really distinguished themselves in what they're willing to do to accommodate all the visitors that we have in town with their dental emergencies. (And are the FIRST to tell folks on the phone that they need to go elsewhere [like the emergency room] if the problem sounds like a medical priority.)

Anyone on the fence should feel excellent about trusting the Edwards. They're a great, skilled, family run practice that are going to look out for their patients' best interest first.

Love you guys!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.

name: Kinsley Lively
text: Such a wonderful experience!! I’m usually a little nervous about dentist appointments but the staff here was so welcoming and friendly. Dr. Edwards, the younger one, was so knowledgeable about my concerns (wisdom teeth coming in) and Star did a phenomenal job cleaning my teeth!! Pearly whites for the win! 😁

resp.text: Thank you, hope to see you again here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Mike M
text:
I like to just say this is the best and most friendly dentist 🦷 office around
I just had work done and very professional
People 5 stars if I could give 10 stars I would
Highly recommended !!
They have a 24 hour emergency service if needed
Sincerely
Mike

resp.text: Dear Mike, Thank you so much for the kind review!  We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Vincent Odom
text: This office was great.  They worked with my crazy schedule to get me seen and their rates were very reasonable.  On top of that, their staff was very personable and polite.  I definitely recommend this dental office.

resp.text: Thank you, let us know if you need our service again here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: kristin kilborn
text: Wonderful and friendly staff. Just moved to the area and I have found my dentist. I must say I was a little nervous and they put my mind at ease!!

resp.text: Thank you Kristin for the awesome review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry and please let us know if you need anything!

name: Kirk Flowers
text: Had a tooth that my dentist at home had been monitoring for the last few check ups. In the first week of my winter vacation, it broke off. Got an appointment the next day with Dr Edwards and 7 days later, she installed a crown. It feels great. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry . We really appreciate your support.

name: Rachel Pody
text: A great lady dentist that is caring, fun, and funny. I was very happy with my visit. Dr. Mary Edwards  was extremely professional, skilled and friendly. The office was very clean, modern, and at the same time felt like a home; which is a huge plus. On my first visit which was an emergency I could tell that the staff cared and I wasn't just another patient but a human being that was in pain, and they empathized with me and wanted to help me(Very different than one of my visits to a different dentist in town). They even took the time to make small talk with me. Every visit since then has been great. Strongly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the lovely google review Rachel of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry!

name: onakay
text: Amazing service! So family friendly, patient, and genuine. I was unable to get work done due to the fact that they don't accept Medicaid, but their excellent service honestly made up for it! When I get official dental health coverage, I will certainly be returning 💕💕

resp.text: Thank you! Can't wait to see you again here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Thomas Francis
text: Great experience! I am a snowbird who broke/cracked two molars with very old large fillings. I was able to get a same day appointment with Dr Edwards. She conducted a thorough examination and we had a frank discussion about courses of action. I chose to have two crowns. Within a week I had two new crowns. Dr Edwards and her staff were polite, professional, and extremely competent. I would and have recommend Dr Edwards.

resp.text: Thank you for the lovely google review Mr. Francis of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry!

name: Whitney Day
text: This will definitely be my go to dentist from now on! I had an awful toothache and they got me right in and the very next week got me in for a cleaning! The staff is so sweet and personable and made me feel completely at ease!

resp.text: Thank you and thank you for the referral to us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry!

name: Jennifer Farris
text: Amazing staff and wonderful doctor. Was there on vacation and I had recently had a root canal done at home before going on vacation. I had extreme pain for the last few days of my trip.  I called to see if they could work me in, they got me in immediately.  Turned out the molar behind the tooth I had the root canal in was cracked.  Since I was leaving the next day it would be nearly impossible to fix the tooth, since I needed it crowned.  They took care of me the best they could and sent their findings to my dentist back home.  I would highly recommend this practice!!!  Thank you so much Dr. Edwards!!!

resp.text: Thank you Jennifer for the review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Aaron Frazier
text: On vacation and dental emergency day one. We called Dr Edwards office and they worked us in as if we were regular patients. They saved the rest  of ourvacation once we realized an abscess tooth causing the issue! Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thank you so much, we are here if you need us again at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

name: Holly Howell
text: What a wonderful staff!  Professional, courteous and were very understanding to my fear of the dentist.  The work  I have had done on my teeth has been phenomenal.  I recommend Dr Edwards to everyone.

resp.text: Thank you for he kind review of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry , you're so kind.

name: Betty Myrick
text: I can't say enough about this Dentist.  Dr. Mary Edwards is awesome, as well as her staff!!!!! I broke a tooth in half with exposed nerves while vacationing over Fall break.  I am so thankful God led me to this team!  I have a fear of dentists from childhood and an even bigger fear of needles.  They got me right in as were were being evacuated from hurricane Michael!  The staff treated me with "kid" gloves and pampered me.  Dr. Edwards made sure I would experience no pain and for that I was very Thankful!!!!!  The secretary helped my husband book a hotel as I was being treated.   I just can't say enough about this team!  Thank you all so much!!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the lovely google review Betty of us here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry !

name: Allayna Duffy
text: I've never left a review before, but this dentist truly deserves one! The staff was incredibly friendly and as a young adult, going to a doctor for the first time alone, they made me feel so comfortable and welcome! The next morning I even received a phone call from the dentist to see how I was feeling. Absolutely amazing!

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming in. We are always here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry if you need us. Good luck with college.

name: Local Guy
text: Go somewhere else where the doctor actually has time speak with you and look at your teeth. Receptionist was very nice. No communication . Already booking appointments elsewhere in Foley. Wasn't happy they wrote me painkiller script to try and  get me out the door. Not happy at all about experience.

resp.text:
Hi Local Guy,

Thanks for your feedback however, we are unable to verify any of the information you have described nor can we locate your name in our patient database.

We take customer feedback very seriously so if you could contact our manager directly at mrstoothdoc@hotmail.com so we can resolve this issue as a matter of urgency.

Many thanks

name: courtney west
text: I am on vacation and had a tooth break and needed emergency care. Not only did they get me in immediately but they were so fast, efficient and  friendly! Highly recommend going here if you live here or if you need taken care of while visiting. This office is the best they really made this stressful time so much easier! Thank you

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star review. We really appreciate your support here at Dr. Pamela Edwards Dentistry.

text: Came here to fix a broken tooth and they did the best work. The staff was great from the first time that I called till the end. Got everything done quick and perfect. They also followed up to see how I was doing after my visits. Highly recommended.

text: Everyone including the dentist was very friendly and nice. I didn't have to wait long for an appointment and I  had NO PAIN ! The dentist was very gentle and considerate. She stopped several times to check on my comfort and even got me a pillow for my neck. I highly recommend this office!

text:

The work performed was great and I never had any pain after I left there, I would recommend them to anyone, local or not local, very nice and professional.
Thank you,
Glenn Terry.

text: My son chopped out his front front tooth when was running in house. In 3 days Dr. Dean put the segment of tooth back to its place. Now we even can't say which tooth was broken. It's great job!!

name: dona fowler
text: Went for my semi-annual cleaning, was like going to visit family. Dean Dental, is by far the best in this area. And if you happen to come on the day I'm there you can't beat the entertainment provided by Mary Beth and me! I try not to see Dr Dean, cause if I am, that means he's drilling on my teeth, and I'm freaking out. But I'll tell you a little secret, he does very good at keeping my nerves settled by talking calmly to me, and drilling as little as possible. Try Dean Dental, you won't be sorry.

name: chuck crick
text: I love Dr. Dean and all of his staff..very professional, always friendly !! I highly recommend  Dr. Dean !!

text: Had to get a molar removed. 1 star on that. The staff was friendly, Dr Dean was very knowledgeable and skilled, so that makes up for everything else. I got a call the next day from the Dr, checking up on me and making sure I was ok, and that's awesome. Thank you Dr Dean and staff, for making a miserable procedure a smooth and professional experience.

name: Bryan Taylor
text: I have been going to Dr. Dean for years, the staff is very courteous and professional and my appointment is always on time. I have to pre-med before each visit and I always get a reminder. The office is close to work, in research park, and most convenient. Try Dr. Dean, you won't regret it.

name: Shantel Ervin
text: As a cancer warrior, I have had my share of doctors appointments, treatments, surgical procedures and more. Because of this my pain threshold is high so if I say something hurts it really hurts. My previous dental office was aware of this yet the hygienist chose to ignore the pain I was experiencing. After speaking with the office manager I decided I would not complete my appointment and later called back and canceled any further treatment with that practice. I called my insurance company and located the office of a previous dentist that I loved and I am so glad I did. I called Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace and even the interaction over the phone was pleasant. Whitney was able to schedule me an appointment quickly and educated me on the processes and procedures and what to expect. I could hear her smile through the phone. The day of my appointment, the entire staff was absolutely wonderful! As a new patient for the practice I knew I would have paperwork and would probably be there for a while but as soon as I finished my paperwork my hygienist was waiting for me. Chelsey greeted me with smiling eyes (she had on her mask), explained the process in depth and after reviewing my x-rays she recommended the best next step to help with my issues. She listened and made sure to understand what I was experiencing and throughout my appointment she made sure the process was not causing too much pain. With tender swollen gums pain is to be expected however if the hygienist knows what they are doing the patient will experience minimal pain. Chelsey knows what she is doing! She took a potentially mouth throbbing, tears running uncomfortable situation and made it a pleasant and educational experience. I went in with my mouth feeling awful and because of what Chelsey did my teeth feel so much better. Because I am a cancer warrior my teeth and gums have gone through some major changes. Chemo, radiation and long term medication has caused damage that I thought was going to take radical treatment to repair but Chelsey explained how to minimize further damage and what to do to get me on a path of recovery. She was absolutely amazing! I highly recommend Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace, you will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Wow to that wonderful review!  We are so happy to hear about your great experience with us!  We will pass these sweet words you shared on to the staff and especially let Chelsey and Whitney know :)

name: Colleen Sauls
text: Let me save some of you the trouble. They use Transworld System collection agency when Tonya makes a mistake with your treatment plan and tells you your insurance will pay half and you pay the other half ($560) and then it turns out TONYA read it wrong but expects the patient to pay for her mistake you will get turned over to a collection agency! I liked Dr. Bentley and was very disappointed she let her office manager get away with dirty office practices, so I had no other choice but to find another dentist for my son and I. Tonya wouldn’t let me speak to Dr. Bentley she twisted what happened to fit her narrative and let Dr.Bentley think they were doing me a favor by cutting the bill in half when all along Tonya knows this is on her! And she sent a $240 bill to collections on a procedure that wasn’t even done correctly (we were told my son didn’t need a crown turns out he did but because of Tonyas error reading our policy which is her job by the way we never went back to Dr.Bentley after getting a $500 bill in the mail no phone call Tonya knew I would be upset and she knew exactly what she told me) and the tooth had to be extracted after all of that! So NO  I do not recommend you go there! Not because of Dr. Bentley but because you cannot trust Tonya to do your insurance and billing correctly! Do you have an extra $1000.00  laying around when you get a surprise bill from Tonya? When I asked Tonya why she didn’t catch that the insurance wouldn’t cover that procedure she said to me well neither did you! Wow!! Tonya claimed to have gotten an approval for the procedure when all along root canals weren’t covered within the first year of coverage (so that was a lie to cover her mistake) I would have thought an office manager and the person who is supposed to verify insurance would check that first thing! I have never had this happen before over 30 years of taking myself and 2 kids to the dentist! So there you have it! Chelsea & Jennifer are great though!

resp.text: So sorry Colleen that there was any issue with your time with us at Bryant dental.  Unfortunately with insurance they always have the disclaimer that it is an estimate and not a guarantee of payment.  As a courtesy we strive to help our patients by handling all the dental billing rather than collecting all payments up front for procedures creating the hassle for the patient to handle all billing to his or her own insurance.  It's a partnership where we rely on what the insurance provides us and what the insurance provides to the patient about their own coverage.  We definitely do our best on our end to try to gather all the information about waiting periods, missing tooth clauses and percentages covered.  We will look into your account and see what happened in your situation.  Once again we apologize you had anything but the best experience with us!

name: Jeffrey Smith
text: Just returned from having a root canal at the Huntsville office..Terrible experience...assistant didn't introduce herself so I couldn't tell you her name or the dentist because he didn't either (when we were leaving my wife found out it was Dr. Willis)..no tell me what's going on or anything..I passed on info from previous dentist as was told to do but was quickly dismissed with we don't do that..just you need to see a specialist...how about what type of specialist? I informed them that cold water really hurts my teeth and dentist said, "Really nothing I can do about it unless I numb your mouth."  In addition, I told both that it does not feel numb where you put the shots..most dentists would probably give you another shot to help..not this one (wasn't even offered anesthesia)...of course they sprayed cold water in my mouth and I jumped you may need to know...dentist says I can't do anything if you jump to which I replied "That is why I told you prior to starting about what you may need to know!" Sprayed cold water in mouth and it sprayed all over my face no goggles and never wiped off my face.  Dentist went back and forth with me on why I was telling him anything about cold water or numbness..after getting through it there was no what to do if I experience pain afterwards, wife had to go back in and ask.  I found the dentist and assistant very rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: So sorry to hear you didn't have a great experience with us Jeffrey!  This definitely doesn't sound like the experience we want for any of our patients or that we typically have as our normal feedback.  I will reach out to the office manager and she will contact you.  We always want to create a wonderful experience for all our patients and will look into this complaint.

Cigna did pay them for the services, but Bryant wants even more than what a cleaning and exam are. Under Cigna in network plan the cleanings and exam are 100 percent covered. text: Terrible experience I had a splint ordered since last December and got the first one it was wrong. The second time another was ordered and it was wrong. I had already paid for the splint $335. The doctor stated he needed to order another one at this point its terrible because my mouth and face were in pain. The assistant waited to call the company in turn she was rude and I had to wait to find out when my splint that had been paid for was going to arrive. I explained that it was not right I had to keep waiting on the right splint. The assistant said it was not their fault the company got it wrong but I disagree!!  I asked if I could be reimbursed for the splint the assistant manager stated she couldn't reimburse me. I have been going to Bryant dental for over a year and never had any problems until this splint. I had impressions done on this splint in December before the holidays its going on February and they never got it right! Very unprofessional and doesn't value good patients with longevity. Staff is not professional at all!!!

text: Terrible!!! Went there for a free teeth cleaning that was covered by my insurance. They dental assistant photographed my teeth and measured them.  They told me that they would need to do a 3 phase cleaning which will cost me over $700 with my insurance, I told them NO, I came here for a free cleaning.  I left and they sent me a bill for almost $200 for my supposedly FREE teeth cleaning.  They are some crooks, I wouldn't recommend them to anyone but my worse enemy.

name: Toni Worrell
text: I agree with jade... i am a severe Dentaphobe and called to change dentists after a bad experience with my other dentist.  My first visit was ok, but something seemed off.  I assumed it was my fear, and continued goung. I was told I would need a crown.  I show up terrified and they start working on me with nitrox. He says I don't  need it and after several minites, gives me the nitrox, but does not give it time to work. He then drills pokes and grinds, while I am crying. . They fit the temp crown and say I can pay when they put new crown on. I am then in  PAIN for 3 weeks. I go back in he says he wants to put me on steroids and pain meds, but he may have to do a root canal.  They will check to see how I am and setup another appointment.  NEVER HAPPENED.  got a bill in the mail for my crown that I never got... when I called them, their number listed on bill was disconnected. Can you say, "" you know a good attorney? "

name: Jeffery Wynn
text:
We initially had a good  experience with DMD Kym. The visit was to determine what we needed to do with me 71 year old Fabulous Mom. 😉 The office  was patient  and helped us get a bottom denture made and CREATED A PLAN  to work on the top after the bottom  was completed. Now Mom's on hospice care at home
along with the influx of Covid 19, we had to cancel many appointments.  Well  all the "planets were in alignment today" and I actually got her in to get  the denture. Mr. Kym spoke extremely curtly to her and quite frankly. Afterwards quickly , what I felt to dismiss us. Mr. Kym actually wait for it...........sent us home with this  denture only.
Nothing  else. So fast forward as Iam looking at it sitting on my table "on a napkin"  I called the office to inquire as to how to care for it. What to put it in (other than her mouth of course) And remembered her telling him that a tooth on top was sharp and causing pain to her tongue. To which he offered NO assistance. Pretty Inept  is the opinion I have of this guys practice.  He also made it quite clear he would offer no  further assistance with her remaining denture situation. You remember, the " plan" he had established prior. At any rate  I am simply at a loss.  Mr. Kym, Kim whatever at the very least owes her an apology for the lack of respect that he obviously felt was OK to show towardmy Mom. And at this point,  perhaps he could have one of his assistants  forward His  initial  " plan " if you will,  to a DMD whom can assist us in finishing her needs? I have reached out to Medicare and UHC for any assistance, thoughts or recommendations.

Everyone is so compassionate and caring. I am
So thankful for the way they cared for my two young boys yesterday, and I trust them to get the necessary work all done with my son trusting dentists and not fearing them.

name: Kat Calvert
text: From the front desk to the dentist, this is a wonderful office. The assistants are knowledge, kind & extremely professional. Dr. Tan showed such a degree of professionalism and compassion. I have never received such great dental care in my life. Will and have recommended to everyone. Such a blessing to me.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words.  We appreciate your positive review.

name: Aaron G
text:
I’ve been to this office twice . After my first visit I felt something was off about the way they handle things but I thought maybe I was overthinking it so I decided to go to my second appointment .

During my first appointment I just needed to get a diagnose to see what I needed to get done . I saw Dr. Tan.  When Dr. Tan came and check my teeth and X-ray said I probably just need a cleaning and I had 2 cavities that need filling. They offered to do the cleaning that day and  I was ok with it. I have insurance so I knew that was cover and didn’t have to pay anything. The hygienist also told me I needed a panoramic x ray and that my insurance doesn’t cover so it was going cost me $92 and handed me this paper to sign it . I get very high anxiety at dentist office so I sign it without thinking any of it . She didn’t explain why I needed she just said it was to check if everything was normal . I’ve never had this done so I went with it. Now after my second visit I realized that panoramic x ray  is just a way to get money out of you and just to makes you pay for something you don’t really need . After I got my teeth cleaning dentist never came to check on hygienist work and they never went over the panoramic X-ray . I went go head and got my second appointment to get my “2 fillings” done . The girl at the desk told me it was going to be $116.

I went to my second appointment and of course I was anxious. The dental assistant tells me I need 3 fillings and it was going to cost me $155 . I asked her why 3 since I was told it was only 2 . She said her chart shows 3 fillings. Being anxious and wanting to get this done I just said ok and sign . Got my fillings done and paid . I went home and checked my teeth I can barely see the “3rd” filling . It makes me wonder if I even had 3rd cavity or was this just made up to get more money out of me ? . I don’t know wether there was a miscommunication or if they’re really just dishonest and taking advantage of people who are anxious ? !!!

I know part of it is my fault for not speaking  up and just sign a paper . But I hope this helps other people in future . I will not be coming back , I will be looking for new dentist .

name: Vallie Lee
text: Amazing.... Good dentist... Made my visit fast friendly and was very gentle. Thankful to have visted this dentist.

name: Wayne Mckerley
text: Very friendly and caring

name: kim Glenn
text: When I first went there Dr Kim saw me .He pulled 3 bottom teeth and was pretty gentle with me .I don't like going to dentist so of coarse this made me alittle ok with the fact I new I would need some dentures soon .Well if you want to be sure your satisfied and your dentures are right and will fit,you'll need to go elsewhere  .They don't give a damn if they were made rite,if there lined up rite ,if they fit,or if they were even made right  .They simply don't care,how you feel about them,the fact that they don't fit,it dosent matter.they have there money,so u got to deal with wat you got.My sister just got screwed by Aspen ,now I get screwed by Today's family Dental .Nobody cares about the other anymore.Its dog eat dog.no feelings,no compassion.just live with it and die

name: Teacher Debbie
text:
I have been to this dentist's office before and seen Dr. Kim. He always did a good job. However, I had a painful, decayed, infected back tooth and needed to be seen by whoever was available. When I called the office, I was able to get an appointment for the next day.

When I got to the dentist's office, I was called back immediately, which I thought was good. I was to see a Dr. Tan. Dr. Tan was nice, and told me that the tooth needed to come out. She numbed the area and left me in the chair in a position with my head down and my feet elevated. No one came in to check on me and I was in the chair for three hours. Finally, when Dr. Tan came in the second time after she had numbed me, she started working on my tooth. I told her that it was still hurting. She then said that she was not bragging on her numbing technique, but that the area had to be numb. She said that since it was decayed that she might have to dig around down there and if I was feeling pain, she could not do that. She did not offer me nitrous oxide or more lidocane. She sent me home without extracting the tooth. She prescribed antibiotics for a week and then said we would try again.

While I was in the chair, I was so cold that my feet were actually shaking. I was never offered a blanket or asked if I was OK. This office is always so loud as they have music playing and everyone is always talking to each other about their weekends or what they did the night before. I need a peaceful area when I am in a lot of pain.

I went home and looked up dentists in Birmingham and found a great one that removed my tooth the next day. I will not be going back to this dentist's office.

name: Ryan Dingler
text:
Been here many times. Always easy in and out. Dr. Tan was nice, funny, and did a great job each time. The dentists and assistants are very friendly and informative. I never consider going anywhere else.

I would definitely recommend them.

name: Barbara Goodwin
text: My dentures still bother my My Gum..

text: Great experience

name: Donna Causey

name: Lucas Elliott
text: Beware!!! Stay away from this dentist. They will get your child in the back and do extra procedures and not tell you until they are through. I told them I didn’t want my son receiving a filling that day. Everyone assured me that he wouldn’t be and once he was in the back they proceeded to do the filling without asking or telling me until they were finished. I will be filling a complaint with the state board of dentistry.

name: Sonja Renea
text:
My tooth extraction was terrifying since I was not completely numb yet. I have TMJ, which no one asked me about before it was done... in fact there was no consultation prior to extractions at all. I bought dentures from this office but I regret it. My TMJ is much worse now. They were not very informative or thorough. I felt like I was wasting their time with my concerns.

My dentures cause me pain because I have a small mouth, and these dentures have more teeth than my mouth was used to... I thought that was something they would have checked. But I was told that is the standard amount of teeth for a normal mouth (which I never had) that my bite looked fine and basically deal with it. I felt like once they had my money my comfort did not matter.

Even though I saved up for their "high end" dentures, they are very uncomfortable and I will be saving up to purchase another pair of dentures elsewhere as soon as I can afford it.

name: Chuck Noris
text: Went in to have one wisdom tooth removed. Staff were very curtious and made the visit comfortable and quick. Unfortunately, they charged my insurance $350.00+ for this one simple 15 minute procedure 😐. Over-charging insurance companies is the number one reason for high rates. Won't be going back.

resp.text: Hello Chris.  We are sorry that you are disappointed in our billing practices.  Just so you know, Dental Insurance works much differently than Medical Insurance.  What we "charged" your Dental Insurance makes no difference as the Insurance company sets the fees, not us.  We could have "charged" $1000 for the work you had done, and we would have been paid the same and written off a higher amount.  In fact, we typically have to write off ~33% of everything we do.  Most dental insurances companies haven't changed their fees in 5+ years, and we haven't raised our fees in the same time frame.  If you have any further questions in how Dental Insurance works, please feel free to give us a call.
