name: Kristin W.
text:
I had a very, very bad experience here. Cindy did my cleaning, if you can call it that (bloodbath might be more accurate). The pick kept slipping and gouging my gums and it was extremely painful. According to her, my previous dental hygienists didn't do a thing to remove the plaque from my teeth because she announced that my mouth was in terrible shape, and didn't I know that I was supposed to brush my teeth regularly? When she started in on flossing and waggled her blood-stained fingers in front of my eyes, I got dizzy and started crying.

Dr. Peters came in next and said, "I hear you've been having some trouble! Did you know you're supposed to brush and floss your teeth? You have to be good about it, or else your teeth will end up looking like this..." at which point he gestured to a horrifying picture mounted on the wall featuring blackened and rotting teeth. He told me that my teeth shouldn't be so bad for someone my age and the cleaning shouldn't be so painful unless I haven't been taking care of them. People, I have been seeing dentists twice a year throughout my entire life, keeping up with my regular cleanings and x-rays, and no dentist has ever been this critical of me. I think Cindy was rough and careless, and defended herself against my crying by saying that I had terrible and highly sensitive teeth, and Dr. Peters took her at her word instead of asking her to leave the room and talking to me alone.

Between the condescension from both of them and the heavy-handed pick wielding, I will never ever recommend this practice, nor will I ever return there.

name: Ashlyn Crawford
text: I’m super sad because I like Dr. Summerford. I have been a patient for many years and was told this last time that it was now $25 to reschedule an appointment within 24 hours. I have 3 small children and a last second issue with child care. Unfortunately, that is now how you should treat patients and it looks like a desperate money grab. Anyone with a busy life knows that cleanings are scheduled months in advance and life issues can change in a second. I will be finding a new dentist.

resp.text: Ashlyn, we are truly sorry that you feel the need to leave, and we understand your frustration.  We've had to implement this new policy due to the increase in patients who cancel with short notice or don't even bother showing up to their appointment.  On average 20% of our appointments every day do this which inhibits us from scheduling appointments for those patients who want or need them on certain days or times.  We also reserve time and resources for these patients which are lost when appointments are lost.  We hope this might explain why we've had to implement this policy.

name: Minehwa C
text: I had been going to this dental office for cleaning for 3-4  years until recently.  Last week I had the dental cleaning at my new dental office, the hygienist was very puzzled that I had a lot of calcification buildups even I had cleaning every six months at Central Park Dental.  Apparently the hygienist at Central Park Dental did not do a thorough job.

resp.text: Minehwa, we're sorry you feel like you received sub-optimal care at our office.  We can assure you, however, that every patient receives a thorough cleaning.  We accept nothing less.  We cannot comment on your situation due to HIPAA regulations.  As a general point of information, some patients acquire calculus buildup more easily and quickly than others due to factors both within their control and outside of their control.  For that reason, not all patients receive cleanings every six months although most do.  A small amount of patients require cleanings yearly while others require them every 3-4 months.  Again, we are sorry that you feel that you didn't receive the care you deserve, and if you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to call our office.

name: Rebecca Little
text: While I was in pain I called around to several dentist and they currently were not taking new patients. I called Geneva Family Dentist not only were they taking new patients but scheduled me immediately. When I arrived to the office the parking lot seemed full. As I walked in the office is beautiful and roomy I no more finished my paper work and was called to the back. I was in and out in record time with no pain from my procedure. The staff was amazing from the women at the front desk, the dental assistant, to the dentist. I have no dental insurance to cover the bill. When I walked out of the office I can say that even with having extractions I walked out happy upbeat and with more money in my pocket that I thought I was going to have to pay. I would highly recommend this dental office. They are amazing and I can not say thank you so much enough.

They are a great team they work so well together to make everybody feel comfortable and I felt really comfortable especially when I found out I had to have a root canal which they performed the very next week. name: jennie franks
text:
Warm and wonderful facility. Lexi, whom was the receptionist, was truly a pleasure speaking with. She is kind and truly goes above her call to help. I'm hearing impaired and explained as much; she informed the staff, so everyone was aware. Huge plus! Everyone was patient and kind. Jamie, my Hygienist was absolutely the best. She did not rush me nor the experience (as dentist appointments can bring on lots of feelings, depending on individual needs of the patient.) Dr. Markham was the best. He spoke loud, and clearly. Looked at me while speaking. He as well, took his time and was patient with me. He listened to my concerns. To put it simply, the bomb.
Haley, she was everything and more. I can not stress enough the kindness and compassion that was extended to me and my family. Haley, explained pricing (in full detail) and discussed all of this in a private room, so I could actually hear her.
Overall, the experience was phenomenal! Geneva Family Dentistry has an amazing staff! We will be doing all of our future dentistry needs here.

text: Had a couple visits to try to fix a severe pain in my upper right jaw. Doc was fantastic about finding the source of the pain, and it turns out I was completely wrong. He scanned and did visuals to make sure they got to the right place, then fixed me up with a canal and temp filling until I could get a crown. Return for crown was mostly awesome. New girl was training and they seemed to be really patient and informative, rather than harsh. Doc even worked a little into his lunch to fix me up. Very professional and thorough, great visits!

resp.text: Will, thank you for such thoughtful feedback!  We are happy we could help you and we enjoyed visiting with you in the office!  Thanks!

name: The1_ Grammy
text: I've been to many dental practices over my 58 years. Geneva Family Dentistry is by far the best. I love the personal attention I receive and the experience and knowledge of the staff. Jamie Howell is my hygienist and she is the BEST! I would give her 100 stars if that was possible. Dr. Markham has a very straight forward approach and will consider all options when you are faced with necessary dental work.. He will give you an honest estimate before doing the work for your consideration. There is no need to make several appointments for a crown because he uses the latest technology to make your crown right there during your appointment. That is worth a lot to me and my time. You won't see a waiting room full of people either. Their appointments are scheduled very well and they will call you in within a few minutes. I've never waited over 10 minutes. The staff at Geneva Family Dentistry are always friendly and do whatever is within their power to accommodate you. If you are considering a new dental practice, this is the one you should choose. I didn't know any of the staff before I made my first appointment so I am giving an unbiased opinion. I tell as many people as possible about Geneva Family Dentistry. You may have to wait a while for your first appointment. But I feel it is worth your while to do so. I'm very thankful for each one of the staff.

resp.text: Kelly, we really appreciate your thoughtful words!  And, we are thankful for you too!

In this ten-month process, I have never had even one disappointment. He called me at home to check on me after the bone grafts, gum grafts, and post insertion. His collaboration with my dentist, who will finish the crown work, is seamless.

If there is an issue, they work hard to resolve. They are good enough to file for me even though they are not a preferred provider with my primary insurance. name: Pete Pappelis
text:
The dentist that I had been seeing for almost fourteen years unfortunately retired so I have been trying to find a replacement. I recently cracked a tooth, and I was referred to a local dentist, so I decided to give them a try. Folks, just because someone has a fancy office does not mean that they are a reputable business, at least in my experience. It is not typical of me bad mouthing a local business and I will keep their name out of this review, but they are an embarrassment to the noble profession of dentistry. When I was seen by the hygienist, she responded, "Oh wow that is bad, you will need to have that tooth extracted immediately". My initial thought was "I didn't realize that a hygienist was also a doctor of dentistry". Then when the dental assistant took the x-rays, her response was identical! What made matters worse the doctor backed up what they said and wanted to extract the tooth right there and then!!! I was concerned and confused so I asked what the cost would be. They brought in the "closer" with the three options. Just yank it, yank it and create a cap with a bridge like a denture or the option that I would probably have chosen, yank it and have an implant which would have cost over three thousand dollars, oh, by the way they have a company that will finance.
Thanks, but no thanks!
So, I walked out and I waited, maybe too long because I got a bad abscess. Now what do I do?
I researched and talked to many folks. I decided to give Southern dentistry a try and thank God I did. They got me in the next morning. Everyone that I came in contact with was very professional and friendly. From the receptionist to the dentist. The dental assistant took the x-ray and told me that the doctor will be with me shortly. Most of my experiences with doctors or dentists are that if you have an appointment be prepared to wait an hour or two before someone sees you. I was seen within a few minutes. Dr. Jessica Robinson was great, very professional and to the point and explained everything in detail. She recommended against extracting the tooth. She believed that the tooth can be saved. Her recommendation was to perform a root canal with a crown at a cost of less than a third of what the other dentist recommended! Very short and to the point treatment plan. NO FINANCING NEEDED!
How refreshing and what a great place. For once a dentist that understands CUSTOMER SERVICE! I highly recommend Southern dentistry. You will not be disappointed.
RAVING FAN

resp.text: Thank you

name: Alyssa Stellmaker
text:
This review is in response to a request sent to me after a dental procedure and included a side note that a review of less than 5-stars should be called into the office rather than placed online.  Dealing directly with the office was unresponsive. I’ve been a patient at Southern Dentistry, with Dr. Nebrig, for 3+ years, with numerous procedures performed. I don’t expect perfection; but, when a business won’t/can’t get you in to see the dentist for pain related to work that he performed and waiting too long could cause further or more serious damage, those little, previously forgiven imperfections compound.

Cons:  scheduling and communication.  Can’t get in to see a dentist; even as an established patient, for a dental emergency, or to get a newly placed crown adjusted. If there is a problem with dental work that was completed there-such as a crown that’s too high, pain/possible tooth infection/root canal needed after dental repair 3 weeks prior but persistent pain when chewing, the office will, literally, tell you that they are “too busy” to see you. You have to schedule a regular appt, which is many months out.  Neither pain, facial bruising, nor new pain at the contact tooth will matter. One of the assistants who places crowns will ignore a patient’s cry of pain in hopes of rapidly finishing the crown fitting on a raw tooth. When the crown felt a little high during it’s placement, the assistant didn’t dry the tooth before using the chalk paper and told me to wait until I wasn’t numb and to give the teeth time to adjust; they’d move around a bit and I could easily come back in to get it adjusted. The amalgam fillings have a rough/sandy texture that leaves the tooth constantly feeling dirty.   The wait time before work/cleaning begins is often 45-60 min.  If insurance covers at 50%, you overpay before the work is done at a 40% coverage. This policy is left to the patient to discover. When questioning the math for the estimates and lack of refunds or j completed work, they say they will reimburse the difference after all the insurance claims have paid.  After all of the work that’s been done, I’m aware of only one reimbursement.  Perhaps, the overpayments were applied to other procedures and they forgot to tell me. My insurance claims for one procedure showed that I had overpaid Southern Dentistry by something like $86 and the front office confirmed the same amount a couple months after the claim. When I was at my next procedure and asked to have that $86 reimbursement applied to the current procedure, the office said I had $8 owed to me and my “insurance must not have paid fully for an X-ray or something.”  (They didn’t apply the $8 toward the current procedure or give me the money back.) Providing patients with a break down receipt that shows the portions the patient and insurance paid, and the refund owed to the patient would enhance trust and clarity.  At one appt, the office was in such a hurry to get patients out the door that they skipped my annual X-rays and said they would do them at the next cleaning, in 6 months.

Pros:  Dr. Nebrig has a charismatic and laid back, jubilant personality. He does a great job numbing the area that will receive work and calming an anxious patient.  He takes pride in and enjoys his work, and completes the procedures quickly.  Same day crowns drastically improve an unpleasant and time consuming dental procedure.  The office location is convenient. Silver fillings aren’t used.  The hygienists, assistants, and dentist are friendly and gentle.  The sport-top water bottles provided  after a procedure exemplifies attention to detail and patient needs. The facility is clean. The office accepts a lot of different insurances. The business wants patient feedback.

resp.text: Thank you

resp.text: I'm so sorry for the incovenience.  We make every effort to handle accounts within our dental family, however our universal policy is that after 3 months of sending statements with no response, our balances are handled by a different company.  Once it is in there hands, we can no longer handle the payments.  Our desire is to be a comforting, quality dental home for our community, and having to chase debts takes away from our focus on the people that we need to care for.   We have carefully selected a debt collection agency who has a history of pursuing accounts in an accurate honest way in order to make the process as simple for those involved as possible.

Once done they completed my checkout, scheduled my next cleaning appointment, gave me a goody bag and a flower⚘. That is amazing customer service. Very pleased!!!

resp.text: Thank you Phillip! We really try :)

name: Mari J
text:
-->UPDATE<-- Today, 5/27/20, I went in to get 2 cavaties filled. I was a little upset that I had to call to reschedule my appointment, originally for 4/6, (due to COVID)... I guess I just thought that the patients in pain, would at least get a call FIRST to reschedule any important procedures - that didn't happen. Thankfully, I called in late April & was able to get an appt for today, 5/27. I get there at 10:20, my appointment time, let them know I'm there, only to be told, "You're appointment is scheduled for 11:10". This was due some type of system issue they were having (understandable, not their fault). BEFORE they take payment, she goes over what they are doing today + how much it would cost. I immediately asked if that price included the nitrous oxide gas (my cost $50). She said no and amended my new payment to include the gas. After waiting for way longer than usual, I was called in and told, "I'm sorry, the truck hasn't delivered the oxygen".
Yes, I had about 2-3 panick/anxiety attacks in the chair but after 2 hours of crying, it isfis .... for now.
Now, I'm in lots of pain and I can't even begin to describe it ... I can't open my mouth + chewing is OUT of the Question!!!!
I really hope Dr. Nebrig and his staff makes this right bc I thought I FINALLY found a dentist that I can trust + does good work at good prices.
***********************************************
(August 2019) Dr. Nebrig and his staff are MARVELOUS. The environment is very relaxing. I was called back as soon as I arrived (literally no wait time in the lobby - not used to such a quick call back once I check in at other facilities I've visited in the past 🙃). I was greeted with smiling faces and just felt "Welcomed". The girls were the most amazing assistants with my VERY FIRST root canal! They went over + above to ensure I was in as little discomfort as possible. Sidney even brought me a blanket while I waited on my crown to be delivered. Dr. Nebrig has an amazing bedside manner and is very kind and considerate. The staff called me the next morning to check and see how I was doing. I would recommend Southern Dentistry to ANYONE - matter of fact, I've been raving about them since my visit! Keep up the great work!!!

resp.text: Thank you Mari, We really try!

name: Alison Harper
text: Called today as a new patient without insurance, bad tooth ache, Friday after lunch and leaving for a 7 day cruise on Sunday. After calling around I was losing hope of getting seen. However, when I called southern dentistry Taylor said she may have a cancellation late in the day and took my name and number. Not expecting a return call, I kept calling around with no luck. At 3:41 Taylor called me and said they could get me in today! I was super impressed that she was that concerned about me especially late on a Friday. They quickly got me back and I was seen by Dr. Robinson. They diagnosed my problem and we agreed on a treatment plan within 15 minutes. Dr Robinson was so pleasant and made it clear that she was confident and knowledgeable. I have my follow up appointment for after my vacay but am so thankful to know I won’t need emergency dental work in the middle of the Caribbean!

Not to mention today, I had an appointment at the Daphne office & I had to call back to make the follow up appointment. I literally was left on hold for 13 minutes. text: I've been going here the past couple of years and had nothing but excellent experiences whether it was for fillings or cleanings.  It's always been painless. As usual, Dr. Robinson and the hygienist did an excellent job, but the operational side is just as impressive.  I literally checked in and sat in the lobby for 2 minutes before I was called back (they've always been on time).  Thirty minutes later I was leaving.  They are great.

name: Tara Hyde
text:
Had a dental emergency on a Thursday just after 5pm. No one returned my calls and my son had seriously broken about 5 teeth with nerves exposed, which required about $900 worth of fixing after ins paid.
I was at the mercy of trying to get another dentist who wasn’t ours to come in after hrs to fix him up.
To top matters off, they didn’t return my multiple calls until the following Tuesday. They may do good dental work, but they weren’t there for us when we needed care the most! Chose wisely!

resp.text: I am so sorry that you had such a hard time getting in touch with us.  Our Robertsdale office is open on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.  We have the Daphne location open 5 days a week and my cell phone number is on the voicemail there, so I am accessible on weekends too.  I will make sure this information is on the voicemail so that it doesn't happen again.  Thank you for letting me know, and again, I'm sorry that you couldn't get in touch with us.  Dr. Michael Nebrig, DMD

name: Sharon McMahon
text:
I had a large cavity in my back tooth where my nerve was exposed.  I had put off making an appointment until I couldn't wait any longer.  I was referred to Dr. Nebrig by my parents' dentist in Birmingham, and I didn't hesitate to make an appointment after reading so many great reviews.
I called the office on a Friday to see how soon they would be able to see me.  They found a cancellation on the following Monday and fit me in.  After a thorough examination, it was determined that I needed a root canal, and they were able to do it the following day!  Not only were they able to do the root canal, but they also made and fit my crown within an hour after the root canal was completed!
With all of that said, the staff was absolutely amazing throughout the entire process.  They were so genuinely caring and helpful, taking time to get to know me personally and put me at ease... and I can't say enough about Dr. Nebrig.  He is kind, competant,  caring, and funny... I feel completely safe in his care, and I know my family and I have found a home at Southern Dentistry!

name: Jody Hirst
text:
Today was the first day in my 16 year old daughters life that she went to the dentist by herself.
When I asked her how it went, she said “horrible”.
She said she waited for 30 minutes to be taken back.  And when she finally got in the chair, she had to listen to your employees argue about who would clean her teeth.  Neither one felt like working today I suppose.
As I’ve never had a bad experience in your office, I’m appalled at how badly you screwed this up.  This is how you lose an entire family as patients.

R/
Jody Hirst

resp.text: Hi Jody.  I'm so sorry to hear about her bad experience.  As you have experienced in the past, that is very unusual.  I was in our other office when this occurred and as soon as I read your note I inquired about the event.  It seems that it was miscommunication between the hygienists and your daughter.  Rhonda was scheduled to see her, but was spending a lot of time reviewing a complicated treatment plan with her patient.  Faye had a cancelation at that time, and volunteered to see your daughter instead (to try to avoid any longer delays).  The "argument" was regarding whether Rhonda needed Faye to help her out or if Rhonda could see her just a little later.  The effort was to get to your daughter as soon as possible, not trying to avoid her.  I'm sorry that it did not come across that way.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention.  All feedback helps us to become a better office.  Dr. Michael Nebrig, DMD

text: I had an amazing experience here! The staff was very friendly and thorough. The office was clean and welcoming! Definitely glad I found them. :)

text: Absolutely amazing experience for my two kids, 9 and 6, who hadn't been to the dentist in a long time. The staff is very good with kids and made our visit a very pleasant one. When we got ready to check out, we were given some of the most beautiful carnations I have seen in a long time. Topped our visit off with a great big smile...a clean, white smile!!! I highly recommend this dentistry.

text: I'm really thankful I found this place.Staff was so great and caring❤I highly recommend them.

text: Fyffe Dental is amazing! I went in for a tooth that had been giving problems all weekend!  They got in me in as soon as they opened checked and worked to get me into a oral surgery on to get it out all in the same day! The staff is sweet And Caring and super easy to speak with!

text: All the staff is friendly and extremely professional. My appointments go smoothly. I am in and out in 30 minutes or so. Never had any problems there. Hygienist was excellent!!!

You're more than just a payment to them you're an actual person doctor and staff best ever

name: Judy Couch
text: My hygienist Courtney was very nice and explained everything as she went. Madison who did my x-rays also explained everything as she went along and was very nice also. Dr. Bailey’s exam was thorough and he told me what I needed to have done. The front office staff explained what needed to be done regarding insurance and made sure I understood. Can’t say enough about this Group!!

name: Rebecca Barnes
text: Great visit with friendly staff. No waiting.  Awesome  experience!  Will definently recommend to others

name: Deb Means
text: My appointment was for a Cleaning with Doris.  She was very professional and caring. I am 67 and have anxiety going to the Dentist, She has a way of making me feel comfortable and safe while doing her job...making my teeth Sparkle. Then Dr Smith comes in and checks my mouth and teeth, sending me home with a Great Dental Experience. I’ve used many Dentists in the past, but this is the Best!  Thank You, Dr Smith and Doris!

name: cynthia sneed
text:
Smith Bailey is the best dental clinic we have ever used.  They explain everything clearly in terms the patient can understand.  Very effective billing procedures with no mistakes.
Dr's. Smith and Bailey do brilliant work at Very reasonable prices.
They provide great cosmetic and family dental care.
Most important to us?  If you have an emergency they will treat you.  Rated #1 dental clinic for a reason: they are #1!

name: Jason Waugh
text: Welcoming receptionist and waiting area. The place is always clean and well kept. The staff is always friendly, courteous, and my dental hygienist and dentist are always respectful of any issues I may tell them! Love the office hours as well! Thanks for a job well done as always.

name: Brent Means
text: Every visit I have made to Smith & Bailey has been nothing short of the utmost quality in service provided.  The staff displays professionalism and communicates well with me on the procedures taking place, as well as the appointment dates.  Clean facilities, technicians that are knowledgeable and efficient in their tasks, and a well-structured system that is facilitating to their clientele, makes for a successful business that provides a quality service rendered.  Smith & Bailey is also accomodating to provide any urgent care needed.  I highly recommend this office to anyone desiring quality dental care with state-of-the-art equipment and friendly, professional staff to provide excellent service.

name: s ch
text: Always very friendly and helpful at this dentist office. Very safety conscious with covid also. My hygienist that cleaned my teeth did a really good job. She cleaned them very well without having to make my gums sore. Dr Bailey was very personable and talked to me while he was checking my teeth, the conversation took my mind off the dental work he was doing. I was less nervous. Very enjoyable dental visit!

name: Amy Buckelew
text: As always it was great!! I absolutely love Doris and always try and schedule with her! She is so pleasant and personable and makes my experience easy (I’m kinda a chicken at the dentist!).

name: Susan Bryant
text: Everyone here is so friendly and accommodating.  Dr Bailey is very thorough and helpful.  Always has our health his first concern but does not do unnecessary procedures.  This makes me always trust his suggestions.

name: Terry Beam
text: I was very impressed with the knowledgeable employees. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. I appreciate their dedication to their profession

name: Missy Wright
text: Really Liked Dr. Bailey. I am one of those that has a panic attack going to the Dentist. My previous dentist had me mark as a Red File other than allergies also meaning I could freak out at any time. Smh..   Dr. Bailey and the staff all helped me to not get freaked out. They were all very kind and understanding. They also look for any way to help save you money.  Totally recommend..

name: ryan moody
text: Everything was great about the place. Even help get other appointments set up that day. Thank you.

name: Ruth Moffatt
text: I LOVE Smith & Bailey! Dr. Smith is my dentist and she is. FANTASTIC. The staff is also amazing! If you are looking for a doctor in this area, you will not go wrong going here.

name: Flow Digital Solutions
text: Smith & Bailey Dental is easily the best dental clinic in the Gadsden area. The staff really go the extra mile to make their patients feel comfortable and at ease during cleanings and procedures. Televisions are installed on the walls and ceilings of each room for the patients to enjoy, and they even provide patients with sunglasses to keep the light out of their eyes while they're working. You really can't ask for anything more from a local dentist!

name: Thomas Robinson, Jr.
text: Smith & Bailey Dental is the best dental facility I’ve ever visited. The staff and dental technicians are always smiling and friendly.  Dr. Smith has a great personality and is genuinely concerned about her patients dental health.  Smith & Bailey Dental has built relationships with other dental specialist. I’ve had to be referred to a couple, all of whom have the same caring and concern for the patient.  I am retired military and used to be deathly afraid of dentists , however thanks to Smith and Bailey Dental I now have no fear of a dentist or the quality of their service and look forward to keeping my appointments and seeing Dr. Smith and the staff. I am truly a patient for life.  Thank you Smith and Bailey Dental you are the G.O.A.T. In dentistry.

name: Dinesh Parmar
text: Best  dental  office  in Gadsden,  modern, staff  and Dentists  excellent, courteous and caring.

name: Kim Stone
text: I love Dr Smith,  my first visit was today and she and the entire staff are so compassionate.  So glad I have found a dentist in my hometown

name: Betty Downs
text: Great group. Dr Bailey is the best. Very knowledgeable and pleasant. Takes good care of his patients. Technicians are very helpful and friendly. Would recommend to anyone needing dentist.

name: Farrah Hayes
text: Smith & Bailey Dental goes above and beyond to meet the needs of their clients. I have had extensive dental work done over the past 5 years and Dr. Bailey and his staff have accommodated me in so many ways. They provide a calm and relaxing environment with positive energy. If you are scared of the dentist, you need to visit Smith & Bailey Dental because they will make sure you are comfortable and fully aware of the steps of your procedure.

name: Darlene Smith
text: Everyone was kind and professional.  The manner in which the staff handled the current regulations as it relates to Covid 19 was superb.  As always, the hygienist was one of the best I have ever had.  Dr. Smith took time to explain my plan of care for the upcoming year.  I was not rushed.  I was given time to ask questions.  Pleasant experience.

name: David & Vicki Potter
text: Jessica and Dr. Smith went out of their way to carve out time for me, formulate a plan for my treatment,  and calm my raging anxiety.  My procedure went smoothly and I left the office in much better spirits than I had gone in.  Thank you, Smith and Bailey Dental.  Well done.

name: Donnie Tanner
text: Really proud to be a patient of Dr Bailey. Very friendly staff and they all want you to feel welcome. Well pleased always!

name: Marian Headington
text:
Pleasant, professional staff. They take such good care of my family. The office procedures before COVID where easy and private. Now, with the virus, I feel safe.
We do not have insurance so pay as we go. Pricing is very fair.
Highly recommend this practice and especially Dr. Bailey.

name: Pam Washington
text: The staff is amazing and Dr.Bailey is a Wonderful Dentist. My Hygentist did an awesome job today.  The whole office is wonderful wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Cassie Green
text: I had a great experience with Doris and Dr. Smith as always. Thanks for taking good care of me! 🙂 🦷🪥

name: Jerolyn Page
text: Staff is courteous and knowledgeable.  I was very pleased with the service that I received.

name: Sally Staub
text: Our family of six had top-notch service! Dr Julie Smith and her team displayed not only excellent dentistry, their clear concise explanations, kindness, gentle approach and  service by her front office staff was a breath of fresh air! Their office was clean, state of the art and her network of oral surgeons and orthodontists that she recommends were also amazing.

name: Amy Robertson
text: Love the precautions they are taking to ensure the safety of patients and staff during this difficult time!

name: Marilyn Lawley
text: With covid 19 going on it's hard to think about your teeth but at Smith and Bailey Dental they care and are doing everything required to keep you safe by doing screening. They are so nice and friendly. They helped me get over the fear of being at a dentist at times like this. I would like to thank them and I appreciate they're help.

name: Thomas Russell
text:
Our family LOVES this place.  Dr. Smith is a great Dentist and a great person!   She is easy to talk to and explains everything really well.  My 7 year old and my 11 year old absolutely love her. The dental hygienists
that work in this office are very thorough and very good at what they do.  We will be going to this office for many years.

name: Derek Pierce
text: Bailey is an excellent dentist. Staff are always friendly and polite. Any dental pain or problems needing immediate care are addressed quickly. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Mandy Wooten
text: The lady who I had today was so very awesome.  And dr Baliey was great as always. Thank you all very much.

name: Bryan Walker
text: Very kind, gentle and high tech. In a comfortable and convenient way.

name: Candace Doak
text: Great attention to detail and friendly service.

name: Bob Hundley
text: Ya'll are best!!  My teeth look better than

name: LaQuentin Ragland
text: Smith and Bailey Dental always do a great job cleaning my tenth. They are very thorough, but are also as gentle as a dentist/dental hygienist could be. They have great customer service. You don’t typical look forward going to the dentist, but they make you feel as comfortable as possible.

name: Donna Richey
text: Excellent experience ! All staff are very kind & helpful.

name: Nicole Frazier
text: My son is 4 years old and they always do so well with explaining everything and making it a great experience for him. Highly recommend. Dr. Forrest Bailey is wonderful!

name: josh martin
text: Excellent care. Professional operation going above and beyond to provide a safe and pleasant experience during the pandemic. Ceiling mounted television was a nice touch. See you in 6 months.

name: Jim Garrard
text: Dr. Smith is awesome and a thorough dentist. She will spend as much time as necessary to explain your dental issues. Also all the hygienist I have used are all excellent. The whole staff works to make your visit pleasant.

name: Darlene Davis
text: Dr. Bailey and the entire staff are professional, courteous and friendly.    Dr. Bailey has performed several different dental procedures for me and I have been greatly satisified with them all.  I highly recommend Smith and Bailey Dental.

name: Linda Cleveland
text: My not favorite place is the dentist, but Smith & Bailey always make me feel welcomed. The dental assistants are friendly and work so easy in your mouth. I'm not scared to come to dentist anymore. Thank you

name: Rachel Abernathy
text: ❤️👍🏼Wonderful staff, wonderful, building.. very observant of taking necessary precautions due to the Covid virus. My doctor is Miss Smith and she is amazing. She explains everything to the detail before hand, even the cost which they are willing to wrk with you on like make payments etc. I have had 2 fillings on my two bottom front teeth and it matches perfectly! Also a rootcanal and cap on a back tooth that fits perfectly!!! All without any insurance. I love this group of people they really care about their patients.❤️

name: Odessa Evans
text: I had a very pleasant experience! Dr. Smith and her assistant as well as the the other office personnel were very professional and knowledgeable.  They were willing to help and did not mind doing so. Dr. Smith and her assistant answered each question that I asked and did not rush me.  I appreciate the matter in which they treated me. Sincerely,  Odessa Evans

name: Seth Spotnitz
text: I called and was seen the same day. Dr. Bailey diagnosed and treated my problem quickly and expertly. The doctor and staff were friendly and courteous. As good an experience as one can have from going to the dentist. 5 stars easily!

name: Linda Wilkes
text: I always receive the best treatment when I go for my appointments. The staff is very professional and the last time I went I got the most thorough teeth cleaning I have ever had. After the teeth cleaning Doctor Smith came in and sat down and went over everything. She always spends plenty of time explaining things. I highly recommend  Smith and Bailey dentist.

name: Mary King
text: Always fast, courteous & very clean! Best dentist in town. Top notch dentists there & hygienist & staff!!

name: Benjamin Clough
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful even with all of the Covid restrictions. They were wonderful with both of my boys and I have no hesitation with any of the staff taking care of them. Dr. Bailey is wonderful with the kids too!

name: Mike Burford
text: Awesome Professional Staff  ,  The Owner definitely Leeds by Example of Serving the Patient.

name: Jane Whitfield
text: The staff was friendly and helpful. I loved Delores, my hygienist, because she told me what she was doing during each step of x-rays and cleaning. The office was modern and comfortable. Surprise, when you are lying back, you have a tv on the ceiling to watch!

name: Tammy Higgins
text: Very courteous and professional. Love the attention to detail Dr. Bailey performs

name: leighrn95
text: I had neglected the dentist for a while and finally came in and I’m so IMPRESSED and GRATEFUL  I chose here! Awesome experience! So professional and friendly! My hygienist was so great! I didn’t hurt at all and she explained everything! Definitely recommend!

name: Seth Shirley
text: Great place with a super friendly staff. Best dentist I've ever been to.

name: Mercedes Dudas

My experiences with Smith & Bailey Dental have been wonderful!!  Dr. Smith is very kind, patient, and gentle. Very concerned for your well being.  ALWAYS making sure you understand what she needs to do & makes sure you are on board with it. All the girls working there are very sweet & courteous.
I highly recommend Smith & Bailey Dental.

name: Amanda Shepherd
text: The best dentist and staff in all the land.. you'd be silly to go anywhere else!! ❤

name: Terrie Dickson
text: The staff is always friendly and professional. The waiting area and patient rooms are very calming and always spotless. We are fortunate to have highly trained dentists as  Dr. Bailey and Dr. Smith in Etowah County. If you live in Gadsden or the surrounding areas and need dental care, I would highly recommend Smith and Bailey Dental.

name: Jimmy Jones
text: The staff is absolutely amazing!  They handled safety regarding COVID-19 as well as I imagine it can be.  Such a great group of professionals who are also warm, friendly and caring.

name: Abby Davidson

name: Karen Dickey
text: Friendly, courteous, Dr. Bailey and staff are the best!

name: Joshua Rakestraw
text: I love being a patient at Smith & Bailey Dental. They make you feel like family. The staff is friendly, professional, and very clean! Your health, happiness and comfort is the utmost important thing to them.

name: Kristen Phillips
text: Dr. Bailey’s office is like the Chic Fil A of dentistry! Any time a dentist gets brought up, I cannot say enough amazing things about him and his staff. I’ve been a patient there for over 6 years and never once had even a slightly negative encounter! Wish I could give more than 5 stars!

name: Karen Frederick
text: Amazing patience and work on my 4 year old daughter! She loves going to see Dr. Bailey-even after having a cavity filled!

name: David Ford
text: Always great service, and all of the coronavirus precautions are being taken.

name: Joshua Bellew
text: Staffs are very friendly and gentle!

name: Carrie Gowens
text: I have extreme anxiety with dentists and this office has worked wonders with me. I don't shake as bad and have anxiety attacks near as often, and I just love them! Very professional, caring staff and doctor and Dr Bailey has a gentle tone that's not judgemental or condescending in any way. Made me feel very comfortable and at ease that they're there to help.

name: Mel Mckee
text: Doesn’t get any better than Dr Bailey and all of his staff!!

name: Amanda Aldridge
text: The staff was very professional and kind.They also followed all of the new regulations for the COVID-19 pandemic we are going through right now.  My hygienist, Brandy Hardin, was precious, she had the best personality and was sure to tell me everything she was doing and if something needed to be addressed. Hands-down the best experience!

name: Brandi Blakely Strawn
text: Dr. BAILEY AND STAFF ARE GREAT PEOPLE . HE AND HIS TEAM WORK VERY HARD TO ENSURE YOUR SAFETY AND COMFORT. I AM SO VERY THANKFUL FOR DR BAILEY AND HIS STAFF . VERY HAPPY WITH SMITH AND BAILEY OFFICE , IT'S THE CLEANEST DENTIST /DR OFFICE IVE EVER BEEN TOO. THANK YOU AGAIN DR. BAILEY .

name: Mary Rickards
text: Always enjoy coming, very professional, super safe during covid, temp taken, opened doors all the way, carried straight to room, I had no contact with anyone except hygienist that cleaned my teeth, Dr. Bailey.

name: Mitchell Stewart
text: The doctors and staff at Smith and Bailey are top notch. Very professional and they create a relaxing atmosphere for their patients. Would highly recommend.

name: Mike Owen
text: Great experience, the best teeth cleaning ever!!!

name: Sarah Kelley
text: Dr. Smith is an amazing dentist and the staff at Smith & Bailey Dental are just as wonderful! I would highly recommend this Dental Office; Very professional, considerate, and willing to be available to work around your schedule. I’ve always been apprehensive when going to the dentist and I’ve never felt that when I’m at Smith & Bailey. I cannot say enough good things about this Dental Office!

name: Tammy Allred
text: My boys always have the best experience at Smith & Bailey.  I want to thank you all for being so great at what you do and for being so kind!

name: Janet Kelley
text: Love these people. Always telling me what is going on, giving me choices without pushing, listening to me and keeping me informed about costs.

name: Samantha Thomas
text: I have always been very impressed with Dr Baileys work, knowledge and the manner in which he communicates with his patients. Everyone including Dr Baileys dental assistants and office workers have always gone above and beyond for me!

name: Betty Phillips
text: I felt very safe from Covid19 during my visit. It began with a call upon reaching the office and I was asked several questions regarding my health and exposure to Covid19. My temperature was taken and led into the office with doors opened by them. I was required to wear a mask up to being seated in dentist chair and after the procedure. Again door were opened for me. I only had contact with that person and the dentist. Great protocols all around!

name: larry hill
text: The best Dental office I’ve ever been to hands down. I won’t take my teeth anywhere else.

name: Mary Brantley
text: Absolutely fantastic. Very professional, personable and caring people.

name: Maxine Mintz

name: Bridgett Trammell

text:
Best dentists and staff!!!!
All outstanding!!!!

name: Brooklin Graves
text: Awesome experience even with the COVID-19 going on. Never disappointed and always satisfied. If your looking for a new dentist take a leap of faith and try Smith & Bailey and tell them Brooklin sent ya.

name: Kathy Heath
text: Dr. Smith, Bailey and their staff are extremely friendly, professional and helpful. They back up the quality of their work and quickly resolved my need every time. A clean-family friendly atmosphere. Thanks Smith and Bailey!! I was never a burden to you all, instead, you treated me like family!

name: Ivan Jimen
text: Best Dentists!!💝💝 Dr. Smith and Dr. Baily are super great at what they do. The staff are very thorough, I love going to the dentist because of how they treat us!!💝💝 they all treat us like family. Definitely recommend them⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: Samantha Carnes
text: We love Smith & Bailey Dental. With the pandemic we have going on in the US, they make our family feel so safe while still keeping our smiles beautiful and healthy.

name: Rachel Cline
text: We love this office. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They treat my children very well and keep them at ease. We recommend them to anyone looking for a dentist.

text: I’m terrified of the dentist, however every time I go here they make sure I am comfortable and I know each step. I’m so happy to call them my dentist

name: Casey Borch
text: the  whole team is great.  nice smiling faces when you check in and you can tell the doctors and ladies really care about your health and work hard to make you feel comfortable.  they are always busy but I never had to wait. very detail oriented. thank you for a totally different dental  office experience from what I have had in the past.

name: Jeff Poland
text: Courteous! Professional! Prompt!  Always checking your comfort. Great use of technology. Plenty of reminders of upcoming appointments. The Best!

name: Mary Gatgens
text: I went in today with a cracked tooth they were able to see me quickly, handling my issue and take care of me with great professionalism, and they scheduled appointments for specialist that worked with my off days from work. I have been a patient for a little over a year, I'm very pleased with Bailey Smith Dental. Great staff and physicians.

name: elizabeth peterson
text: I am a new patient and was warmly welcomed by the receptionist.  Everything was very clean and in order.  The hygienist was awesome she was gentle and effective.  They have state of the art equipment to care for your dental needs.  You can even watch tv while they work on your teeth.

name: Joseph Pullen
text: Excellent dental office; great office personnel, services and care.

name: Ashley Morgan
text: Love S&B! They are awesome with kids and very knowledgeable. The staff is kind and patient. We have never had to wait to be called back. Both dentists are great too!

text: Wonderful experience from the calm waiting room  the gentle hygienist and the professionalism in Dr Bailey and his expertise.

name: Diana J
text: Excellent practice!

name: Amanda Lukima
text: First of all I am terrified of the dentist but everyone there made me feel so comfortable especially Jessica! I would recommend to everyone I know! Thank you again for such a pleasant experience!

name: Shianne Hardy
text: They have always done and great job on my teeth

name: Tyler Cline
text: This practice is amazing. I will start with the fact that I have never had to wait past my appointment time. As a matter of fact, at my first appointment, they called me back while I was filling out my paperwork. Then when you are placed in a room, the rooms are very nice. Then there are the technicians and hygienists. I am an absolutely horrible dental patient. Before anything was done, they went out of their way to explain everything, and we're very caring and thorough. Both Dr. Smith and Dr. Bailey are extraordinarily kind people, and both excellent at their job. I cannot speak highly enough about this practice.

name: Jessica
text: I have been using Dr Smith for 4 years now. The best dentist in this town hands down! They have helped me financially as I have no dental insurance. Have always been very professional and treated me so kind. I have had emergency situations and Dr Smith came in on a  Saturday morning to fix my tooth.

name: Lisa Parker
text: From the minute I walked through the door, I was greeted with friendly faces.  The staff and Dr.'s were so kind to help calm my nerves and make me feel at ease.  So thankful that I found this dental office!!

name: Karah Grodt
text: I've been going to Smith & Bailey's for a year now. They're absolutely amazing! Very informative, helpful, and always friendly. I have not had to wait long to be seen (I think I've had 4 appts this past year). I'm in and out, and I feel comfortable through out my entire visit.

name: Kelly Conner
text: Great experience!

name: Seraphin Arcanus
text: Very friendly and professional.. Awesome Dentist, I wouldn’t go anywhere else.

name: I
text:
Dr. was extremely rough and I was sore for days after. Permanently damaged my gum and is till painful and it is visibly noticeable years later. I have to get corrected what they "fixed". Worst dental experience I have ever encountered.

I finally had the time and worked up the courage to find a highly recommended cosmetic dentist to have bonding corrected. To my horror my tooth was tampered with and filed down and had cracks from being sanded at this office. I also have had to make an appointment with a periodontist to try to avoid any further gum rescission and to prevent tooth loss. This is my experience and I wish it were further from the truth but it’s what happened to me when I chose this office to do simple bonding work. I will not be back to have anything “corrected”.

text: AWESOME! DIXIE IS THE BEST EVER!!!! SHE AND DR. BAILEY WORK PERFECTLY TOGETHER. AND I PLAN TO BRING MY GRANDAUGHTER TO SEE DIXIE FOR A CLEANING. THANKS SO MUCH FOR PUTTING MY SON BRADLEY AT EASE IN THE CHAIR DIXIE! YOU GUY'S ARE THE BEST,  ALL STAFF INCLUDED.

resp.text: Hey there, Ms. Brenda!  Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to leave us some feedback regarding your visit with our team!  We are very sorry to hear that the problem you were having was not resolved to your satisfaction.  Dr. James and his assistant, Alicia, would be more than excited to see if there are any other options available in hopes that we can all come together to reach the best solution for you!  If this interests you, please let us know so that we can have one of our patient coordinators reach out to you to get you in for quick, but thorough visit to discuss options.  Thank you, Ms. Brenda!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Danique Rouse
text: Katherine and Tracey were the first friendly faces that I met when I came in! Katherine made sure the check-in process was speedy and she was very informative, and she explained the day's process with me, which I greatly appreciated. Tracey was and is incredibly kind! She made me feel so comfortable from the start, especially when she reassured me about my facial piercings as I was afraid that I would have to remove them while they are still healing. She was also very knowledgeable and explained everything to me simply and clearly. I felt that I could relate to her and talk to her comfortably. Dr. Ferreira was so nice and had such a warm energy! She made me feel comfortable, and she also listened and aided me in my concerns about wanting braces, which no other dentist had done for me before. Summer, my hygienist, soothed my worries when she told me my treatment moving forward would be fairly easy. I was afraid that I hadn't been doing my part completely and that she would find something disastrous, but she said my teeth were great and gave me a few tips moving forward! Everyone in the office was extremely courteous, kind, and made the process painless. I was probably out of there within an hour or so and left more comfortable than when I came in. Thank you to everyone!

name: Brandon Rowand
text: I’ve had a lot of dentistry work done, and Aspen has definitely been one of the most welcoming and efficient dental offices I’ve been in!  The intake and wait was less than 10 minutes overall and everyone was incredibly knowledgeable and kind!  Tracey H, the dental assistant who helped me get started, was amazing and really helped the entire x-ray and exam process go by painlessly and easily. Will definitely be coming back in the future.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear you had a seamless visit, Brandon. Thank you for sharing your experience! - Mitch, ADMI

text: The office staff is amazing, they got me in on short notice, during my Emergency. I am very thankful for them.  With over 25 years as a Paramedic, I felt the treating staff could have a lot more empathy toward the patients, but that may come with time. This was a very painful experience, but I do thank them for seeing me on short notice. Apparently my ANTHEM Insurance does not pay for much at Aspin, so this would definitely not be a regular dentist for me, it should pay 80/20 but the quotes for me did not reflect anything even close to that.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Abb. If you would like to discuss this in more detail, please reach out to the Patient Satisfaction Team: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Suzan Graham
text:
First time with Aspen and we were a bit hesitant initially. I didn't like the idea of a chain dentist office, but having recently joined the military, I wanted to set my wife up with a place that would seem more consistent through multiple moves. I've seen the buildings around multiple places, so it seemed like a good idea to try it.
So far, we're very happy with the experience. My wife was happy with the people who worked with her, and the initial processing was pretty easy and very well explained. My favorite part was with Ms. Mayfield at the financial desk. She was very friendly, but also competent and efficient; put us immediately at ease.
I walked away feeling very confident that we understood her dental care plan and the expected costs associated with it. Financially, they were very transparent, and I definitely appreciated that after some previous experiences at other places.

resp.text: Susan, I'm so happy to hear your visit was successful and that you felt comfortable with the team. I hope you continue ot have 5-star experiences in the future! Keep on smiling. - Mitch, ADMI

name: TERRY Glisson
text: This place is a total scam and a ripoff do yourself a favor and don't go. I made an appointment for today to get a cleaning and I even made an extra trip before my appointment time for them to verify my insurance and I was told yes they take it. My insurance pays up to $1500.00 per year for dental. I get to my appointment and after waiting 35 minutes past my appointment time they take me back and do the x-ray then put in another room where a woman comes in and does a very brief look around my mouth and I am told I have no cavities but I do have a very bad build up on my teeth which is true. They also say I have mild periodontal disease which is probably true also but here is were it gets crazy. The tell I am going to see another woman to tell me what it will cost me. I said it shouldn't cost me anything my insurance pays up to $1500.00 to which they reply that the insurance will only cover a normal cleaning and since I need a deep cleaning I have to pay. Then they proceed to tell me that even with my insurance my cost for a deep cleaning will be anywhere from $2000.00 to $3500.00 I told them no way and that I thought they were crooks and walked out. After I left I did a Google search for what it should cost to have a deep cleaning done and it comes back the it should cost between $750.00 and $1200.00 meaning my insurance should have covered it. Now I have no idea how much they are gonna bill my insurance for what they did but I would bet it will take a huge chunk out of my $1500.00 of coverage so when I find a reputable dentist I now won't have the full amount available for that dentist. Do yourself a favor and don't ever go there the will rip you off.

resp.text: I am so sorry Terry, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

text: The staff was absolutely sweet, i was a little disappointed in the miss communication about pricing. I was told it would cost a little but but not $6 thousand dollars! I understand having to take care of the whole  thing but all I wanted to do was remove the ONE tooth with exposed nerve. I was told per the Dentist was supposed to prescribe me something for the horrible pain and i never got anything for the pain especially when it was Aspen who told me verbatim that they were going to send off something for the pain and never did. I ended up paying 53.00 on what was supposed to be a free visit. $53.00 to “ensure” my next appointment!!? Ive never even heard of having to do that and again if I don’t have insurance how in the world during this pandemic does anyone just have 6,0000 lying around??

name: Pelles Asher
text:
I had a consultation for a simple cleaning and chipped tooth. I left feeling like I was put through a machine! The appointment took twice the time I was quoted and I tried to wait for the person to make a follow up appointment but I ended up just wandering the halls until I found my way out. Im 40 years old and have been going to the dentist every 6 months of my entire life and I have never had such an "unfeeling" dental experience.

I have no dentures, partials, cavities and still felt like I was put through the ringer. I was not hurt, prodded, ridiculed or demeaned in anyway but I did not feel safe, comfortable or appreciated. I will not come back and I would never recommend Aspen. That being said I did get xrays and the dentist came in for a few moments to look in my mouth to verify I didnt have anything wrong. I am going back tomorrow to sign a HIPPA release to have the records and the xrays (I paid for!) released in 7-10 business day to the new dentist I chose over Aspen. Sigh.

I also was recommended a procedure that is not and was not necessary, i refused the chemical prescription strength mouthwash and denied the procedure but was told because I did not accept the (unnecessary debridement) gingivitis procedure that they would not clean (polish) my teeth. Appauled! I wish I could upload pictures of my teeth right now, they are perfect, gums and all. Im sorry but if I dont want to give $100 dollars out of pocket for an optional treatment I shouldn't have too.

Me, myself, and my cavity-less mouth won't ever be back and it would take hell or highwater to ever recommend them for anything other then ripping someones teeth out...which I heard one of their dentist talking about while I was there, I shuttered. Ever see the little shop of horrors dentist?!

Aspen, I get it youre a chain but going to the dentist sucks for everyone...find your roots, try not to be the Walmart of dentistry and Aspen if you do choose to become a WallyWorld, lower your prices for sh*t we dont need.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Pelles. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

However, upon calling Aspen Dental, not only did they find an appointment in the area -- that same afternoon -- the wonderful customer service rep (thank you again Peggy) put my wife down for a free first visit!!

I just can't say enough about the outstanding customer service! It was a pleasure doing business with Aspen. We are switching all of our dental care to this fantastic company. Great job!! Thank you all.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Ralph. Thanks for sharing! - Dawn, ADMI

name: keith cavender
text: I had a great experience with this aspen dental office. I had been in agony for 4 days. They were very accommodating and got me the first emergency appt they had. When I arrived at the office they checked me in on the phone in the parking lot in adherence to social distancing during this pandemic. They got me in after an extended wait. But bear in mind this was an emergency appt. Once inside they took a full set of xrays. The dentist came in and discussed the options with me all of which included the extraction of the tooth that had cause so much pain over the last few days. I met with the office manager, paid for the extraction, and went back to wait on the dentist to perform the extraction . I was moved to a procedure suite and the extraction was preformed under local anesthesia. I was released about 20 mins later. I was at the office almost 4 hours but again this was an emergency appt. I returned home and continue antibiotics prescribed by the emergency room 48 hours earlier. The swelling in my jaw and face is slowly going down. The pain is being controlled well with tylenol and advil. Give the fact that they made the emergency appt on Saturday for the first thing available and that I had to drive 40 miles to the office, I was grateful to get the appt as even emergency appointments during the pandemic are hard to get. The experience overall was positive and the staff was very friendly and professional. Thank you a gain for your help with this very painful and unexpected event. I will use aspen dental locally as a dental provider and recommend then to anyone whether having a dental crisis or for routine dental care. The treatment plan and cost are explained up front. They offer third party financing should you need it which could have been a viable option had it been necessary. Thanks again Aspen Dental. Great customer service and great dental service. The cost to get the tooth removed that had caused me such agony for days was $134. Fortunately I had the money to pay for the services. I highly recommend their services.

resp.text: I'm so glad that the team was able to accommodate you, Keith. Thanks for sharing that it was a positive experience! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Eric Chamberlin
text:
I made an appointment with Aspen Dental back in January because they could get me in on short notice. Most of the other dentists I contacted had about a 3 to 4 week wait. The day I arrived they provided me with x-rays and a quick inspection which included reading a bunch of numbers that were above 5 when they measured my teeth. Shortly thereafter they informed me I needed a deep cleaning procedure and a bunch of other treatments. Of course this procedure was going to be over $1,000 out of my own pocket. It was not covered by my insurance. They also informed me of a cavity that would need a root canal and it would be a separate procedure at an endodontist they recommended that of course would be more. They then tried to get me to go into a small room and sign paperwork to pay for the procedure. I left and figured I would get a second opinion.

I decided to wait and made an appointment with Complete Family Dental also in Phenix City. They were able to do a cleaning for me and also fix my cavity tooth with a filling rather than a root canal and Crown. My insurance also covered almost all of the procedures and total cost out of pocket was only $150.

Also there was no deep cleaning procedure necessary and the numbers they read when measuring my teeth were all three or less.

It should be noted that I did not inform Complete Family Dental that I had visited Aspen. I wanted to see what they would say to make sure I wasn't being ripped off and if I indeed needed a deep cleaning procedure or a root canal.  Furthermore the dentist at Complete Family Dentistry fixed another filling free of charge because he noticed some decay building up behind that filling on the same tooth he was fixing already. I had my tooth fixed just this week. Definitely worth the wait.

I recommend getting a second opinion if Aspen tries to get you for their 'deep cleaning' procedures.

The staff is friendly enough, but you can tell that they've all been brainwashed with corporate training sessions to push the vulnerable into unnecessary treatments. Victoria is particularly cutthroat and snarky.

I'm glad that they didn't get any money from me. The initial exam was enough to see that this is the used car sales of dentistry. Save your time, money and sanity. Steer clear of this dental practice.

name: M E
text:
They gave me such an amazing experience. When I first called, I got the call center and they were not very knowledgeable nor helpful. However the actual physical office is great. I do not have insurance so I was able to get my initial exam and conaultation free, no hidden fees. They were very thorough and had 4 different types of professionals exam me so I got a great idea of how my oral health is and what my next steps are. I only waited about 8 minutes after arrival before I was called back. The whole first appointment was only about 45 minutes.
I went back 2 weeks later for a tooth extraction. Doctor Sara was absolutely amazing. She is so friendly helps keep you calm and very understanding. I was in and out in about 25 mins. It was completely pain free. I appreciate that they charge way way less than others around. I paid less than $150 here when other dentists quoted me $300+ for a simple extraction. I did have complications a few days later but Doctor Sara saw me right away as a walkin and she solved my problem. I will be going back here for all my needs for now on. If you do not have insurance and you are on a tight budget, this is the place for you. No doubt.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear this. It’s so great to hear this about the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. — Dawn, ADMI

text: Be prepared to have an expensive deep cleaning that is not necessary and won't be covered by 99% if insurances. They charge way more than what is Reasonable & Customary for their services. Make sure your insurance actually covers the specific Dentist who works on your teeth!!! They immediately say they take all major insurances but then your insurance doesn't pay because the provider who saw you hadn't completed an application or re-certification to be a participating network provider. When you call and question this, they throw it back at you that it was your responsibility to make sure that specific provider is in the network. How are you supposed to know exactly who will be working on your teeth and that they aren't covered when you are already said you take the insurance?!?!? Basically, they don't take all major insurance and you will be stuck to pay for the entire work that is done. No wonder they sucker you into signing up for financing to pay for the work. They are great at a bait and hook tactic. What a nightmare and all this because of a stupid tooth ache!!!

text:
Just wasnt happy when i left. Came in with a tooth ache and left with motrin and a 2 week wait. All they seem concerned with is very expensive treatments. I have insurance but it still doesnt cover the level of services they wanted to do. And when i asked about staggering and doing what is affordable they then told me that unless i went with this super expensive plan they would not be willing to do any other work. Even filling a cavity.   They kept pushing their dental credit card on me and when i expressed concern about a dental credit card they assumed i had poor credit and told me they accept co-signers.   I have decent insurance why should i need a credit card for some deep cleaning...  when has deep cleaning ever cost 4k?    Once i went to the dentist for the Root canal he also told me that Aspen is known for pushing expensive procedures and their credit card on people. He reccomended what he called a “normal” dentist and thats where i will be getting my crown done.

One good thing about aspen is everything is state of the art and it feels like a expensive clinic for the 1%. So if u can afford it i bet they are great. Just not budget friendly like they proclaim.

text: Please do not go here especially if you are on a budget. You may go in to have a simple toothache addressed because they are convenient and can get you right in. By the time you walk out, they have taken advantage of your state of pain and know you aren't thinking clearly due to the toothache and then before you know it you have this dental plan of action that will cost thousands of dollars. They know you don't have that kind of money available, so they have you sign up for their credit and have changes even before the work has been done. I wish we had read social media reviews before we went there because we are now in the same situation with the horrible experience.

If you need any additional care in the future or would like to discuss the care plan you had received during your visit, we’d still be happy to help. You can reach me directly at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Jeremy Kline
text: Worst possible experience for a routine check up ever in my life. I'm 38 and retiring out the army. So I've had plenty of dentist experiences over the years. First off it's a brand new facility. Yet some how when you walk in you get hit with a horrible smell. Once you get past the smell it wssnt to bad until they wanted 18 xrays of my teeth. Okay not to bad of a idea so they can see everything. Except you will have to listen to the ridiculous joke that the xray tech has patients drool over her all the time. Ok it's a joke I'm ok with that except I had to hear it multiple times. Along with other jokes and comebacks that you may be thinking in your head right now. Then I have to question  how sterile the equipment is. Like I said I had to get 18 xrays. So I had to bit the tools to do so while sitting in a computer chair. There is a plastic sleeve to cover the exposed parts except the metal they want you to bit down on. Then I move to a room and the actual dental experience not so bad and quick. 10 mins to check for cavities. 10 minutes to check my gums. That might be kinda long it was actually very quick. Then I had to sit there and wait for some new employment paper work as I realize I watched 2 episode of daytime TV. I havent seen anyone in a long time. I start to ask my wife via text I wonder if they forgot about me. I go look for someone and finally ask of I'm waiting on something still. I'm told I'm waiting on the facility manager. Who is with a patient hmm. 20 minutes later I get called to their office asked if I had any questions. Then was like no but this was ridiculous and I'll never come back I've been here 2 hours for a check up that i had a appointment for. They said ok thank you. So not even a apology that their service took so long. So I would not recommend this facility to anyone unless you feel like wasting your entire day. Now it's not like it was a ton of paper work it was all filled out it just needed a signature. Which was signed by the dentist when they completed the exam. So I'm not even sure what the facility manager had to do. But if that is the level of management at a new facility they need a new manager immediately. I also wish I could give negative stars.

resp.text: I am sorry you did not have a positive experience Jeremy; If would like to discuss the care plan you received during your visit or you need any additional care in the future, we’d still be happy to help or address any questions. — Kelly, ADMI

text: Nicest people I’ve ever met. Everything was done timely, and they explained any questions I had. I had a small hiccup with insurance not covering me, but was quickly helped to resolve said issues. Fully staffed with skilled employees, I never felt any lack of dental knowledge by any of the staff.

resp.text:
Thank you Jesse for the nice review! I am so happy that we were able to work things out with your insurance, so that you can continue your dental treatment. Thank you also for coming in and talking to me. Great to see you again!!

Hi Jesse. I am sorry that you are having problems with YOUR insurance company. I have many, many patients with BC/BS insurance whose services are paid for by BC/BS. Please know that with BC/BS there are many, many benefit levels on these individual plans. These plans are elected and paid for by your employer or yourself but reimbursed at different rates. The higher the premium results in better coverage. We have found that some plans pay very well while others cause the patient to pay more in principle than what is actually received as a benefit. Due to the confusion and the large number of insurance plans we call the insurance company as a courtesy to verify coverage for all new patients before seating them for treatment. With the information given to us from an insurance company like BC/BS we quote patient portions and offer advice to maximize benefits, but we can only be as accurate as the information that is given to us. Unfortunately, in this healthcare business there are times that claims are denied. Insurance companies are in business to be profitable for their investors. Usually, with additional patient information, documentation, charting and pictures that we obtain on your first visit, the claim can be refiled once we know why the claim was denied in the first place. If you bring your Explanation of Benefits to the office next week, I personally will help you resolve this so that you may be reimbursed or I will offer a refund that resulted from any error made by my office. I look forward to hearing from you next week. Sincerely, René A. Talbot, DDS (256)881-8181

name: Jay Gilmore
text:
I'm in the grocery store shopping for toothpaste and I had to stop and pause. Which toothpaste should I use when I no longer have tooth sensitivity?

Dr. Talbot was my DDS for two years when I worked in Huntsville. After I moved away she allowed the doors of communication to remain open. I could call the office, and she would get back with me.

Earlier this year I was having some pain and sensitivity issues and my Dentist here gave me the run around and the pain persisted for months. I reached out to Dr. Talbot and explained my symptoms. She told me it sounded like I needed a root canal. She had me email her my X-rays and she consulted me from afar. She even told me to seek out an Endodontist for best results.

I got with a specialist and when he  finished my root canal, my pain and sensitivity was gone. She took the time to speak to me and she wasn't getting a co-pay or anything. She was caring because she takes a personal interest in each and every patient that comes through her door.

She is knowledgeable, professional and passionate about dentistry and and I so grateful one of my former colleagues recommended her. I'd recommend her to anyone in the Huntsville, AL area.

resp.text: Thank you Jay!! I have enjoyed keeping in contact with you through the years and giving advice even from afar!!

name: Dewayne Holcomb
text: Dentist worked on my teeth for 4 hours and refused to write anything for pain. She left the building before i was able to speak with anyone and the receptionist said this practice was completely normal... I dont know how anyone could think that is normal i asked her if I worked on her teeth for muliple hours would she expect to be written something anything for pain. Mind you she had written pain meds on the first visit and refused to change the script after i found out i was allergic to what she had wrote. Also they quoted one price and my insurance had told me something completely different which when i called to ask about it and try to finish the procedure that was already billed to my insurance company they refused to finish the work unless i paid them what they had quoted me. I dont understand how a practice gets good reviews unless they are fake or she treats her long time patients differently and if I had just been searching for pain meds I wouldn't have done the procedure through them I would have kept searching and I will never go back here and hope that if you are reading this please reconsider and try to find a dentist that will actually care about how you feel and not blatantly lie which she told me I could make payments on the balance but apparently not if I wanted to complete the procedure I would of had to come up with the rest now I have a temporary crown that came off the second day and no way to fix the work she started and billed the complete price for.. Just amazes me how greedy and self centered people have become. Especially when your insurance pays thousands for hours of work and we get paid in pennies comparatively... Good riddance hope all her and her staff have to face issues like I have had recently. Maybe they will rethink their attitudes then.

resp.text:
Hi Dewayne.

We take these matters very seriously, unfortunately, you are not a patient of record within my office. I have very sophisticated dental software and I know for certain that you have NEVER been a patient of mine. I also have no recollection of any patient experience ever fitting this description. Personally I warranty all of my work and financial arrangements are made prior to the preparation appointments, so my patients are never left in temporaries and there is no confusion regarding fees. If you were actually a patient of mine, I would happily complete your work or offer your money back to have your procedure completed elsewhere.

I certainly would like to investigate this issue further, please contact me at info.yourhuntsvilledentist@gmail.com or (256)881-8181, so that we can resolve this issue immediately.

Thank you so much,
Dr. René A. Talbot

09/26/2018
To date Dwayne Holcomb never contacted our office to resolve this matter. It is in our opinion that Mr. Holcomb reviewed the wrong dentist.

No one bothered to explain that is not part of a new patient appointment. The X-ray process was very painful. My mouth felt like it went through a meat grinder. The tech repeatedly said how sorry she was, this is a common problem, etc. THEN WHY ISN'T THE PROCESS CHANGED? I had plenty of apologies, but that did not change the fact that I spent 2.5 hours there and my teeth were not even cleaned! At the end of the appointment, my insurance information was not even entered in the computer and I had to be called the next day with an estimate of how much it would cost to get my teeth cleaned. ($223 after my insurance and a discount!) There were no options......I did what they recommended or I would not be treated. PERIOD.
The staff was curteous and appologized profusely, but that does not make up for poor customer service and a horrible experience.
