name: Benjamin Ward
text:
I'm no dentist and certainly not an expert on these kinds of things. I'm not one to write bad reviews on businesses but, I think someone needs to say something about this place.

I went to Aspen Dental in Madison with a brown spot on my tooth thinking it was a cavity. I went through their free exam and X-rays. They found that I had periodontal disease as well, which did turn out to be true.

The dentist, either inexperienced or dishonest, told me that my "cavity" was too close to the gum line to drill and that I would need to have a crown put on (roughly $1,200). She also recommended about $6,000 worth of other work.

I have no insurance and the financing person couldn't work with me due to my low income. I left depressed thinking that my mouth was really messed up and that I needed more work than I could ever afford. Thankfully, I got a second opinion.

The second dentist I went to took an X-ray, and looked at my tooth. He informed me that I did have periodontal disease and needed a deep cleaning but, that the brown spot that "Doctor A" wanted to put a $1,200 crown on was not a cavity or even decay. I had my first deep cleaning session and the spot ("cavity") came right off. Again, I'm not dentist but, I'm pretty sure cavities don't just come off.

I thought about just letting this go and not saying anything about it but, I wonder how many people have been screwed over by this business.

My thoughts are that Madison is a fairly wealthy city and most people have insurance or the money for dental work so, they take the recomendations of an "expert" without a second thought. It makes me wonder how many people's mouths and wallets have been ruined by this office. This Madison office has good reviews but, if you look around online, the chain is poorly rated all over the country.

I do not recommend Aspen Dental in Madison. It's strictly for profit, not for people.

name: Zidane
text:
The entire process was a sales pitch.  From the moment your name is called until you exit the front door someone in that building is trying to sell you something. I had 4 different people try to sell me a $200 toothbrush with a $30 mail in rebate. Both the hygenist and dentist were talking and selling other dental procedures but did not discuss what I came in for.

I went to Aspen Dental for tooth pain and wanted the tooth extracted. I asked before making the appointment if this was a type of procedure they'd do. They said yes. So I made an appointment. I showed up and everyone had a fake plastic smile as if we were playing We Happy Few (Google it). I felt so out of place. When I was finally seen the dental hygenist looked at my teeth for about 10 to 15 minutes then spent 30 to 45 minutes talking about how deep of a cleaning I needed, how much everything was going to cost, how important doing that there was, then pushed how they could do it now and it was only $93 (which I found out later was NOT true. It was in total $186). I declined and mentioned my pain and tooth extraction. She brought up that tooth brush and rebate and I had to listen to another 10 minute talk. Then the dentist came in. Another 10 minutes of poking and proding my teeth with a huge fake We Happy Few smile followed by a 45 minute conversation about MORE treatments I needed and AGAIN WITH THE DANG TOOTHBRUSH! I mentioned my tooth and pain again and she replied with "Oh no I have to refer you to an oral surgeon. Sorry." Why couldn't you just say that!? Why did you have to talk for over 30 minutes about all this other junk while Im sitting there nearly in tears from pain as you sell?

Now, let's talk billing. After all those sales pitches you're sent to billing where someone talks forever about payment plans and the debt you have in dental work. Mind you, NONE OF THIS COVERED WHY I WAS THERE! They hardly wanted to talk about my pain or the extraction I asked for. Just how they wanna fill and clean and polish all my other teeth. I felt trapped. Not to mention they "referred me" to someone in Birmingham with the billing guy "texting him and taking pics of my xrays". Felt VERY under the table black market because I asked twice for his information and both times I was told "Oh if you want an appointment we can do it for you and text you the way to get there and stuff." Wouldnt even tell me his name or phone number. VERY sketchy.

Later on, I felt uncomfortable about this "Birmingham guy" and the $350 extraction he wanted to do and how he wanted to use gas, which I did not want because Ive heard bad horror stories about it, so I asked for them to send me my xrays because I wanted to show them to my local dentist. That's when the real moods kicked in. The friendly atmosphere was gone. They wanted no part in sharing my medical records with myself. Before they were "willing to send them anywhere" and were texting them to strangers I didnt even know! Now they decline. I was told if I wanted them I had to go get them or I could just go get new xrays. I told them I did not want to be exposed to radiation again for no logical reason so I would go get them. So I did. Drove 40 min back and was given ONE of my twelve or so xrays. ONE! No fake smiles or sales pitches this time though! Just a lot of eye rolling and weird stares.

In conclusion, they are so happy to get you in there and they flood you with information and dental work with very little processing time. Now, Im not afraid of dentists but this place got me nervous and scared. It wasnt the physical look of the place. It wasn't rude treatment. It was the huge fake smiles and how the whole time you felt like a cash cow they just wanted to milk for money.

TL;DR: All fake smiles and the entire process was a sales pitch, didn't care for my actual problem. Just wanted to sell me $1800 in dental work that had nothing to do with my original issue and a $200 tooth brush. Very reluctant to give me my own records and made the process a hassle. Overall, do NOT recommend this place.

name: Samantha Palmer
text: Recently had my teeth cleaned and then a few weeks afterwards had a couple of fillings and a crown put on a molar. I loved the fact that it's a pretty small office so they don't schedule a bunch of people at once, and everyone is warm and friendly.  I've been to places that felt like an assembly line, and this didn't feel that way at all - everyone had plenty of time to chat, answer my questions, and make me feel comfortable. Fillings and crowns are never pleasant, but Dr. Macbeth and his staff did a great job making it as positive experience as possible.  The equipment/technology they use is really amazing and made my dental work a lot easier.  Instead of having a dental mold made and the crown taking two weeks, they scanned my mouth and made the crown in office the same day.  That alone saved me so much time and energy.  I'll definitely be back! N

resp.text: Thank you so much Samantha!  We enjoyed meeting you and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Paul Lawrence
text:
If you need a dentist, no matter where you live, this is the place to be.
The fact that as soon as I walked through the door, Kathy knew who I was and greated me by name despite never actually meeting me before tells you the level of care and detail in your experience.

They were very concise and prompt about everything they did. You are kept fully aware through every single step of the procedures so much that they are actually teaching you about your teeth. You are encouraged to ask questions along the way so you can fully understand and deepen your learning for proactive care in the future. Rhonda was fantastic at facilitating this. A valuable asset for sure.

The facility itself is nothing less than cutting edge. So cutting edge that in every attempt they will reduce the total amount of visits and time spent in the chair in total (as they understand going to the dentist is not typically the top of the list for most people). There’s even a screen on the ceiling so, if you wish to, you can watch and see everything that is happening while they explain it.

It is like being at a 5* hotel- but at a dentist. Not sure I could ever imagine an oxymoron such as this, but Dr. MacBeth and his team have accomplished this. Thank you, congrats, and keep up the great work!

- update 10/4/19

These guys are not only the best, but consistent! Kathy was always smiling and positive at the at the front desk and made sure everything was totally understood so far as billing and working with the insurance.
It was great to catch up with Rhonda again who is so personable and professional in what she does. Thank you!

I had multiple treatments that day - and I was DONE IN 3 hours - including a bunch of fillings and 2 crowns (which they made there and then!) and Shana and Dr MacBeth worked like clockwork to get it done, while having fun at the same time!
The next day I often didnt realise I had it all done as my teeth just felt normal - totally not what I expected. The work is phenomenal!

Totally blown away by this team - sounds strange, but I cant wait to go back!!!

Thank you once again!

resp.text: Thank you so much and we are happy that you enjoyed your visit with us!  We try to make every patient feel as special as you did today and we hope that you continue to share your great experience with everyone!

name: Kathy Saxer
text: I have anxiety from a traumatic experience in my past with dentist. As soon as the staff realized this, they were patient and extremely kind, compassionate, and non judgmental. Following an xray, Dr Robinson came in and was patient, professional, and kind. She prescribed me pain medicine for excruciating pain I had dealt with all weekend due to a Friday visit with a dentist in Fairhope who would do nothing for me unless I had it extracted that day or Saturday without being on antibiotics. As an RN I know with this type of issue you have to be on antibiotics for awhile before extracting a tooth to avoid further infection. I now have antibiotics, dealing with the pain, and a treatment plan which is reasonable and medically sound. I will continue to go to Sounthern Dentistry, recommend to anyone, and my family will be transferring to them. They are compassionate, kind, professional and non judgemental! I am truly grateful to Southern Dentistry!

Now my 2 youngest were a little rambunctious and when I went to the back, the nurses were so nice to entertain my children.
Now I've had experience were if another place had an opening they would call and get me in sooner and it never worked. Well let me tell you the receptionist is nice and caring she was consistently staying on top of everything. She was making sure the patients that were on the move up list were able to get moved up as soon as there was an opening.
I had an appointment a month out to get my wisdom tooth pulled, but I was assured if there was an opening available she would call and let me know. Just over a week later there was a cancelation and she was able to get me in. I am so thankful my mouth is a little sore now but nothing compared to what it was like before. text: I have really bad anxiety and scared of the dentist. This place offers gas which I needed and EVERYONE there were so nice. The dentist also turned on music (It was country but I don't hold that against him lol) which helped distract me while he worked. The dentist is a good hearted human being. I felt like the entire staff weren't nice to do their "job" but they were nice because they are good people. They were also very nice to my baby I brought with me. I recommend this place 100% especially if you suffer from bad anxiety.

name: Cindy Sellers
text: The single worst dental office I have ever had the displeasure of going to. First appt I had cleaning all went well. Second appt was scheduled for cleaning and beginning of crown. I received a call at 300pm on Friday that my 9am appt on Monday had to be rescheduled due to no hygienist to be able to do the cleaning. They had NO problem telling me that I had to reschedule. After throwing a fitime they finally decided to let the dentist do the cleaning. So all went well clean teeth and the work done and crown temporary applied. Scheduled the follow-upbased on work schedule and was called a few days prior and was advised that they had decided to close the office on Thursday's and I was told. . You have to reachedule. 2 days ago the temp crown fell off during the night and was lost.. Called and got an emergency appt at 850a was told that appt would be less than 40 min and they were very clear that I had to be at work 30 mins away by 11. After sitting there for 55 min in the waiting room I finally had to cancel and reschedule that appt. because I could no longer wait. This dental practice is all about them and care very little about the patients and the fact that we book our appts make arrangements for time off and then have them act like its a total inconvenience to them that you ask for your money back because you didn't receive any services. .RUN LIKE HECK TO A DIFFERENT DENTAL PRACTICE..

resp.text: I am so sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction with our office.  We are a small office that loves our patients and treat them like special individuals.  On a rare occasion that will cause us to run a little behind schedule.  We make every effort to communicate with any patient that will be affected by the delay.  I am so sorry that we didn't handle it at your satisfaction.  Please call me and let me know what I can do to make it up to you.                                       Sincerely your, Diane Lai Office manager

We are all so sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction.  I am truly saddened that you had such a bad experience.  Our desire for you is to find a dental home where you are comfortable and satisfied.  Please contact me and let me know how I can care for you and your family better in the future.

Diane Lai
Office Manager

name: Charles Story
text: First time visit. Typical Exam, X-Rays. We checkout and ask, how much do we owe? We’re told from an Aspen employee that the first visit is free. So I get a bill in the mail, $198. Insurance paid $120, Aspen discounted $61, I owe $17. How is this free? I saw the ad was free for the uninsured but how in the World is that even fair for those who pay monthly for dental insurance? Regardless, we told the employee we had insurance and they stated, didn’t matter, first visit is free. We went in confident that this dental would be the best choice for our disabled son but when you’re issued out a lie on the first visit, it’s a game changer. We want the x-rays, they’re paid for. We must move on.

resp.text: I'm so sorry to hear about the trouble you're having. The team and I would be happy to help with billing concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Elise Cassell
text: The staff word knowledgeable, friendly and efficient. The only complaint I have is the high cost of services for patients that do not have dental insurance. Wish it could be more affordable.

resp.text: Hi Elise, I am so glad you enjoyed the experience with the team. We appreciate your feedback about the pricing. I will share your thoughts with our team so that we can improve the patient experience. The direct phone number is 1-866-767-0890. Be well. – Cindy ADMI

text: Just an initial visit, we set up a plan of action and got payment worked out. Staff was very friendly can't wait for my procedure. They really helped to calm my nerves 🙂

name: Tammy Landreth
text: Just another number and deposit into their bank account! Everyone was very polite and courteous. Spent 2.5 hours between x-rays, waiting for the Hygienist,  being examined,  waiting,  waiting,  waiting for the Dentist. Dentist comes in, he was very polite,  professional, very knowledgeable. Really liked the staff and what he was teaching,  then had to wait again for someone else to come get me,  waited and waited,  for the Financial advisor to come.  Then had to wait again! Total time was 2 hours 47 minutes,  but only spent 33 minutes TOTAL with ANYONE! The computer magically crashed,  so they couldn't tell me what the work would actually cost me after insurance! The grand total...$11,000.... basically a cleaning, 3 crowns, and an upper denture! But, they said that they would call me in a few days after they contacted insurance!

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear this and can understand your frustration, Tammy. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience: 1-866-767-0890. - Krista, ADMI

name: Steven Tonn
text:
I went to Aspen Dental in Athens Alabama.
The Dr. there then - Dr. Walker is a wonderful Dr. & Person. I hate he's moved to Baldwin County. He is traveling back to Athens to take care of his previous patients like me. I saw him Sat 05/22/21 & picked up my teeth that he RE-MADE for me that the Aspen Dental on Bob Wallace in Huntsville made for me Feb 2020 that did not fit my mouth or fit together at all - I have not been able to eat w/those at all. Dr.Walker did not have to do that!
It took awhile bc he had to use The Aspen Dental labs that never followed his instructions. Dr.Walker upgraded my dentures!
The Manager - Greg @ Aspen in Athens is also a good man. They now have there in house lab tech back. My Dentures are a perfect fit & the bite fits together perfect. 15.5 months later I can now eat with teeth & I am Extremely
HAPPY!!! THANK YOU DR.WALKER!!! THANK YOU GREG THE MNGR!!! & THANK YOU JEFF THE IN HOUSE LAB TECH!!!

resp.text: I'm so glad you're finally enjoying your new smile, Steven. Thanks for taking a moment to share you appreciation! - Krista, ADMI

name: Ronda Myers
text: They were very nice, they examined my mouth really good. The doctor was great in explaining that it was a process and it would take some time. The call center had said i could possibly get them that day. I was devastated but they were really sweet about it. Understanding compassionate and was really thoughtful. I realized once there it would not be possible in one evening but they did put me on the cancelation, moved my next appt up 4 days. They really were very good to me. They understood I was a shut in until we could get the dentures made. I really would recommend the Huntsville store on Bob Wallace. The financial gentleman was wonderful, kind, understanding, didn't push no more on me that I didn't want at the moment. I thought that was really great. No pressure. The tech that did my x-rays was gentle and the girl that did my impressions was thoughtful and did a really good job to get me squeezed in and my appt moved up 4 days. The girl that greeted me at the service desk was very helpful and professional. I was greeted upon arrival and ackowledged by all as I left. Even put up with my crying. Very kind and considerate. Even without dentures and crying I felt better leaving then I did arriving. Thank you

name: Michael Smith
text: I have a HUGE fear of the dentist. I’ve had multiple fillings, etc done elsewhere with full feeling and no trust in other dentists. I could tell they didn’t care about myself, only the check I cut them. Although I’ve had a single encounter here, it was such an experience I felt I had too share with all of you. Jessica at the main desk went over and beyond too take care of me and get me in ASAP for extreme some extreme pain. Every employee here treats you like family. They truly care about the mental and physical well being of their patients. These guys have taken my business for good. Dr. Abtin was incredibly soft spoken and made me feel like everything was going too be okay despite feeling like I was shot in the face. This dentist is the perfect fit for anyone with a phobia of teeth. If you’re reading this, and are in similar shoes as I was, this is your sign too check them out!! You won’t find better service in the TVA!  Thank you guys for everything you’ve done so I can come home and eat whatever I want without fear! I can’t wait for my future visits to change my 1/10 smile to a 10/10!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Michael. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Dawn, ADMI

text: I have never been treated with such kindness and empathy from any dental staff as i have with Aspen Dental! I was so nervous I ended up calling the day prior to my appointment and explained how terrified i was to the house manager (I believe that’s what he was called). He assured me they would respect my feelings and no one would make me feel bad for my teeth... I can honestly say he is a man of his word! name: Kim Lang
text: I went cause I have 4 teeth that need to be fixed. 1 is broken and the other 3 are cracked. I have been hurting. They did the xrays and exam. We went over the cost of my options. One over 8,000 and one to get them pulled over 1,000. They wanted me to get a deep clean before any work was done too that's 265 I think. So this was on Thursday and around Tuesday one of the teeth started hurting so bad ...I can't eat...hard to drink anything. The pain is very bad. I called on Thursday I told them what was going on ...ask if they could at least for now pull it. I could pay for it. I would worry about the others later when my insurance will pay. I was told they couldn't work me in until the 24th now this is the 6...so I said I can't wait that long I am in serve pain. She told me that's best they could do.I said what am I suppose to do? They told me to go to the ER or call around. NOW IS THE WAY THEY SHOULD HAVE DONE ME? NO THIS IS SO WRONG. I GUESS MY CASH ISNT GOOD ENOUGH FOR THEM. I HAD 3 PEOPLE THAT WANTED TO GO THERE AND ASK ME ABOUT THEM I TOLD THEM DONT GO THERE....GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. I HAVE WRITTEN A LETTER TO MAIN OFFICE. THIS IS DISCRIMINATION IN MY EYES. CAUSE THEY CLAIM TO TAKE WALK IN EMERGENCY PEOPLE BUT CANT WORK ME IN. 😤😤😤😤

text:
First impressions are everything! name: Bonnie Buck
text:
Had an infected tooth that needed to be extracted after antibiotics.
Their  ad says 117 for extraction and x ray, exam and initial visit are free. I had a 3:15 apt and my doctor finally came in at 7:15. He went over exam and noted that I had an infection. He thought the tooth should be extracted. In order to get the tooth out, I would have to pay $381.00 and they would schedule another apt. to remove the tooth. I have no insurance and this was much more than discussed so I ask for an antibiotic until I could get the tooth out. I was told no, that doctors were handing out antibiotics like candy! I left the office in the same pain I went in with!

resp.text: Hi Bonnie, I'm really sorry that you didn't have a positive experience. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 844-296-0187 EXT 201152. - Julie, ADMI

name: Elaine W
text: Came in today as a new patient. Very pleased that I was able to get in three weeks ahead of when I had initially scheduled on the 28th, but not so pleased about the wait. I also liked how I was able to come in later rather than first thing in the morning. I read the other reviews before posting this and do not understand the last review about Mrs. Jessica having an awful attitude. She went above and beyond to make me comfortable with bringing me water, helping fill out paperwork on the Apple as I forgot my glasses, and even getting me a blanket once we were in the room as they keep it frigid inside. We had a lovely chat and she even let me show her pictures and made me feel at ease as I told her I have an awful fear of the dentist. I did not like when they took my xray as they kept jamming it into my mouth and the girl doing it seemed very annoyed and like she would rather be elsewhere. I heard her talking negative about other patients with another girl in scrubs while she was doing my xrays as well which makes me wonder what they said about me and my silly fears. She left me in the room for over an hour waiting for the dentist, and the girl at the front came and checked on me more than the xray girl in scrubs did. I enjoyed meeting with the hygienist I belive her name was Miranda as she explained everything I needed done and was very understanding about my fears. She even spoke to me about possibly numbing it before she did any work which definitely makes me feel like I found the right place. The dentist Dr. Ebby was very kind and had kind eyes. He seemed to genuinely care and made jokes to make me feel more at ease once we were in the room. I’m sure he has a nice smile but I couldn’t see with the mask on. He was definitely better than my last dentist who didn’t care about people of my age and only want money. He seemed to want to help me get what was best for me and not drain the little savings I have left. When i spoke about the money to man at the end named Austin he was an absolute sweetheart. I have never met someone so understanding and kind, and he even went out of his way to give me more adorable options and let me take up so much of his time just to make sure I would be able to afford what I need. He gave me his personal office number and told me to call him with any questions. I learned later from the front girl he was the office manager and I find it so refreshing that an office manager is willing to spend that much time with a woman like me to make sure I’m taken care of. The level of care I received was unbelievable and I truly feel like I found a place where I am cared for and taken care of financially and healthily. I would give 5 stars but I do not appreciate the rude xray girl and the wait was rather long.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you for taking a moment to let us know about the experience you had during your visit. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Lynne Daly
text:
Absolutely wonderful dentist and staff. Could not have been more kind and compassionate. They were right on top of serious issues and I could not be more thrilled!!  They have a lifelong patient

My first review (above) still stands.  It is now months later and I have my final dentures. Dr. Abtin Iranmanesh is the consummate professional with a very big heart and compassionate  side. When I first net him, I had been the victim of extreme dental malpractice from another local so-called dental franchise. I was in dire shape. Dr. Iranmanesh 'took me under his wing' and today I am finished with my treatment plan, out of pain and have a beautiful smile. I could not be more pleased with my outcome. Many others in that office have been very kind and helpful as well. When I first started treatment at this office, it was brand new and barely established. I received a lot of personal attention and there was no issue getting the needed appointments. I do miss that part. Their popularity has grown along with the number of patients. That is a great thing for the business but not so for the patients unfortunately. I guess I was spoiled in the beginning.  However, Dr. Iranmanesh has always made sure I was well taken care of and given the best treatment available. I am very happy to say that this was a story with a happy ending.

resp.text: Lynne, thanks for taking the time to let us know, ! The office will be so happy to read this. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Larry n Heidi Burger
text:
I started with Dr Cook 3 years ago.   I have a terrible fear of the dentist.  I mean the kind of paralyzing, crying kind of fear.   My mom was a dental assistant when I was a kid and she was always with me.  As an adult she still went with me.  When she passed away I just didn’t go back..

I had an issue and found Dr Cooks office.   I shared my fear and they put me at ease.  They didn’t make me feel childish or crazy.  He is amazing.  He takes his time to relax you with his sense of humor and he is gentle.   Another thing that may not matter to you but it did to me, he has a strong faith.  You can feel that being around him.  I feel I could go to anyone in that office with a fear or concern and they would talk me thru it.  Or even pray thru it if that is what was needed.

While this is his practice it’s a team effort.  He has the best staff.  Everyone in the office is there working together.  They feel like a family and make you apart of that.

An example... While in the office I got a call that a family member had passed, one of the ladies sent a sympathy card.  Another time after some serious dental work they called on a weekend just to check on me.

You can not go wrong by choosing Dr Cook and his staff...

name: David Attig
text:
Edit: Since I guess you want details, the reasons for me not visiting your practice again and leaving the least number of stars available are separate.

Not visiting anymore:
My tooth was in no pain at all until you prepared it for a crown.  The pain persisted after placing the permanent crown (on the second try, and it still did not look great on the X-ray).  I gave up on you as a dentist after the third or fourth bite-adjustment that did not solve the problem.  On the most recent visit (after my new dentist told me to go back to the person who placed the crown to get it re-done), you said that this crown is "perfect" and told me to go to an endodontist.  You also mentioned that you had told me before that the root could be damaged from previous tooth decay - you had not told me this about this specific tooth in the past, only a different tooth on which you had already performed a root canal.  According to the endodontist that did perform a root canal, the roots were in good shape - there is a crack in my tooth underneath the crown, which was the source of pain whenever debris got in the crack and irritated the root.  Whether this crack was because of a poor bite when I first got the crown or something else, I guess I'll never know.

Zero Stars: You lied to me.  I am listing several instances here, in no particular order:

1.  As I already mentioned, you did not discuss this tooth and its root with me in the past as you stated at the most recent visit.  The assistant at that visit even looked for it in the chart notes and could not find it .

2.  After the insurance claim for the crown was denied the final time, I asked you about the dentist's narrative on why it was necessary that should have been included in the files that were sent to the insurance.  You said you typed a full page for this, your receptionist said it was a few lines handwritten.  Neither of you could find a copy to provide to me.  When I was filing the appeal to the insurance company a few months prior, I asked if there was a narrative, and was not made aware that such a thing existed.  One or both of you lied directly to my face.
* If you did not file anything because I was on the "patient appreciation plan" which states that you won't file insurance while I'm on it, you could have told me that and I would not have had an issue.  This was why I filed insurance on my own after paying you for the procedure, expecting them to reimburse me the covered percentage of what I paid; admittedly, I did not realize the amount of paperwork and effort needed for this.  Instead your office told me that you did file all the needed paperwork, which the insurance company never received.

3.  I'm not even convinced that this crown was necessary (and there apparently is no narrative to state that it was).  Your office seems to put a higher priority on crowns and other high-dollar work than on fillings, which seems backwards to me as I would think that you would want to do a filling as soon as you find it so the tooth does not get bad enough to need a crown.  Another tooth of mine which you said would need a crown (which I never got from you because the pain on the other side of my mouth never stopped) currently has a filling from my new dentist.

4.  You said an endodontist can remove and save the old crown to place it back on later.  This is incorrect, both endodontists I visited stated that they drill through the crown to perform the root canal.  This may not have been intentional, but I'm counting it as another lie.

5.  After I got the root canal, some porcelain chipped off of another surface of the crown.  I called your office to ask about what material the base metal is (and if I should worry about corrosion) and was told that ALL the crowns you perform are pure zirconium and not porcelain-on-metal.  When I asked how that could be if mine clearly has exposed metal, the person on the phone got quite defensive ... like accusations of lying (perhaps not unfounded) is a common phenomenon.

resp.text:
David, I'm sorry you are unhappy. I do hope you at least realize we tried our best to provide all the Care that we could. If you don't mind, as you leave us one star would you mind elaborating on what you wish we had done better? That would be helpful for me and anyone reading this. However, respecting your privacy, I don't want to elaborate on what I think your experience may have been.

Update: David, I am so happy that you have found a new dentist with a relationship that you have confidence and Trust in! Thank you for taking the time to share this with me.  It will do neither you nor I any good for me to make a defense of the experiences that we had together. I'll leave it at I am so sorry for the misunderstandings we had and I wish it had gone otherwise. I do wish you the best going forward.
Sincerely,
Brian Cook

name: Andy Walburg
text:
Go to this dentist... And I'm not a relative, I swear.
I live in Austin Texas and was visiting Huntsville and had a dental emergency. My crown post broke and I was left without a front tooth. I went to Dr. Cook for options and after extensive discussion decided to put a new post in and a temporary crown so my dentist at home could then replace the temporary with a new crown. But when Dr Cook got into the process he discovered an old-school resin that had been used  to fill the root canal and determined that the chances of success for a new crown were significantly reduced. Rather than continuing with the new post, he simply glued the old crown back in place and suggested that I discuss my options with my dentist at home. Wow... He had the opportunity to charge me for a new post that probably would have been unsuccessful but instead was honest and told me that I would probably need an implant.
Patient before profits. For me this is something significant and something I was extremely impressed by. On top of all of that, the office was friendly, extremely organized, and seamless throughout the entire process. I highly highly recommend Dr. Cook if you happen to be fortunate enough to live in an area where he can provide dental services for you.

resp.text: Andy, thank you for the kind words. Good luck with your your dentist on Monday!

text: I never have had a dental experience like this! The staff are so friendly and professional! Dr. Barnett is amazing and really cares about his staff and patients! name: Kiahna Mollette
text:
I have always been very selective of my dentists due to pretty severe dental anxiety. I've been coming to Divine Expressions for approximately 6 months now and I have always had a great experience! I've had cleanings, fillings, and wisdom teeth extraction and always left satisfied. My fillings were always 100% pain free and I found that I didn't even need any anxiety reducing measures, as everyone made me incredibly comfortable. My cleaning was amazing, Roxy is one of the nicest people I've ever met. I very recently had my wisdom teeth removed and I felt no pain and didn't even need to take pain medicine afterwards. I used sedation for this and I didn't have an ounce of anxiety before, during, or after. The office is very focused on what your goals are with your smile as well as keeping your mouth healthy.
I would recommend Divine Expressions to anybody that is searching for a dentist, I actually look forward to dental appointments here!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Kiahna! Your review made our entire team happy!

name: Crystal Smith
text: Dr. Barnett is amazing! He is the first dentist I’ve been to that eases my anxiety. I don’t dread going in for procedures. His work is meticulous, yet quick. I feel totally at ease in his care. His staff is also very kind and welcoming. The office is inviting and beautifully decorated as well.  I rarely ever write reviews, but I’m THAT pleased with Divine Expressions. 10 out of 10 recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Crystal!!!

text: Impersonal, impatient, and overall unsatisfactory service. Be warned this is a profit oriented, Cosmetic dentist. I do not recommend at all due to the lack of care and attention to detail provided. If your looking for a permanent solution to your dental needs look elsewhere as this dentist will rush you in and out... also, when you get a list of what he claims needs to be addressed, do yourself a favor and Seek a 2nd opinion. D- dental practice at best.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write us about your concerns. Our core mission is to go above and beyond in everything we do, and every patient that walks through our doors is valued. If we missed the mark in any way, we would like to talk more about it. We are unable to find you as a patient of record to contact you so please give our office a call at your earliest convenience to discuss this further.  We look forward to speaking with you.

text: The people were so friendly and helpful. They made everything so painless from procedures to paperwork. This is going to become my new dentist

name: Samona Jones
text:
Divine Expression is a good dentist practice I would highly recommended. I needed a root canal and crown. Dr Barnett and his staff did an amazing job. The hygienist were amazing, billing staff amazing, and Dr Barnett very precise with his work. The office is very modern and I love the scriptures and soft music throughout the setting. I thought it was very cool for them to have the ability to print the crown in house instead of sending it off (like most dentist offices). The technology being used in today’s society is out this world and Dr Barnett seems to have the latest. One of the things I love the most about my visit is the bedside manners. I received a phone call after hours personally from Dr Barnett making sure I was ok and wasn’t having any complications. I’ve never in my life received that type of service and it really was the highlight of my visit.
Divine Expression is highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you Samona for your recommendation and we are so glad to have you as part of the Family!

name: Gary white
text:
Terrible place to go! Dr Barnett did a hack job on my mouth and his crew laughed about it! I call constantly for resolve and they do little to help make it right. After my crown I was in pain for weeks coming there 3 or 4 times and not getting a proper fit. I had to go to a specialist 2 hrs away from home because they were not comfortable doing a root canal.

Afterwards they did little to follow up with me and when I call the receptionist on the phone have no idea what they are talking about or how patient in need. They have maybe 2 people out of the entire crew that were pleasant to deal with but the rest are trash! BEWARE AND DO NOT GO HERE!!!

resp.text: We apologize for your experience it definitely was not our intent. Unfortunately there was miscommunication about the needed root canal as we did not refer you to someone else or feel uncomfortable doing it.  As for someone on the team laughing at you we will listen to the calls because that doesn’t sound like the character or integrity of any of our team members and doesn’t align with the vision of our practice.  We work really hard to work with our patients and provide the care they deserve and need when allowed to.  Thank you for your feedback as we view all feedback as an opportunity for growth.

name: Shambria Davis
text: Always a great experience when I visit. My appt. was at 8am and they got me in and out by 9:30a. They ensure to implement COVID precaution which I felt was an added bonus. Overall amazing experience with the patients care in HUGE consideration.

resp.text: Thank you Shambria!!

resp.text: Exceptional patient care is our standard in our office, we apologize we were not able to help take you out of pain during your visit.  We wish you the best of luck in your dental care.

name: Taric Alani
text:
Pros: The place was clean, and I liked how they asked me to wash my hands as soon as I came inside. I saw everyone wearing masks. This was much better hygienic practice than I have seen in other offices in the area. The dentist was friendly and explained everything clearly.

Cons: They didn't have any of my paperwork, my dental records from my previous dentist, my sleep study for my dental oral appliance, not even my new patient paperwork, which I filled out online on their website weeks beforehand. I had called several times both to my other providers as well as here to organize everything before I arrived, several weeks in advance. They just dropped the ball and claimed they were having internet issues, which is just a lousy excuse easily remedied in a day, not one that takes weeks to resolve. I won't likely be returning, because even though I had the electronic referral done via my physician and got their information from my insurance, Blue Cross Blue Shield, they don't accept Blue Cross Blue Shield, because they don't have the software to bill to medical insurance. That's just unacceptable in this day and age. If you're a approved provider as shown on that insurance company's website, you should accept their insurance or else ask that insurance company not to list you as a provider.

resp.text: We apologize that things weren’t as they should have been for you.  Also we have made a decision because it’s a handful dealing with dental insurance to not file medical insurance however you can always file and get reimbursed and we would be happy to give you all documentation that you need to do so.

name: seth adgate
text: Let me start off by saying my past experiences with dentists has been awful. Every time I've had any work done I have felt pretty much everything and even told the dentist and they didn't seem to care. Everything was painful. I was to a point where I would never go to a dentist again, it gave me anxiety, my blood pressure would shoot through the roof and I felt like I just another person in a long line in the waiting room. I can say this is the total opposite here at Divine! Dr. Laurentis made sure I couldn't feel anything, his nurses kept the atmosphere upbeat and had comfort items if I needed anything (warm towel to wash my face, noise cancelling headphones, eye mask, etc,.). I went in for a root canal and a crown and I'm happy to say 1 day after the procedure I'm pain free and the crown fit perfectly. I feel like there is hope for my teeth again since there is finally a dentist I can trust. Thank you to Dr. Laurentis and your staff for everything. See you soon!

resp.text: Thank you Seth. We are so glad to make you comfortable and to have you as a forever patient and part of the family!

name: DeAsia Knight
text: This office simply doesn’t know what they’re doing. I scheduled an appointment specifically for a root canal, only to be told (while I’m sitting in the operating chair) that Dr. Crawford doesn’t feel comfortable performing root canals. Why would you come to a root canal appointment unable to perform the procedure? Also, I thought this was Dr. Barnett’s office. I know that he can perform root canals because he gave my mom one, so why wasn’t he there? They also acted as if they had no idea why I even came to the office. They asked about the pain I was experiencing and why I came in, as if I hadn’t specifically scheduled a root canal. Eventually I was referred to an endodontist specialist after waiting in the chair for 45 minutes. Very displeased with this experience, especially since I scheduled off of work for this appointment.

resp.text: We apologize you had the experience you did.  We will reach out to you on Monday when Dr. Barnett and the full team is in the office to see how we can take better care of you and get you out of pain!

text: Tried to set an appointment with a very rude and unprofessional secretary.I had to call back to because I had some wrong info and they wouldn't answer after 3 calls and a left message to no reply. I never placed any blame just wanted to set an appointment won't be trying again

name: Phillip
text: Many are posting about the excellent service, which it was, but I must shine a light on the disastrous treatment I received when it came to insurance. I walked in with Blue Cross and Blue Shield, but the manager involved kept telling me I only had health insurance. I have insurance through my job, so I know this is incorrect. They compromised by making me pay upfront and claiming they would pay me back when the claim came through. It has now been a month and I have not heard one thing about my money or my claim. During this time I have called my insurance, who tried to call them, but had to hang up as the manager put the claims adjuster on hold for over ten minutes with out answering any questions. Continually when I call to talk to the manager, I am told she is out of the office and when she does call back tells me it is the insurance's fault. I will not be returning and would not recommend this establishment to anyone else.

resp.text: We have looked into your history and will be contacting you soon.

Exceptional Quality Service and Experience... I have been a longtime patient at Divine Expressions, the entire staff is professional, attentive, and more importantly caring. In addition, the staff is extremely precautious in escorting patients throughout the dental clinic.  If you are in search of finding a new dentist or would like leave your current dentist, Dr. Barnett and his team is a Go-To! From the receptionist at the front Desk Alecia, (so Bubbly and such a Joy to see) to team of Dental Hygienist and Dental Assistants,   I literally feel like family, when I arrive.

Not to mention, the ambience in the dental office embodies tranquility, and get this, you can inhale calming scents while your teeth are cleaned or maintenance is performed, all while watching Netflix, YESSS Netflix in the Dental Office, I love telling my peers, I have a dentist appoint and I get to watch Netflix and chill, while my teeth are being cleaned....

name: Sarah Brown
text:
April15, 2019

The moment I walked through the front doors, I felt the love ❤️ in the atmosphere. I continued and met to beautiful young ladies at the front desk, smiling at me, Alecia and Caitie that made the journey a little more welcoming. Alecia went a step further by being professional and giving. She gave me a grand tour of the elegant facility and what they had to offer. Alecia introduced me to other staff members and enlightened me on what their jobs consisted of. Dr. Barnett is a complete gentleman and very professional. Last but not least the beautiful lady that took care of me so gracefully, Mrs. Janine my dental hygienist, she explained everything she was doing and did everything to make sure I was comfortable. She answered every question I had, she was gentle and kind. She made me aware of the things I needed done and what I needed to get my smile back. Dr. Barnett came in to confirm. name: Sally Menendez
text:
5 stars for looks, 1 star for respect and dignity of the patient.

The facility is very nice on the outside and inside. They have fancy gadgets and machines, but that does not make up for how they treated me as a patient. Not once walking into that building that I feel comfortable, the dental hygienist was very kind but I always had a vibe that they had to try to sell something to me. I stayed at this facility for about a year and a half just to give it a chance after every six months cleaning. But my last visit was the worst, the doctor was expecting me to pay $1,500 upfront for a procedure he suggested I needed to do. They wanted me to pay for it before I left that day and schedule an appointment. I am not an ATM, and on top of that every time the doctor would see me he would nonchalantly scold me about my teeth. I would leave the facility in embarrassment because of how they thought of me. I also noticed that they treated me differently than they did my husband. We would go at different times and he would tell me how great the the doctor was while I was the one getting scolded.

resp.text: We apologize that your experience was difference than your husbands.  We want to support patients in understanding how their oral health is and when it is contrary to optimal health.  We make it our goal to remind patients of treatment left at each visit as we know that life happens and we forget things.  We also have the policy of making a deposit prior to scheduling.  If you pay in full you receive a discount.  We apologize if that wasn’t explained completely to you.  Additionally our fees are set by the insurance companies we contract with.   Your policy sets the fees and we strictly abide by what your insurance company charges.   We would be happy to discuss this further.  Please give us a call for further clarity and to receive our heartfelt apology.

name: Stacey Pruitt
text:
I switched to this dentist to be closer to my job. I researched and looked at the reviews. I have never had a bad experience at a dentist office before. I first thought it was weird that they were begging for 5 star reviews when i first started going here. That explains where a lot of these reviews came from.

On each visit I felt like it was more about up-selling you on the products they offer than focusing on my actual teeth. They were always mentioning teeth whitening, special mouth wash, special tooth paste etc. I am in the sales world so I get it, but don't be pushy. You can usually tell when a person is uncomfortable about the topics. Which I was.

I received a quote for invisalign about a year ago, and decided to save. They quoted me 1800ish without insurance for that visit. Then this past visit they quoted me 3,325 after my insurance pays 1000. I thought that was a bit dramatic increase especially since my insurance now covers a grand.

I go to my dentist every 6 months. I might go two months over, due to work scheduling, but I go regularly. I've never had cavity problems so 8 months ago when I was told I had 6 I almost fainted. I actively brush my teeth and floss multiple times a day. My family and friends make fun of how cautious I am when it comes to my oral health. I want to keep my teeth so I do care for them.  I was told I didn't floss enough and that I needed to start when I asked how it was possible to have 6 cavities. I felt like i was being degraded.  So I started brushing 3Xs daily and flossing after every meal. When I came back 8 months later (2 months over because of a work scheduling issue)  I had 4 more. Only then when I almost started to cry did the Dr. ask about my medical history. I have severe acid re-flux. Apparently that can cause the cavity issue. He then up-sales me on some ORA-Care mouth wash and told me to use it until my next visit. When I return to the next visit if I have additional cavities we will re-evaluate. I'm not sure that I would want to wait another 6 months to see if i get additional cavities even while using the mouth wash.

When I went to schedule my filling appointment they told me I had to pay a percentage of the $250 cost before they scheduled me. I told them that I didn't have the money even though I did, and decided right then I would go back to Dr. Sonja Gill's office.

I felt this office is only concerned about the money that goes into their pocket. I get businesses have to make money, but I have never not paid them. Even when I missed an appointment I paid them a $55 no show fee with no hesitation. I felt like I was their personal ATM.

I will never go back to this practice again. I am going back to Dr. Sonja Gill where I am greeted with a smile, and they don't hold out their hand for your credit card every time you walk through the door.

resp.text: We apologize and will be contacting you to see how we can make it better for you.

name: Tipawan Gallo
text:
I was a patient since the practice was still known as Horizon PC, and then Divine Expressions. Content with the service, I decided to have Divine Expressions as my primary and only dental care. And for the most part, it was good. The staff are incredibly friendly, extremely accommodating and very gentle during each cleaning. Not to mention the breathtaking, home magazine worthy office.

Where it pains me to write is related to Dr. Laurentis Barnett's procedures. Every procedure that dealt with a crown of some sort, always came off. It resulted in me either having to leave work early, take an extended lunch, take a day off and/or come back multiple times that same week. While the staff and Dr. Barnett was very accommodating and flexible with scheduling, the process were still very inconvenient. A particular case was getting an implant for one of my teeth. For starters, the tooth itself was shaped very oddly. It did not look or feel like a normal tooth. It also always popped off, even though the office used dental cement.

With every visit to either add or replace, I never received an answer as to why this kept happening. Dr. Laurentis also hinted that it was possibly my fault that the tooth kept coming off. I'm not opposed to thinking that I could've been doing something wrong, but after speaking with friends and colleagues with dental implants and explaining to them my daily routine and lifestyle, I was suggested to get an second opinion from another dental professional.

I sought treatment elsewhere and unfortunately had to pay for another tooth implant. The implant printed from Divine Expressions leaves my new dental office with many questions as they have never seen such an odd shaped "tooth". My current implant from my new dentist has been in my mouth for nearly 2 months. I had not returned once for a re-application.

The purpose of this post is not to defame or deface Dr. Laurentis Barnett, it is simply to write a review I felt needed to be written. I wish him and his office the best of success and hope that maybe this review will leave some food for thought. I'm glad there are a good number of patients that are satisfied with his service. I simply was not.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience and will be happy to issue you a refund for the crown and the inconvience it has caused you.

name: Gideon Rah
text: Professional and painless!

resp.text: Gideon, thank you very much!

name: Marissa Jones
text: Let me just say that every time I come to this place they go above and beyond to make sure that I'm comfortable. Like I've had dentists that were just plain awful, rude, and didn't care if they were hurting you while they worked on your teeth. Due to this I have a terrible fear of the dentist but Dr. Barnett(?) and his staff are insanely professional and nice. I never have to wait long. They always work with me for appointments. I had to change my appointment a few days before and they worked me in that very same week on another day! I seriously cannot stress how amazing this place is. If you're on the fence about choosing a dentist, definitely choose Divine Expressions.

resp.text: Thank you

name: K Staten
text: The new office is beautiful. However, I am not pleased with the run around I received as if I didn't know what I was talking about. Every time I called the office in reference to the same tooth/problem I always explained in detail what my concerns were. I repeatedly went in and each time you would think I was a new patient. I saw 4 different dental assistants and none of them had a clue as to why I was there. They didn't even know which tooth that I had a root canal on in there office just 1 month prior (this happened twice). One time I called, I was asked what the doctor told me on the last visit I went in.....this is disturbing considering they should keep record of what the doctor says each visit and overall what is actually going on. Also, it would seem smart to keep record of what a patient says for the reason they are needing to see the doctor again so that there is an overall knowledge with other office staff on the situation/patient. I was always greeted by a friendly smile (wish I could remember her name) but once I got behind the door everything seemed surfaced even with Dr Barnette. Maybe the staffs lack of knowledge was the problem. Not a great experience

resp.text: We apologize for any lack of information you feel you have received.  We have only worked on one tooth so it wasn't so much a lack of knowledge it was ensuring we locate the source of your pain. All notes reflect work done but I request that, just like in the hospital, we verify which tooth is in question each visit.  That's for our patients protection.  We look forward to completing your treatment and will make a note to ensure we are thorough and detailed with you in the future.

name: Haddy Ndiaye
text: The staff were amazing and courteous my hygienist Rita was great in every way and answered all my questions. Two thumbs up. I'm a happy patient

name: Sabrina T
text: I purposely waited until the day after to post a review. Let me say I am so surprised at how great the service, procedure, and recovery went. I got my wisdom teeth pulled and a few fillings. My biggest fear   are injections.  It was almost painless. I couldn't feel most of them. The doctor was gentle and talked me through the process. His assistant lent me her hand.  On top of that, I watched Netflix listened to music and calmed my nerves with the aroma therapy bar. Let me just say it was a Divine Experience. High5 Team.

resp.text: Awesome Sabrina. We are glad your appointment went well and exceeded your expectations!!!  We look forward to creating more High5 Dental experiences for you in the future.

name: Phoenix Rising
text: What exceptional care and professionalism from the moment you step in. They never hesitated in calming my fears and fit me in last minute for a surgical procedure. My family and I have now become loyal customers.

resp.text: Thank you Carmen for allowing us to be your dental provider.  We look forward to a life long relationship and helping you and your family achieve all your dental dreams!!

name: Catrail Langford
text: These people were AWESOME!! MY 1st appt was supposed to be March 18th but had and emergency come up they worked me in today Man I feel so much better I haven't slept in 3 days because of tooth pain but it's on tonight make up rest Kim and Shay were GREAT!! as well. I can tell Dr Barnett  you're themostat in the place you set the temperature thanks again TEAM DIVINE!!! For a pleasant 1st visit..👍👍👍

resp.text: Awesome Catrail we look forward to continuing to create wow experiences for you at our office!

name: Black and Brilliant
text: This was by far the most pleasant experience I had at a dentist. I had to have a root canal and was so scared. Let me first say his staff is always so pleasant, and his office is so welcoming and relaxing. I mean come on, paraffin wax, aromatherapy, Netflix while you are serviced, it feels more like a vacation then a trip to the dentist. Well anyway, He numbed my mouth before giving me the shot, I didn’t even feel it! The root canal was quick, painless, and I got my crown within minutes, I didn’t have to come back! They called me back on time and I was out in a couple of hours. I am NEVER leaving Dr. Barnett and his crew!

resp.text: We are so glad we were able to give you a fabulous vacation Jasmine!   See you soon!!!

name: Jeffery Engbrecht
text: I had a great cleaning at Divine Expressions!

resp.text: Awesome Jeffery.  Please tell all your family and friends about it.

name: Beverly Little
text: I've never been one that likes, dentist or doctor's. But the people at this place are great going in and coming out. They greet you by name.I love them

resp.text: We love you too Beverly!

name: Cecilia Bell
text: I've never gone to a dentist that was so welcoming and professional. Very thorough and the patient care is awesome.!

resp.text: Thank you Cecilia

name: Myriette Shillingford
text: I love this place. Nice comfortable atmosphere and they even give you blankets and hand exfoliations. You are so comfortable you wouldn't want to leave.

resp.text: Awesome.  We are so glad we were able to make your visit with us relaxing.

name: Marc Loertscher
text: At my first and last appointment with Doctor B. I very directly asked what work was needed and he wouldn't answer. When I got to the front desk they out lined over six thousand dollars of dental work that my new dentist said wasn't even remotely necessary. I felt like he viewed me as an atm machine not a patient. To his credit he offered to sit down with me when I told him we would be leaving but it was too little too late.

resp.text: We are sorry you feel your treatment plan was not accurate.  It is customary for me to go over treatment plans as long as needed so I'm not sure where the miscommunication was for you. However every dentist diagnosis differently and I am unaware of any prices while diagnosisng. We keep what's needed clinically separate from finances because we feel finances should not dictate treatment on your end or ours. Our hygienist and I both codiagnosis patients to ensure we are all on the same page. We use technology and Intraoral pictures to show you what's going on in your mouth. Because we want to be transparent anytime someone is confused or in doubt we offer the option to come in to get clarity. Trust is vital in any relationship. And we are happy you have found someone you can pick all your trust in what they say you need. Thanks for sharing your concerns as we view all feedback as vital.

name: Mrs. Irby
text:
Ms Janine was awesome! When I arrived, I was greeted by another employee and Ashley. Ashley had been very helpful in scheduling my appointment via phone. I filled out my paperwork and within minutes Janine took me back for a quick tour. The facility is BEAUTIFUL! I appreciated all of the amenities that were offered. Janine explained all of the equipment, showed me pictures and kept me informed of the process all the way through. My cleaning did not take long, but my overall appointment was a bit lengthy. Give yourself extra time for your first visit. Dr. Barnett seemed friendly, but we didn't talk long because Janine was so thorough! I appreciated the treatment plan provided and look forward to getting to a brighter smile.

Updated 8.1.18 My husband found Divine Expressions and we haven't been disappointed. The staff is friendly and courteous and can pretty much handle it all. Dr. Barnett is usually in-and-out so I appreciate that the hygienists and receptionists are so kind. The treatment plan you receive is clear and outlines the plan for your teeth-you don't waste time wondering what's next or the cost. The facility is beautiful and up-to-date. Everything is always clean and there are little perks like hand wax, chap-stick and warm towels. The wait usually isn't extensive. The only downside is that the facility isn't open on Fridays (the day I'm off early!). Otherwise I have been pleased!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Irby. We look forward to taking good care of all your dental needs.

name: Briannah Weaver
text: Ms. Rita is wonderful! She takes her time and makes sure you have everything you need. She’s the best!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Teresa Brown
text: All personnel were professional and personable. I did have to wait about 45 minutes due to an emergency patient they were servicing. However,  not a big deal because the service I recieved far exceeded the wait. Janine is the best!

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us and being flexible with your appointment time. We work hard to not make our patients wait but when an emergency presents we try to reduce patients pain and save their lives!  We look forward to a life long relationship with you and helping you achieve all your dental dreams!

name: PAULA NESBIT
text: Wonderifull experience.....Dr Barnett and his staff are awesome. ...Their technology and their equipment  is unbelievable ....never dreamed that a root canal and crown could be done the same day! And everyone makes sure you  are comfortable.

resp.text: We are so glad we exceeded your expectations by completing your crown and root canal all in the same day!!

name: Kayliabeth Ross
text: This dentist office is the best dentist I've ever been to, it so clean and smells so good in the office. The staff is very friendly and treats u with so much respect.

resp.text: Thank you Kayliabeth. We are blessed to have patients like you. Can't wait to see you at your next appointment!

text: Dr Barnett and staff are professional, empathetic and kind. Went out of their way for my dental emergency. Found ourselves a new dentist.

resp.text: Awesome!  It was our privilege to take care of your dental needs and we look forward to a life long relationship!

name: William Gardner
text: Was very nervous going into my procedure, but was relaxed after going over procedure with Jeannine .   Was relaxed and able to get through without any problems .

Update from my visit yesterday. 6/15/20.
I can continue with the 5ive stars.  The response to the COVID-19.  is stellar.  Felt very safe with the the precautions taken.

Yes, I can give a dentist 5 stars!
Thanks Janine for the checkup today.  One of the few times I have not had to do the crawl down the dentist chair during the cleaning.
Looking forward to the new office!!

resp.text: Matthew, thank you for the 5 stars :)

name: Araceli Ream

name: Rico Clark
text: By far the worst work I have ever had done I have never had any teeth issues until visiting with him when he instructed that I needed not one bit 3 root canals that I did get done by him in which they have ALL FALLEN OUT I am extremely pissed I feel he does not know what he is doing in that aspect I have not had these any longer than 1 year MAYBE 2 ! I will defintely be seeking legal ways to get my money back for the lack of quality service done on my mouth it is completely ridiculous I wouldn't recommend visiting unless it is for MINOR issues and I do stress MINOR!

resp.text: I'm sorry Mr. Clark your name was not found in our pool of patients.  There are many steps to root canals to ensure their longevity.   Please contact the doctor that completed them and I'm sure they will guide you through what's needed to complete your work.  If you go by another name we stand behind our work and will be happy to take a look at your current condition. Please be reminded that we recommend regular cleanings to support your teeth and ensure you keep them for life. Our number should you need us is(256) 837-1200.

name: Louise Hipp
text: Amazing experience.

resp.text: Thank you Louise for your trust in us!

name: James Pidcock
text: Outstanding service provider.

name: James Chalmers
text: Because of the professional services I receive.

name: Jacob Cary
text: Quick and virtually painless

name: Thomas Robertson
text: First and Foremost this is not a dentist office! This is a Five-Star Luxury Spa & Resort for your Smile! Divine Expressions luxurious packages include TVs on the ceiling for your viewing pleasure during routine visits, warm lavender scented towels to wash up with after your appointment, and the most knowledgeable and professional staff in North Alabama that equips you with the information and services to ensure the wellbeing of your oral health. Dr. Barnett and his staff has done an amazing job maintaining a clean & sanitized environment for their patients, providing exceptional services with state-of-the-art equipment and gadgets that make your appointments a breeze! I highly recommend Latoya Baker! She was kind, gentle yet thorough, knowledgeable, and she laughed at all my jokes (had no impact on this review lol). Dr. Barnett has done an amazing job with establishing a family culture within his practice and with staff as you will witness when you come here. His staff has nothing but great things to say about Dr. Barnett and once you meet him you will see why. I highly recommend Divine Expressions to anyone who demands nothing but the best for their teeth. Our whole family now goes there and our three year old absolutely loves the dentist now and her experience has been nothing but great! Thank you Dr. Barnett and staff for all that you do!!!

name: Hannah Roberts
text: I have been a patient here since 2005, when my family and I moved to Madison. I will definitely never go anywhere else! The staff is so friendly and it's always like seeing old friends when I come in every six months. The  hygienists always do wonderful job on my cleanings. Dr. Paul and Emily are so nice, and I can tell that they treat both their patients and staff very well.

resp.text: Thanks for your kind review, Hannah! We love seeing you each time! -MFD

name: Ginny Wagner
text: We have been patients at Madison Family Dentistry for four years now and we are very pleased with their professional service.  You never wait for more than a minute to be seen at your appointment, and the technicians are very kind and thorough.  Dr. McIntosh always takes lots of time with me to discuss any questions or concerns and offer various options for treatment.  I highly recommend Madison Family Dentistry.

resp.text: Thank you, Ginny! We are so grateful to have patients like you, and we look forward to seeing you again next time! -MFD

text: Very friendly staff that go out of the way to ensure your comfort.  Dr. Paul and Dr. Emily are outstanding.  They both explain procedures and have patience with questions.  I have been a patient for a very long time and know they stay on top of the latest dental developments.

resp.text: Thank you, Harry! Our team is committed to making your visit to our office as easy and comfortable as possible. We look forward to seeing you again next time! - MFD

name: Lynn Laing
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Emily’s since 2013! I go for regular cleanings twice each year, and Dr. Emily has also replaced and/ or repaired just about every one of my old fillings/crowns. She does beautiful work! They always get me in when I need an appointment, and the Entire staff is a joy! I cannot recommend this practice highly enough!!! They are awesome!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Lynn! It is always a pleasure to see you each time! We love having you as a patient, and we look forward to seeing you again at your next visit! - MFD

name: Erin Coffman
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Emily for about 5 years now, and I have received nothing but the best treatment. She and her staff helped me with a crown when I got a dental implant, and it was a breeze. The assistant/hygienist helped me pick the best color match for the crown, and I get compliments on it all the time. People can’t even tell it’s not my real tooth! I highly recommend Madison Family Dentistry for all your dentistry needs!

resp.text: Thank you, Erin! We are so glad to be your dental home, and we are happy to hear you've had positive experiences in our office over the years! We look forward to seeing you again at your next visit! -MFD

name: leonard c hall
text: It is always a pleasure coming here to get my teeth worked on. Dr Emily, her husband and her staff always do a great job taking care of my teeth each time I come around. Valerie is an excellent hygienist, who is excellent at her job and is always real sweet to my family and I. I have been coming here for decades and that says it all!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Leonard! It is always a pleasure to see you as well! We enjoy having you and your family as such wonderful patients, and we look forward to seeing you again next time! -MFD

text: I've been a frequent visitor to dentists since I was eight years old, when in 1955 I had eight teeth filled. I've seen a lot of dentists, but Drs. Paul and Emily McIntosh at Madison Family Dentistry are the finest dentists I've had the pleasure of knowing and receiving treatment. Their first consideration is the patient and his or her comfort while undergoing dental procedures. They use their considerable skills to treat all patients with the finest dental care. Their staff also reflects their commitment to patient service. I highly recommend Madison Family Dentistry.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Philip! We truly appreciate your kind review and recommendation. We are grateful to have you as such a wonderful patient, and we look forward to seeing you again next time! -MFD

resp.text: Thank you, Mary! We are so happy you and your family have been our wonderful patients for so many years. We truly appreciate you! We look forward to seeing you again next time! -MFD

text: Our family have been patients of Dr’s Paul and Emily since we first moved to the area about 15 years ago - and they have taken excellent care of us. It’s a delight to go in for our regular care (Fallon is friendly and efficient) and whenever we have needed work done they have been gentle while giving excellent care. When our daughter was young and struggled with going to the dentist they were kind and patient.  This practice is friendly, professional, timely, thorough, and gives the highest quality of care.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Gail! We are so glad to have you and your family as such wonderful patients. It is an honor to be your dental home! We look forward to your next visit! -MFD

Pam Neeley

text: My husband and I have been patients of Doctor Paul and  Doctor Emily for over 12 years.  The facility is pleasant and equipment up to date. According to my husband that gets 4 stars, but the overall rating is 5 stars because they do NOT hurt!

resp.text: Thank you, Peggy! It is a pleasure to have you and your husband as such wonderful patients. We are so glad to hear that you both always have a pleasant experience when visiting our office. We look forward to seeing you next time! -MFD

text: I have never had a long wait and I have been with Madison Family Dentistry for over 10 years. They do a great job with cleanings, fillings, and crowns. The office staff is friendly and efficient.

name: Gregory Brown
text: Dr. Paul and Dr. Emily have taken care of our entire family for many years now.  Highly professional, very personable, and they treat you like family.  Additionally, great staff that also take excellent care of you.  I would highly recommend Madison Family Dentistry.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review!! We are glad you've had great experiences with us, and we look forward to seeing you at your next visit! - MFD

name: Horace Smith
text: Paul and Emily are, hands down, the best. In my 60's and have, necessarily so, seen many dentists over my lifetime. That stopped, roughly around 15 years ago, when I, and my family, started going to Madison Family Dentistry. I found a place that excelled in dental care and treatment. Because of my prior years of experience, I knew I had found top notch excellent quality dentists. Icing on the cake are the folks they have working with them. Hygienist and staff are great folks and continue in the path of quality care demonstrated by Doctors Paul and Emily.

text: Doctors of Dental Science Paul and Emily McIntosh provide excellent dental care in a warm, family friendly, environment. They have cared for my family’s dental needs for 16 years. Paul and Emily consult with the best orthodontists, endodontists, and periodontists in Northern Alabama. Whatever your dental needs, Madison Family Dentistry is a smart choice.

Also, the staff know me when I come in, I don't usually have to say who I am and what my appointment is, and I have NEVER had to wait a long time.  I usually have barely sat down and picked up a magazine before I am called back.
I can't say enough good things about this practice, they check all the boxes.  If you are newly looking for a dentist or you are unhappy where you are at, I highly suggest that you call Madison Family Dentistry first.  I am certainly glad that I found them.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review and recommendation, Randy! We appreciate the huge compliment to our office and are so happy to hear you've had such positive experiences with us over the years. We look forward to seeing you again at your next visit! -MFD

Good luck to new patients, I hope your experience is better. First impressions are lasting ones.

name: Wade H. Peery
text:
I've spent several hours with Dr. Vega & his practice before he was at Madison Family Dentistry--and he's such a good dentist that I'm willing to make the 45 minute drive to Madison to see him. He's definitely the best dentist I've ever had in my life. He's one of the top dentists in the state of Virginia and I say that without hesitation. He truly enjoys his craft and has a passion for teaching others about the dentistry profession (he's won a ton of awards). Personally--I don't even need to see the awards to know that he's an outstanding dentist. The rest of the staff there are friendly and are excellent about answering any questions and keeping you at ease in the dental chair. Dr. Vega and his staff's strengths have an outstanding ability to remain unflappable during procedures. I was incredibly impressed when Dr. Vega did a root canal resection on me at his previous practice. Dr. Sauls & Dr. Vega form one of the better tandems of dentistry in the Commonwealth and the Madison area should feel extremely lucky to have not only two outstanding people--but outstanding dentists as well. I'd recommend Dr. Vega to my own family--and I actually have. I've got nothing but fantastic things to say about the staff and I will be a Madison Family Dentistry patient as long as I can find employment in the Charlottesville area for the remainder of my life. Truly--a top notch medical care facility!

This review was intended for a practice located in Madison, Virginia--not Madison, Alabama. My mistake!

--Wade Hampton

text: I hadn't been to a dentist in at least 15 years. Tons of problems. Many hours in the chair with Dr. Paul. I never felt a hint of judgement coming from them. Dr. Paul could probably weave a sweater out of spider silk with his bare hands. This place is a little more expensive, and I'm on the lower end of the income scale. They made it hard for me to even care.

text: The staff flat out lied. The service was average, but with a long wait.  We specifically asked the staff if they were an in-network provider for our insurance.  They said clearly, Yes we are.  We later found that they accept most insurance but they are not "in-network" for any insurance. So if you are going here, you are overpaying!  We paid over 400 dollars for three cleaning (all on the same day), from their almost $700 bill.  They are dishonest and charge above average prices for dental care in this area.
