text: I have been coming here for 2 years now. Found this dentist office online, read the reviews and took a chance. I am so happy that I did. Staff is very professional, everyone is friendly, they send appropriate reminders and I truly feel that everyone enjoys their jobs. Good choice should you decide to come!

name: Tyler Buford
text: I had cosmetic work done on my teeth. Initially, I was skeptical about getting this work done, but I am so satisfied with the outcome. My smile is vibrant. I'm no longer embarrassed about showing my teeth. Double Oak Mountain Family Dentist does excellent cosmetic work!!!

name: Jose Cantu
text: I was a new patient at Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry and had a very pleasant experience there. The staff members were very courteous and friendly with a cheery smile on their faces. I would highly recommend this place for your dental work. I would definitely return to Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry.

name: Shannon Harrison
text: I reviewed excellent online feedback about this dentist prior to making an appointment and I was not disappointed. Everyone was very friendly and I felt valued as a patient. I was a new patient and I needed to have an evaluation by the dentist, a cleaning and a filling. They exceeded my expectations because they had scheduled extra time prior to my first appointment to ensure that I could have all of this done at the same appointment. This saved me a lot of time, which was SO VERY APPRECIATED!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy you had a great visit and look forward to seeing you in the future.

name: Neha Gupta
text: Had a horrible experience. They do not have any information about the insurance and gives you false estimate before the visit. Also, they gave me referral for a surgeon who doesn't even take my insurance. I was told by the surgeon on the date of surgery that they will charge me the whole amount since they don't take my insurance. I had to take official office leave for surgery and had to cancel everything because of this. They are horrible with patient care. When I asked for referral for current surgeon, they asked me to call them to get their email address so they can do it. This is not a patients job in any way. Even after doing that, they failed to send the referral letter to that email. I will never go there again.

resp.text: I speak for myself and my entire team when I say our number one priority is excellent patient care. Our focus is to provide a positive experience in a caring environment and if you did not receive this, I’d like to extend my sincere apologies. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that you feel that standard was not met in your interaction with our practice.

name: debbie spinner
text: A dear co-worker of mine recommended Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry to me some time ago and I have never looked back. My visits have always been on time, efficient and thorough, from the greeting (by name!) at the front desk, to my hygienist, the Doctor and the well wish on my way out...goodie bag in hand! I have introduced my husband to this fine group as well and we have both in turn recommended this practice to other family members and friends, who have been thankful. When we moved (actually down-sized), we continue to drive a few miles further just to be treated like they really care! It feels like family and a plus - - - they know insurance and are always a step ahead.

name: blessed7fold
text:
I thought I would try these guys out since they were offering the new patient $89 special and have all these 5 five star reviews. However, I regret that I did now. The $89 special is just a bait and switch. What they don't tell you is the $89 special is only for a "light" teeth cleaning. If they have to do a heavier cleaning, you better get your wallet out! The price jumped from $89 to $289 just because of that. I called around to some other places in the area and I found that I could get the same work done for half as much as they were trying to charge me. Now I am out $62 in X ray fees that I didn't even need because I didn't accept their bait and switch offer and I already had some that I could of sent from another place.

You will see many reviews on here say that the staff is very friendly and nice and that is mostly true. However, they are not so friendly when you want to question their price. They act very smug and arrogant when you try to negotiate with them. They would rather not have your business then to try to earn your business. I think you would be better served in overall value elsewhere.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your unfavorable experience. We strive to be the best dental office in the community and we regret we missed the mark on your visit. Unfortunately, in dentistry we cannot always make an accurate diagnosis over the phone. We are happy to refund any money you paid toward services with which you were not happy. Please call Merry at 205-991-8850 at your earliest convenience and we will do whatever it takes to address your concerns.

name: R Smith
text: I have been using this Dentist for about 2 years now. I love the convenient location and friendly staff. I am always impressed with the service I receive. The TV's attached to the chairs are an added bonus!

name: lisa lamb
text: Brought our whole family of 5 including kids. Everyone was super friendly and made everything convenient from giving me forms ahead of time to make my kids first visit quick and painless.

name: Damon Night
text: Best dentist experience all around I've ever had!

name: LaTonia Williams
text: I am super sensitive and always end up in tears when I get a cleaning. This was my first visit to Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry but I will definitely be a returning patient. My hygienist was thorough, yet gentle. The ladies at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. Dr. Brewer was nice and informative.

name: T May
text: I was surprised by how quick Dr. Brewer and Dr. Samford were able to get me in as a new patient with a broken tooth at Double Oak Family Dentistry. Not only did the work take less time than I was expecting, the cost was way under what I was expecting without dental insurance as well. Dr. Brewer also helped me feel at ease by engaging with me while doing the work and letting me know where we were in the process, and I appreciated that. I've definitely found a new dentist.

name: John Pilewski
text: I very much enjoy Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry. The latest equipment and procedures make for an exceptional patient experience. Everyone is so friendly too.

name: Logan McGeeney
text: Loved my hygienist, Candy! She was so sweet. She was thorough yet considerate of spots that may have been uncomfortable. Dr. Brewer was informative and personable. Overall, the whole staff was great and they’ve become my new regular dentist.

name: Val W
text: The staff is ALWAYS friendly. I have never had a bad experience. Alecia and Tonya always go above and beyond to make your visit great. To see someone happy when you walk-in and out really can make your day.

resp.text: You are a great patient! Thank you for your kind review!

name: Mark Scholz
text: Teeth haven't felt this clean in years! Staff is super friendly and very accommodating. They also have the most comfortable examination chairs and also hand you the remote for the fancy tv attached to your chair. Definitely have raised the bar!

name: Hannah Waites
text: Love this place! Staff is friendly and Dr are patient and extremely professional. Would recommend anyone who needs their teeth fixed. The whole staff is super friendly and helpful. The dentists, hygienists and dental assistants are very knowledgeable. I could go to a dentist closer to my house but this is well worth the drive :)

name: Kwame Little
text: Best dental experience I've ever had. My hygienist was very knowledgeable and friendly. I am definitely with my decision in choosing Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry. Would recommend to anyone in the area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review. We enjoyed having you in the office!

name: Heather McDonald
text: Double Oak Mountain has been wonderful for me and my family. The work they have done for myself and my family has been wonderful. I'm much more comfortable smiling for photos now than I used to be. They are very involved with their patients and offer advice, education, etc. The office staff are super sweet and really care about you. They always get us in to be seen in cases where we have needed a fast appointment scheduled and they're great about sending reminders for cleanings, appointments, etc. The dentists we have seen have always been great about everything - they make sure you are completely comfortable and relaxed throughout the time you are in their chair. That really means a lot to me because I have a ton of anxiety about dental appointments. Their office and equipment are very clean and tidy and they have great equipment that makes your visit go smoothly (i.e. x-ray arms that come to in your chair without you having to walk all over the place). Their location is also very convenient. Can't say enough great things about this place, we will continue to go here for many years to come!

name: Elizabeth Adams
text: First visit to Double Oak Mountain and I had a good experience.  Fast service, friendly and helpful staff, personable doctor, and it was quick and easy to get an appointment.

name: Andy Hernandez
text: We are new to Alabama, Friend recommended Mounted Oak Mountain Dentistry. Have visited office twice. Dr Matson Brewer and his staff are great. If you need a dentist in the area, do recommend you make appointment with Dr. Brewer

name: Devynne Roahrig
text: Had a fantastic first experience here! My hygienist, Kim, was super nice, personalable, and professional. The office is very clean and has a nice atmosphere. And as a young person with no dental insurance, their prices are much better than most!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review. We strive to give patients a great experience!

name: Courtney Hendrix
text: This was my first dentist appointment in about 5 years due to my anxiety about dental appointments. I chose your office because it is very close to my home. Upon entering the door, I immediately felt at ease as I was greeted by a warm and friendly front desk staff. During my cleaning, the hygienist was gentle and efficient. All of my questions were answered by the doctor and his staff. Overall, I would recommend this facility to anyone looking for a wonderful experience at a dental office. -Tony

name: Mrs. Laqnda Hammonds
text: This facility is always clean with nice friendly staff members. The location is very easy to get to from HWY 280. There's plenty of parking available as well. I always receive a phone call within days of my appointment with a follow-up text the day of my appointment as a last minute reminder. The dentist nd hygienist always address my concerns. I would definitely recommend this facility.

name: Heather Heston
text: Everyone at Double Oak Mountain Dentistry is amazing! The girls at the front are always smiling and very helpful. The dentist assistants and doctors are so comforting and I can really tell they care. They are the sweetest and for the first time I don’t mind going to the dentist!!!!!!! Double Oak Mountain Dentistry is TOOTHaristic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Courtney Otts
text: I was chewing on some hard candy (silly me) and happened to notice I chipped one of my back teeth late Thursday night. I sent an appointment request around 5 am and the nice ladies at the front called and asked if I could come around 1030. I came at about 10 and waited maybe 5 minutes and got back to the room for an xray. Within another 5 minutes Dr. Roe was in ready to numb me up and fill in my broken tooth. I haven’t had a filling since I was a child (I am 27 now) and I was actually scared. I seriously did not feel a thing and was all patched up and out of there within an hour. If that is not good service I don’t know what is! Thank you all for fitting me in on a Friday!! :)

resp.text: Glad to hear you had a great experience! Hope to see you soon.

name: Courtney H
text: If I could rate more than 5 stars, I would! My 18 month old daughter and I just left this office for our first visit. First of all, last week when I called the staff was so welcoming and accommodating to all of my questions about becoming a new patient. They took the time to really help me navigate my way through the process. Today, we arrived and after a very brief wait in the waiting room, we were greeted by our hygienist, Brooke who was the sweetest. She was so flexible with my child who was not really into her first dental appointment. She worked around her playing in my lap, playing on the floor, and eventually crying. Other members of the staff came in and helped clean up her mess and offered to walk her around the clinic so that I could finish up my appointment. Dr. Brewer was efficient and very kind. I am most pleased with my experience and look forward to going back. Thank you for your kindness, this mama appreciates you all!

resp.text:
Courtney, thank you so much for your kind review. We enjoyed having you in the office last week and look forward to seeing you at your next visit. We are very pleased to hear you had a great first appointment! We strive to accommodate patients in any manner necessary to make their experience enjoyable.

The Team at Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry

name: Steven T
text: Best experience I have had going to a dentist in the past 20 years.  The staff is friendly and professional, the technicians are gentle/patient, and Dr. Brewer is an excellent dentist.  Having experienced anxiety going to dentists in the past, I was really impressed with the caring and patience at Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry.  I no longer dread the "dentist day" any longer.  Keep up the great work!

name: shawnie hale
text: This was my first time ever going to a Dentist and didn't feel anything, normally when i would leave other locations i would feel alot of the yanking on the tooth if being extracted or when he say your going to feel a little pressure,  i was ready to pinch the doc and tell him to hurry and apply the pressure but before i knew it he was telling me your all done,well when i tell you i am extremely happy with my service i am. I am happy that i chose this business and i will be returning for future appointments.

name: Landon K
text: I have been going to Double Oak Family Dentistry for about 10 years. Dr. Brewer has been my only dentist since I have been an adult and he has done an amazing job. When I stopped going to my childhood dentist at around 18 years old I didn't start going to another dentist. I had some bad habits and didn't brush my teeth as I should have. At age 21 I went to Dr. Brewer at Double Oak Family Dentistry because I had a toothache. He told me that my teeth were in really bad shape and that it would take a lot of time, work, and better personal care on my part to get everything under control. So after 10 years of teeth cleanings, root canals, crowns, and prescription toothpaste my mouth is in good condition...no bridges, no implants, and only one tooth had to be pulled. I couldn't be happier with the professionalism from Dr. Brewer as well as the staff. I would recommend this dental office to anyone who was looking for a good dentist.

name: s hess
text: Awesome office, staff and Dentist.  Dr. Roe and his assistant were very kind and thorough. Everyone at the front desk was warm and friendly. I would highly recommend.

name: J Wilson
text: I have been a patient of Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry for over 10 years and they are the best of the BEST!  The entire staff is incredible and I always feel as though I am the most important person in the office when I visit.  I can't say enough about this team.  Everyone is very professional, knowledgeable, personable, courteous and prompt.  I have always highly recommended this office and always will!

name: kgbcolo
text: DOM staff and Dr. Brewer provide the best dental experience I have ever had. They always go the extra mile to ensure that your care and treatment was handled professionally. The entire DOM staff and Doctors are pleasant and genuinely seem to take an active role in your care and well being. I would HIGHLY recommend DOM to anyone!

name: Cristen Boles
text: The staff here are all amazing, sweet, and super knowledgable. Wait times are non-existent. I would recommend to anyone!

resp.text: We strive to keep wait times non-existent. Thank you for being a great patient!

name: Debbie spear
text: I love this office! The staff are courteous, friendly, and truly seem interested in me as a person. And the care is always above standard.

resp.text: Thanks for being a great patient for a long time Debbie!

name: Amanda Britt
text: The best experience I've ever had at a dentist office! I don't like going to the dentist and was very nervous about going. When I walked in I immediately felt comfortable! My hygienist Brooke was wonderful! Would totally recommend her and double oak mountain family dentistry to my friends and family!

name: Lauren Stallings
text: I couldn't  have been more pleased with my first visit. The staff were so kind. They  listened to all my concerns and answered all my questions. I was just expecting an evaluation and they were able to work on the tooth the same appointment. What a huge blessing! I will certainly be continuing with them for all my dental needs.

name: Suzanne R
text: I have never been a fan of going to the dentist, but Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry has made going to the dentist and enjoyable experience for me. The staff are all so very kind and helpful. The treatment plans are easy and just what I need, and the environment is always pleasant and positive. It's really a great place!

name: Ashley Davison
text: Sweetest hygienist ever! Glad I chose them

name: Eduardo A Salgado
text: My experience with other dentists over my long life had not been good but these folks treated me just right.  They are all great! From the office staff, to the hygienists and specially the dentists, they provide support and painless treatments well worth recommending. Check them out!  You will not regret it.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Eduardo! We appreciate your comments and are proud to have you as a longstanding patient. We also appreciate you taking time from your important tee times to keep your scheduled appointments! =)

name: Caroline Jones
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Samford for more than 12 years and every appointment I've had in that time has been amazing. The staff is always professional and friendly. The office is always impeccably clean -- lobby, exam rooms and restroom! They do a great job of keeping on schedule which is very respectful of patients' time and schedules. I've sent several friends to Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry because it's the best dental office I've been to in all my 61 years of life!

resp.text: You are the queen of referrals and we so appreciate each and every one! Thank you for an amazing review and for noticing the "little" things which we hope sets us apart and makes us deserving of your referrals of friends, co-workers, neighbors and family. Our patients' time is as valuable as ours and we are glad it shows in such a positive light!

name: Michael Norris
text: I moved to Birmingham a couple of months ago and just became eligible for insurance with my employer. I started looking for dentists in the Birmingham area and found Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry. I chose them because they had the best review on a google search for dentist's in Birmingham. I went to my appointment not expecting much, after all it is a dentist. I was completely blown away with how friendly and professional the staff was. Not only are they great professional, they are exceptional people. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a dentist.

name: Rick Lee
text: Thanks to the caring and very efficient doctors and staff of Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry! Having been a patient with routine cleanings on a regular basis, I knew I'd found an excellent gem of a dental practice. It was only when I had a dental emergency that I realized the screws of allegiance were reciprocated and tighter than ever, They got me in the same day, out of pain and smiling once again! Thanks to all from your loyal patient.

name: Taylor Roden
text: I've always had fear of and bad experiences with the dentist, but since I've come here I've had no problems. Everyone is very nice and they make you feel at ease and they explain everything they are going to do. I have never loved a dentist more.

name: Michele McGaha
text: Very Friendly staff, minimal wait time, in & out of dentist chair, check out was also quick and efficient. The girls did a wonderful job of answering any insurance questions. They were very knowledgeable. Overall a wonderful experience and I don't like going to dentists, but this office has changed my mind!!!!

name: Katelyn Hicks
text: I have been looking for a new dentist for awhile now and chose Double Oak Mtn initially due to the professionalism of the website and kindness of staff when I called in. After my appointment I was confident in my decision and will absolutely be going back!

resp.text: We are very glad to hear you had a great first experience. We look forward to seeing you in the future!

name: Merry Lee
text: LOVE THIS PLACE! The doctors and staff are the best! I had my regular cleaning and exam today. Kim did an excellent and very thorough cleaning. Dr. Samford checked me afterward and I am pleased to report a "thumbs up!" What a wonderful birthday gift!

name: Courtney Pate
text: My first appointment with DOMFD was awesome!! Very friendly staff. I had a crown come off and I called them the day of requesting help, and they were able to fit me in. When I got there everyone was courteous and I was taken care of quickly. I’ve booked another appointment today... and for the first time in a while.. I’m excited to go to the dentist!! 😱

name: KidJohnnyC
text: Very helpful and personable!  My wife and I have been coming here for at least 12 years and have been happy with the staff and the service ever since.  We've been enjoying the relocation to Inverness Center very much.  Very efficient with your time.  All around pleasant folkls to be with.  Looking forward to future checkups!

name: Lee Wiseman
text: I had my first visit to your office yesterday.  I was immediately struck by the friendliness of your staff upon arrival.  I am always a bit apprehensive when visiting the Dentist, but was extremely pleased with my experience at your office.  The Dental Tech who cleaned my teeth was one of the best that I have ever had.  I could not have asked for a better experience.

name: Cathy Evers
text: While visiting our son and his family in Birmingham a cap on my tooth broke off.  My son called Double Oak Mountain and within an hour I was sitting in one of their chairs, numbed up, and a temporary tooth was made.  I could not have asked for quicker, kinder, caring professionals.  They were top notch.  Their attention to detail and concern over my situation was so impressive.  My situation was urgent and embarrassing because it was my front tooth.   I was away from my dentist in Pensacola and only half way through my trip to Ann Arbor, Michigan.    I cannot thank them enough for making me feel valued.In two weeks I returned to Birmingham to have the beautiful permanent crown placed on my front tooth.  Like my visit earlier in the month, everyone from the receptionist to the billing lady to the nurse to the doctor were wonderful.  I wish I lived in Birmingham.  Thank you for everything.  It was truly appreciated.  Cathy Evers

name: robin gardner
text: I had a dental emergency on a Friday which in itself is a nightmare,  I wasn't a patient here but, by the time I got off a 2min. conversation with them I sure felt like one. I was there a total of 40 minutes including drive time, paperwork, xrays and referred to an oral surgeon that they set up for me. They are amazing, professional, empathetic, great people.  Totally  appreciative of them.

name: Patricia Washington
text: The staff was welcoming and helpful. The hygienist was very attentive to my concerns and patient. Robin went above and beyond to make me as comfortable as she possibly could.

name: Bob Hill
text: Everyone was very professional but they also made me feel as if I were a regular (my first visit). One of the most painless dental visits I ever had and my teeth are the whitest they've been in years(didn't think that was possible). If the Army keeps me in Birmingham, I'll for sure become a regular.

name: Todd E
text: You won’t find a better dental practice than Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry. The entire staff is great. They make you feel welcome and valued as client of theirs. So glad that I found them so many years ago!

name: Bill Whitworth
text: My crown came off and my regular dentist was closed for the rest of the week. I called Double Oak Mountain Dentistry and they got me in that day.  The office wait was very short and the staff was friendly and professional. The dentist did a great job of restoring the crown.

name: Kim Martin
text: I was able to get an appointment the day after I called to get one up and was only in the waiting room for a few minutes before going back. I was terrified but everyone working there was absolutely wonderful. I have definitely found my new permanent dentist.

name: Robert Hyatt
text: Always prompt, polite and the service is both professional and fast.  Been coming here many years with my son and will continue to do so.  The people are courteous and friendly, making it seem "home like".

name: Janna White
text: Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry is excellent! The office is super clean. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I'm terrified of the dentist, but they put me at ease. I HIGHLY recommend this place!

name: JC DDS
text: My husband and I have been going to Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry for years. It's like my husband's second home LOL. The staff and doctor Sampson are very informative, warm and caring! They Take the time to really listen. We both enjoy our visits to their office. Thank you guys.

name: Kesh Renee
text: I thought it would be difficult to leave my dentist of 8 years. However, I made an excellent choice. The staff was friendly and Dr. Brewer was so nice. The office is close to my house and to receive such great dental service is a plus!!!! I would give more stars if allowed...

name: Bethany Bishop
text: The office staff is pleasant and professional. My hygienist is thorough, but gentle and careful as I have some very sensitive teeth. The entire experience from scheduling to checkout is a pleasure!

name: Ice House Vending
text: Best dentist office around! The entire staff is friendly and goes out of their way to make you comfortable no matter what you're having done. If you're looking for a dentist office you will not go wrong with DOMFD!

name: Frank H Guttery
text: Great experience!!! I didn't even have an appointment...I called on a Friday after 1 pm with a very painful problem with a tooth. They got me in, took care of the problem and I was out of there before 2:30!!! The whole crew at Double Oak Mountain Dental is great, very professional and extremely generous!!! Thank you so much for your help!!! Y'all are great!!!

name: Lisa Lu
text: This office is great!!  I broke a tooth on a Friday morning and while it is difficult to find a dentist who is open on Friday, this office was not only open, they took me on in and fixed me up with no trouble.  The office staff and Dr. Brewer are wonderful.  I highly recommend this office if you're looking for a good dentist.

name: Katie S.
text: Everyone at the office was pleasant and helpful! Even when I first called to get an appointment, they were very efficient and friendly. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing which is definitely a plus for a dentist's office! :) I would definitely recommend this office to someone looking for a dentist.

resp.text: Your feedback is exactly what we like to hear! Thank you for taking time to give us input. We work hard to maintain the standards you speak so highly of. Referring friends and family based on your kind comments is the ultimate compliment!

name: Shanah Adams-Smith
text: I really love going to Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry! We live in McCalla and I work in North Birmingham; however, the drive is worth it. Everyone is very personable while maintaining a professional environment. I always feel very comfortable no matter the procedure. The facility is up-to-date and very clean. My growing family and I will continue to visit this office. Thank you for all of your hard work DOMFD in making sure that my family and I receive the best care!

name: Natasha Pryor
text: I have been going here for almost ten years now and I love it! The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Excellent service!!

name: Carol Leeman
text: I love this office. Everyone is so nice and friendly. Dr Brewer is the best 😊. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Cade Neuberger
text: The workers were so kind and gentle on your teeth. The appointment was fast and it was nice getting to watch TV during it.

name: Claire Neuberger
text: Very nice staff! The dentist office was very clean and nice! The appointment was very easy and fast!

name: Chase Allen
text: The whole staff is awesome; I've been going to them for many years. I highly recommend DOMFD, Dr. Samford (despite his Auburn allegiance!), Kim, Alecia, and the rest of the crew. Nice, professional people who have become friends to me and I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: X-Boss-Hoss-X LG
text:
There isn't a whole lot to say other than:

1 - EVERYONE is NICE!
2 - The staff is very professional and personable.
3 - I ALWAYS look forward to my appointments.
4 - Kim is the BEST!

Thanks!

name: Robyn Jernigan
text: Very friendly staff, the hygienist Robin did a great job cleaning my teeth! She was very thorough! Dr. Brewer seemed nice and I appreciate his referral for an orthodontist.

name: Diana Feller
text: We have been pleased with the service provided at Double Oak Mountain Family Denistry! The entire dental staff has taken good care of our family, and offers a consultative approach to dental care and procedures. They truly care about their patients, and I highy recommend them!

name: Lindsey Romine
text: Love everything about Double Oak Mountain Family Dentistry! Everyone there is sweet and very helpful. The Dentist can sometimes be a stressful thing but they are able to get you in and out quickly without making you feel rush and they make you feel like one of the family.

name: Kelly Monroe
text: Couldn't have asked for a better experience. After putting off going to the dentist for a while, I was nervous to go. Every single person I came in contact with at the office couldn't have been any nicer and they were all very helpful. The girl at the front desk and Dr. Samford were both very patient and answered all of my questions about my insurance and an upcoming procedure eagerly. Going to the dentist is never something to look forward to, but Double Oak has definitely made it as great of an experience as it could be and I'll definitely recommend them to my friends and family.

name: Layla Hening
text: I just had a simple cleaning this morning but they were all super nice and friendly. My appointment was exactly on time and did not take too long. This was my first time here but I think I have found my new dentist!

name: Bethany Henry

I can't recommend this clinic enough.

text: I visited DOM to repair a crown that had come loose and was concerned that I was going to have to get a new which would not be covered by current insurance plan.  After Dr. Samford looked it over he determined that the old crown could still be used and he made the repair.  This saved me a great deal of money and I am very appreciative.  Dr. Samford and his staff are very helpful and develop a treatment plan that works with the patient and the patient's goals.

name: Cole Williams
text: The folks at Double Oak Family Dentisrty do a great job working with last minute schedule changes and the staff is wonderful throughout the entire visit.

name: Sharon Foust-Mills (Sharon)
text: Great dentist. Had to get a tooth removed when root canal from a previous dentist went bad. He understands that you might be on a limited budget, he's straight forward about the priorities needing repaired.

name: Charlotte C
text: I'm giving this place one star ONLY because this program requires it to leave a rating.  BAD DENTIST.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!! This dentist is BAD!  First of all he is VERY rough.  The front desk personnel AND the dentist have a BAD attitudes - perhaps being married and working together all day every day is not a good idea.  This dentist's hand are so big which causes even more problems for someone with a tiny mouth.  I had a filling replaced here, within a day it was obvious that something wasn't right so I returned to this dentist to have it repaired, he made an adjustment and after a week I was still having discomfort, when I called to get back in they couldn't fit me in right away and I had to travel out of town for a couple of months, as time went by the discomfort turned to PAIN.  When I returned home I made an appointment with a DIFFERENT dentist office to have the tooth/filling looked at - the filling was cracked and missing parts in 3 places and when this new dentist started taking it out - it was obvious that the filling material never set up properly as the filling was soft.  I would NEVER go to this dentist again for anything!!!!  AND they have very bad business practices because they refuse to give me a refund!  Perhaps it is time for him to retire!!!!!!!!  BAD DENTIST!!!

name: Brian Dasinger
text: Wonderful experience at Dr. Hart’s office!  Thorough check ups, great communication on billing and benefits, and painless dental work for my little ones!

name: Alia Mizelle
text: I do not recommend. I'm not sure what has happened since the previous reviews but it was not clean, cluttered and crunched into a tiny exam room, my husband and I both had appointments. The assistant was untrained and unfamiliar with the supplies he needed. Dr. Hart moved very slowly, bluntly placed the instruments on our chest in between using them, the exam and cleaning were both, the most painful and least thorough we've had. We drove 2 hours for a holistic dentist, not what their website portrays. If Dr. Hart is ill or they have fallen on hard times...God bless them but; the patient shouldn't be the one to suffer.

name: Theresa Yankovoy
text: I had a very relaxing and thorough dental cleaning. Melissa makes tooth cleaning seem like a gum massage. I am very sensitive, and Dr Hart and his staff really make me feel at home and relaxed. I travel to see him. I have tried local dentists, but I always go back to Hart. He is truly the very best dentist on the Gulf Coast.

name: RC 0093
text: They are very helpful and kind. I'm glad that I found them! They've worked with me, and helped me tremendously. Nothing negative about this place! The front desk and staff are all very pleasant in my experiences.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review we appreciate that very much!!

name: Leah Brymer
text: Great visit. Mr. Hart is a great dentist who share great information with you about your teeth/mouth health.

resp.text: Thanks for the great view that means alot to our practice!!

name: Roy Daniels
text: Dr.Dayton Hart really knows how to make his patients feel comfortable during their visits. The staff enhances this by being extremely genuine and nice at all times. Thanks guys. Can't wait for my next visit.

name: Jackson Gibbs
text: I honestly would recommend my dentist because he is beyond friendly and professional during each dental visit. He really goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable and explains everything thoroughly.

name: Jack Walker
text: Awesome dentist! Dr. Hart's office is actually quite peaceful, plus he is very nice. So if you are someone who gets nervous about dentist appointments, this would be a great place for you!

name: Madison Perekotiy
text: I love the team and their biological approach to dentistry. But their office majorly needs to be cleaned, organized and updated. Every room is very cluttered and not professional-looking. I also always wait 25-35 minutes after arriving, even when I arrive before my appointment time. Also it's very strange to me why, as biological dentists, they have a cookie baking oven in their waiting room and brochures from companies that use fluoride and other nonbiological dentistry tools.

name: Douglas Coleman
text: The dental hygienist that helped me was super professional as well as courteous. I have always had such a positive and informative dental visit every single time I go.

name: Steven Page
text: Dr. Hart is constantly going out of his way and beyond my expectations to help me as best he can and it's something i always notice and appreciate. He's a stand up guy and a wonderful dentist.

name: Thelma Santiago
text: Dr Hart  and his  staff  are  professional and  friendly. I  highly recommend him to all my friends and family.

name: Thomas Reed
text: I have many great things that I could say about Dr. Hart and his staff. I think the highest compliment I can pay them is for being a happy patient for over 20 years.

name: marie Kalantzis
text: This place is so unprofessional and not sanitized at all. Disorganized and cluttered, I felt like I needed to take a bath as soon as possible. Hygenist kept giving me excuses as to why their instruments didn't work, including their exray machine and had the gall to charge me $155 for half a cleaning, she told me I had some sort of gum infection but didn't offer anything to make it better. When i asked to see the dentist I was told he'll come in as soon as he was finished with his other patient, so I waited and waited till I decided to get up and go.What a dump. If I could rate this place as a zero I would have. STAY AWAY.

name: Arely Tapia
text: Front desk have a really bad attitude.

text: Dr. Hart has always taken great care of me and my smile. He spends time with me at each appointment answering my questions and making sure I'm comfortable.

name: joshthegrave
text: Dr. Cook is fantastic. He's incredibly gentle and caring. His staff is friendly and helpful. I actually look forward to going to his office. name: Bethany Gray
text: After an extensive google search for dentists in the Birmingham area, I chose Dr. Cook's practice; so my review is titled, "Who does that anymore?" After a rotten experience with Affordable Dentures, I called Dr. Cook's office, explained my dental situation including my short three week timeline to have everything done in order for me to be able to return to my teaching position in Alaska and was given an initial appt. within two days. A plan of action for a misplaced implant and new upper denture were made that very day. Four short appointments later I walked out with a new perfect denture and smile! But, in between that short block of time I had in the dental chair with Dr. Cook, kudos go out to his wonderful staff as they called often for an answer to a question Dr. Cook had, easily accommodated me with their appts. versus my other doctor appointments, called and made an appt. for me with an oral surgeon for further consultation on my misplaced implant(Affordable Dentures). They also provided kids with a toy choice from their Treasure Chest instead of a lollipop and listened to my crazy life living in 'bush' Alaska. Dr. Cook and his staff are thorough, accommodating, gentle, good listeners and make you feel like you are their only patient for that day!!!! They are now my only choice for dental care!!!!

text: Everyone at Aspen was wonderful.  They are so nice and helpful.  No judgement if you haven’t been to the dentist in a while, they pick up where you left off. name: Diane Abercrombie
text:
This was my initial appointment at Aspen Dental. From the receptionist to the Dentist, I was treated with enthusiasm, respect , professional and courtesy.
I was extremely impressed with the technology used to evaluate the dental health of a patient in conjunction with the physical examination.
The dentist, dental hygienist, x-ray technician, insurance manager were absolutely superb!
The hygienist explained the findings on my dental scan, which I have not experienced anywhere else. It was very informative and helpful in making priority dental work decisions.
The dentist, Dr. Dickinson was the last to evaluate me. He thoroughly reviewed all diagnostics, medical history, medications, etc.
What really stood out to me was his quick whit and demeanor. He made you feel like a family member. His evaluation was positive, to include the discussion of problem areas. You didn’t feel marginalized and berated because your teeth aren’t celebrity status.
Aspen Dental is an entirely different type of dental practice. They offer flexibility in payment plans, especially for those without dental insurance.
The prices are excellent, and far less than other quotes I’ve received.
Aspen Dental is a one- stop shop. When you receive stellar front desk, hygienist, radiology technician, patient-centered education relevant to your specific healthcare needs, and a dentist who’s actually enthusiastic to provide your dental care; that’s a drop the mike, need I say more, touchdown 🙏🏾.

resp.text: I'm glad you appreciated your visit, Diane. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a great experience. - Cindy, ADMI

name: margaret c
text: My initial visit was awesome, I had a very extensive dental exam and was relieved to see that I could get my fillings done relatively cheaply without insurance. However I have an anxiety disorder and it felt like like they were rushing with me, I was not made to feel at ease. The second appointment I had was to receive two fillings, when it came time to restore the natural anatomy of my teeth, it felt very rushed. She ended up grinding my two teeth down on the sides as well as the fillings. My natural tooth anatomy is gone, I still can't believe that happened. What's worse is the fact that I'm experiencing alot of pain in these two fillings, they are super sensitive to heat, cold and, pressure. I cannot eat very well, I am already struggling since I need so much work done. I will be going to a different dentist to get the work fixed. In the end this will end up costing me more time, money, and comfort.

resp.text: I'm so sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Margaret. We certainly value your feedback, and I wanted to let you know that I passed your comment along to our Patient Satisfaction team. I would encourage you call them too, so they can learn more and try to address concerns. You can reach them directly at 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

I would pay 3x times amount to someone other dental office  than have these clowns touch my mouth.  Can only imagine the work they would  do in your mouth if this is how the Business is ran. I will pass this forward to friends family social media etc.

Lee L

name: Lorri McDaniel
text: After breaking a tooth on Friday and calling multiple places, I was told that Aspen would be able to help me on Monday morning. The location nearest me was unavailable for 2 weeks, I would have to drive to the next location which is an hour away. After induring a weekend of pain, I got up and made the hour trip. After multiple xrays and being told the tooth would need to be capped. I was then taken to someone to discuss payment options. I was then informed that it would take 2 weeks for the cap to come in. I asked about a temporary cap and was told that they don't do that. There was no way I could indure another 2 weeks of pain. I would not recommend using for emergency treatment. Thankfully I was able to find a much closer dentist who was able to remove my old filling and put on a temporary cap. Also, my permanent cap will only take 4 days. Only a $90 difference in price but, I'll receive quicker service and not have to wait 2 weeks in pain.

resp.text: I am so sorry Lorri, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Nicholas Beisel
text: Dr. Stephanie and her whole team were great! I was very apprehensive about having dental work done at all, much less to the invasive degree I knew I would need. However, they went out of their way to make sure I wasn't embarrassed, my concerns and worry weren't marginalized, and aside from treating me very professionally, did so in an extraordinarily compassionate manner. While I am still in a fair amount of pain a few days out now, my expectations were managed very well and the procedure and aftercare haven't been nearly as bad as I had anticipated. I would highly recommend this Aspen Dental office and Dr. Stephanie in particular and will continue to use them again for all my future dental needs! Pricing was also very competitive in my opinion, and every effort was made to make sure the total came in under the number I needed in order to get the most important and pain relieving procedures done in the single visit I requested. Will post an update after completely healing as well.

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Nicholas. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a 5-star experience. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Bonnie B. “Alexarn75”
text: I was late for my appointment and they had to reschedule me me but got me in late day so that was nice. Everyone was professional. I made an appointment with a specific doctor I researched and asked for by name. When I got to Aspen I found out he wasnt even there and I would be seeing someone I knew nothing about. I felt this was really bad form. They didn't say anything from the time I booked till I was done Xrays etc that I wasnt seeing my requested dentist. The lady I saw was very nice and I liked her. But she wasn't who I wanted. I found them expensive in the optional add on charges like a pressure sensing toothbrush they sell. Found it at Costco for half the cost. Now I also found out I have to drive an hour to see the dentist I wanted to see at the start. I was supposed to hear from the office manager about getting an appointment with the dentist I want but it's been a week and no word. Poor form again. So basically I'm pretty disappointed with mostly everything. But the office manager at Aspen who I went thru my charges with at the end of the appointment was very nice. Just wish he'd called like he was supposed to. I kinda just want to go somewhere else now........raspberry.

text: You all advertise . Free exam and xray for those  that dont have insurance. We found out that was not true, told staff that i didn't  have insurance and i was a veteran. name: Delta Blue
text:
All-all, it was one of the best Appointments at a dentist I have ever had, since I developed an extreme anxiety to dentists, dental offices, and anything else associated with the mouth and teeth.  The anxiety was a result of an unfortunate event as a child while at the dentist.
I am having major work done, to the tune of nearly $9000.  No, there are no implants included in that work.
The only downside was, after having my appointment schedule, the morning of, they sent me a message about coming in a half hour early, to have an unplanned cleaning.  I had recently had a cleaning.  This news about the cleaning the morning of, totally freaked me out, and turned me into a slobbering idiot.  I had to call several times, crying, to get them to understand what happens, when anything changes on my calendar within a few hours, if it is something I already fear.
However, when I got there, after I had explained on the phone, I couldn't do the cleaning and the procedure back to back, I calmed down, took with me everything to distract me and get me more comfortable, it was FINE.
Before I knew it, we were done!
Yahoo!
I have another appointment in 5 days, for dreaded cavities, and am praying the appointment will go just as smooth!
Thank you guys at Aspen, for helping me restore my teeth and smile.  God Bless.

name: Shirley Rallo
text: It was a good experience.The staff was very nice and friendly.They all had their jobs and they did them well.The dentist was also very nice and easy to understand.A little pricey for me but I have just moved here.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing, Shirley! I am happy to hear of your great experience. The office will be so happy to read this. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Emily Chinal
text: We thought we would switch to Aspen because you always see their ads on TV saying how reasonable they are and how they didn't even make a veteran pay for his dental work on a cavity. Well, we are a military family as well and they sure as heck charge us even when they made the mistake of doing full stays when our insurance only covers some xrays. Their mistake cost us over $100. And they would not do anything to help us out when I asked. Then my husband went in for a tooth that was bothering him. They literally took a few minutes to look at it and sure enough they wanted to take xrays and when he said insurance wont cover it so he cant do them they didn't help him out and sent him on his way knowing he will be gone for a few months at his base. And I just got a bill for over $60 for them just to poke his tooth. Seriously NOT reasonable dentistry. I highly recommend going elsewhere!

resp.text: Hi Emily, thank you for your feedback.  I will certainly pass this information along to the staff, so they can address your concerns. — Dawn, ADMI

name: B Lewis
text: One of the worst dental experiences in my life.  I went to them initially to have an annual checkup and to have a chip/break in my front tooth repaire.  The repair they made looked fine but only  lasted less a few weeks.  Then the dentist recommended that I get a crown.  My tooth was prepared and they took molds of my teeth for the crown and supposedly  did a color match (WRONG).  When the tooth came back it was the wrong color.  But the temporary tooth that was put on in it's place fell out the first day.  No adhesive was applied.  The  doctor left before the temporary was placed in my mouth and the technician who put it in obviously used no glue.  I did not go back for them to glue the temporary (my fault/busy schedule).  I just persevered until the crown came in,  When the first crown came in it was too long and the wrong color.  So it had to be sent back for a color change and to be  shorten.  I received another temporary tooth.   Well the doctor put on another temporary this time and  he really glued it on.  He glued it on with an adhesive that obviously was WRONG for a temporary because they could not easily remove it.  The next dentist I saw had to drill the temporary tooth off.  Then the second crown again was the wrong color (WRONG AGAIN!).  Another temporary was made and put on.   So now I am waiting for the crown (Third time) and hoping it is the right color.  In the meantime the temporary I had fell off while I was eating a salad a few days ago and is broken and can no longer be used to hide the ugly tooth stub.  I have this HIDEOUS gap and STUB of a tooth in the front of my mouth.   I have had so much anxiety regarding this dental situation and no resolution in sight for a few more days. This is not a matter of insurance, nor a matter of money...I have both and have paid in full my co-pay for this procedure.  It is a matter of good dental service of which I have yet to receive.  After the first two disastrous  appointments and having not received a crown that matches and is acceptable I  am very disappointed and disgusted with ASPEN Dental.

text: I was nervous going in cause of some of these reviews but I really enjoyed it the staff was extremely kind the cleaning was good I go back for a root canal soon but everyone was very kind I really enjoyed it

resp.text: Hi Gracie, Each person experiences life in their own way. Often times, a patient can come in with their own preconceived thoughts, as to how the outcome should be. However, when a dentist does the exam, and finds something different, they immediately feel upset. No one likes to get news of possible dental work that will need to be done. It's scary, and costly, we get that. Everyone has their own way of dealing with good and bad situations. We would hope that all our potential patients would rather make up their own decisions, based on their own experiences. You were pleasantly surprised, and we are thrilled you took the step to see for yourself!! Be well - Cindy, ADMI

name: Drew Humphrey-Morgan
text:
The receptionist keeps her front desk on point, sharp as a tac! The young lady over financial is a pleasure to work with. Kindly direct, honest, and offers very helpful advice!

My nurse delivered excellent care. Very considerate and thoughtful, she was in for the win during my predictable “episode” (Fainted. I don’t much like needles). But under her tender ministrations, I was soon ready for the main event.

Don’t let the young appearance of the doctor fool you, he is very competent and professional. I’m always apprehensive at the dentist, but his bedside manner and cool disposition proved to be very settling. I felt no pain! Zero, zilch, nada! Even now, I’m feeling great the day after having two teeth pulled!

I still have a long road ahead of me, but I’m glad I decided to go with these people. They are wonderful!

name: Angela Lawler
text: I am a little late in posting this review. But, felt it was important because people so easily post negative vs positive. Dr. Walker and his staff went above and beyond to meet my dental needs. I previously worked as a dental assistant while I was paying my way through college. So, I know a bit more than the average patient. I have to say that Dr Walker is far above average in his skill and chair-side manner. I had to have an extraction of #18. I never felt the injections.  And the actual extraction was done with speed and ease.  I hardly had any bleeding. I have assisted on many ,so I was prepared for the stress and pressure that one typically feels. Experience none of that with Dr. Walker.  A couple weeks later, I lost a significant portion of an old amalgam filling on#32. Yet, another difficult tooth position. Dr Walker was aware that I did not want to extract the tooth.  But, could not afford a crown at that particular time. Therefore, Dr. Walker spent extra time diligently repairing the tooth so that I wouldn't lose it. As previously  stated, it's  been about a year and 3 month and the tooth is still holding steady. Dr Walker is a brilliant Dentist with a kind heart. A combination not often found. Not to mention he makes you feel comfortable. As if you've been friends for years. In sum, He's as good as it gets. Aspen Dental and the Florence/Athens AL area are fortunate to have Dr Walker.  If he moves, I will travel to receive his care.  He took the time to earn my trust and respect.

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Angela. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Michelle, ADMI

text: First time there. Everyone very nice. Only problem I had was with receptionist. The dentist listened and discussed my thoughts with me, not just telling me "we need to do this and this". Very nice visit. Very pleased.

name: Jo Robinson
text: We were not pleased at all with our experience at Aspen Dental. Xrays seemed excessive and were painful from the apparatus we had to hold in mouth repeatedly. Cleaning procedure was fine. However, what was supposed to be free through our Bc/Bs insurance plan cost us $150 each.  Our insurance plan will pay for X-rays and cleaning twice a year. text: People were very nice. But this place is very expensive.  But i would have been willing to pay it to get my mouth fixed. They claimed to have several financing options to chose from. What credit I had left git ruined when I had to quit work to take care of my husband who had stage 4 lung cancer and passed away 7 months later. I have devoted most of my life taking care of others. I raised my brother and sister, cared for my mother who had ovarian cancer, and my husband with lung cancer. I survived cancer after a long hard fight . And when I need help no one will help. Aspen dental gave me the name if a insurance company to buy dental insurance.  Then I still have to come up with thousands. They only want the money. They will not work with you and will not help you. And I desperately needed the help. No money  no help! text:
Was a horrible scam!! I moved to a new town and picked these guys. Folks were nice till i hit the hygienist. She did not even use a probe to record picket depths, she eye balled it, consequently coming up with ridiculous numbers. I see a dentist every 6 months, i know the health of my gums and teeth.
She told me a need a deep clean, and prescription mouth wash etc.
I had a filling going bad and i wanted that fixed.
They first send me to pay, fair enough,  oh and that cleaning and 1 filling would be 550 bucks, and " you are too far gone for a normal cleaning, and we will not fix that filling unless you pay for the deep cleaning".
At that time i requested my xrays and left, i recognize a hustle when i see one, STAY AWAY

name: Mary Bullard
text: Aspen Dental in Florence,AL has been a Godsend! I experienced horrendous wisdom teeth pain and had put off having them removed because I  have no dental insurance and an extreme anxiety toward needles going into my mouth. The pain got so bad that I ended up in the ER, which resulted in my having no choice but to get them out. I called Aspen Dental and they were so kind and helpful! They allowed me to set up an easy finance plan. They got me an appointment quickly. I had the x rays to be examined and the technician was so helpful by talking to me to make the long process of taking so many pictures go by super fast. I had an initial cleaning with a Mrs. Norma, whose vibrant smile and personality made me feel welcome and calmed my nerves tremendously.  During the cleaning they discovered I had gingivitis and they gave me a full treatment. They helped me get an Oral B toothbrush with Bluetooth capabilities and different modes for brushing and cleaning my teeth on my own. Mrs. Norma took time to give me tips on how to floss better so that I can prevent getting gingivitis again. When it came time to have my surgery, Dr. Perry helped my nerves by telling me what he was doing, when he was doing and why. Dr. Perry took time and didn't rush the process. The dental assistant that day was Mrs. Kourtney. I'll never forget how she kept me calm by reassuring me that I would be fine. She said being nervous was ok and normal. She kept telling me I was doing great. I don't think she knows how much I needed that. She kept my mouth suctioned, which I really liked because I have a tendency to have a gag reflex and that prevented it. Dr. Perry earned my trust and respect especially when he made the decision to divide my surgery in half. He did the left side, then had me wait two weeks for the other because he was concerned about my being able to eat comfortably. When he did the right side, he was assisted by a trainee who was kind also and attentive to my needs. If she continues to do as she did, she will be great! Overall, they really are a great place to go for dental needs. Even though I didn't need to use him, it also felt good knowing they have an oral surgeon with their office too. They will now be my go to for dental work! Thank you Aspen Dental!

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that you felt comfortable with the team, Mary! I hope that you find it easier to continue making your oral health a priority. - Emily, ADMI

name: Dedrick Casey
text: Great service fast and friendly.  They worked me in a slot to get my dental work done. I was in and out in no time.

text: My mom has had the same cap put on 6!! Times in less than three months. She eats nothing but liquid room temperature for two days, then soft foods for two days. It is either not molded right, or they are not doing it right.

As if it were our fault they fell behind and we didnt get called back until well after his scheduled appointment. Our appointment was at 5:45, and we didn't get called back until almost 7. l So we had to make two trips, and they were supposedly short staffed both times. If you are looking for a friendly, time conscious dentist, try Dr. Chastain in Killen.

text: I was hopeful that Aspen Dental would workout for me judging by the fact that I travel for work often and it would be convenient with the various locations. I am sad to say that my experience with Aspen has been extremely unsatisfactory. Not only has it been very pricey, I have been given multiple excuses as to why they cannot give me the filling I need. I have been to Aspen a total of five times and have been schedule for yet ANOTHER cleaning rather than the filling they have promised to give me "at my next appointment." I understand the process of dental procedures, but I have never been to a dentist that has promised me to get my issues fixed during my next appointment only to keep pushing it back further and further with every visit. I have requested a refund for the payment I have already given for the filling I have not received. I was told I would have the money put back on my card over a week ago and it still has not happened. I have tried to call multiple times. I am either put on hold or hung up on before ever speaking to anyone. This is by far the worst experience I have had with any professional practice. I will be finding a local dentist without a doubt.

resp.text: I'm so sorry you didn’t have a positive experience Emily. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315)454-6000, extension 201806. I would be happy to speak with you. Annette, ADMI

name: Robert Robinson
text:
NOT GOOD.  I called for a cleaning for my teeth and a general checkup.  After 3 hours I was told that they would not be able to clean my teeth (the main reason that I had scheduled the appointment) and that my teeth needed approximately $5000 of work.  When I asked how much the cleaning would cost they said $350 plus--way more than I have paid for cleanings in the past.  Consider this:  If I took my vehicle to a mechanics shop to get an oil change (teeth cleaning) but they spent 3 hours evaluating everything else wrong with my car telling me that it would cost $7000 to fix the other items in my car and that they could not do the oil change during this visit--the main reason that I had come to their shop--unless I scheduled another appointment and that it would cost $600 to do the oil change--WAY MORE THAN THE GOING RATE-----------WOULD YOU USE THEM AGAIN?  I think not.

This was absolutely the worse dental experience I have ever had in 60+ years.  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLINIC TO ANYONE!

name: Deidre Thomas
text: The front office is not knowledgeable. She overpriced me on procedures that are covered by my dental plan. Please do not take any children here. The Dentist is very nice but he will only take and examine the X-ray. Any dental work will be referred out! Also, they have the craziest policy......a customer has to get X-rays and then come back another day for a cleaning! Who has time for this??!? Any hoot, I played along since they already filed my insurance and I made another appointment.(months later) I was scheduled at 1030am, I showed up ap 10:10....I sat there until11:25 until I finally left. Total waste of time. I would give them a negative 4 if I could. I will say this, the dentist is nice and very professional but he needs to drop the Aspen brand and go into business for himself.

text: Office staff is great! Friendly and professional, they put me at ease right away. If it were only the staff being rated, this would be a five star review. The dentist however is only mediocre. I was in for two extractions and while he did pull the teeth, he did not loosen with a scalpel before the extraction. This will prolong healing and would only have taken an extra minute. He is a bit overbearing and in too much of a hurry. He did not council me about follow up care for my extraction and seemed to be in a bit of a huff about me not scheduling appointments with the hygienist. This was a good emergency visit, and in a similar situation I would go back.

name: Abby Forrester
text: Incredibly displeased.  The one thing I was impressed by was the fact that I could schedule an appointment online - I chose Apen initially because they seemed to run excellent specials for patients with no dental insurance. After arriving I was taken back for a full set of x-rays, was never asked if I wanted them done, and spent about 20 minutes having them completed. I was then taken back and told the hygenist wasn't in office today so the dentist would be coming by soon. The dentist then came in and performed a gingivitis probe without my consent. She ordered another test and then I was sent to billing - all without my teeth being cleaned which was the sole purpose of my visit. In billing I was told that the new patient process is a two appointment process and I would have to come back later in the week to have my teeth cleaned. I was then given a $306 bill for the services provided without my knowledge or consent. Very displeased with Aspen Dental and will not be returning.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526 I will be happy to speak with you. — Kelly, ADMI

BC/BS provider as per ads so I believe they will take care of me so i’am not in this pain all weekend as my dentist wouldn’t be open til Monday ,,,,well I get there they take an x-Ray of one tooth,the doctor taps on two teeth then tells me I will have to go to the root canal doctor that has done my other root canals and for me to call them Monday ,,I said but the lady on phone said y’all do them ,,they said not anymore at that location that doc was gone 🤷‍♀️🤦‍♀️ So I got nothing done that I needed after taking off work I was in the same position I was before I came here ,,then I get to the billing lady and she informs me that my BC/BS will not cover my exam , but it’s the same insurance I have had for years ,,they have always paid everything but a 30 co-pay on my exams ,,,so I call the same insurance lady from their lobby because they are trying to make me pay all of the fee,,,my insurance lady said you are covered and she wanted to talk to the billing lady ,,,my insurance lady tells me it is all fixed now and they had been just billing it wrong,,ok all taken care of so I get off the phone and wait for billing lady she then comes back and tells me she put it in the computer again and her corporate office sent it back again and I have to pay 100% ✋️😡 this is in front of everyone in lobby I have hated making a scene but I have two blue cross dental policies I pay for never had any problem,,my insurance people tell me and them it’s covered and they still will not take it ,,,,I am forced to pay all of it right there ,,after arguing with her over and over ,, so embarrassing,,,,when I get back to my car I call BC/bs again and they are surprised,,they said but we told them you are covered and how to bill it ,,,,so now my insurance company is going to call me every Friday with an update on getting my money back from this company,,,I would never ever go here again,,,,,Aspen dental did nothing but steal from me and leave me with my same toothache

resp.text: Happy to hear you had a good experience, Linzi! We appreciate your kind words! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Isaac Graves
text:
This visit to Aspen Dental was extremely important to me, and I really couldn't be more satisfied. I, personally, have suffered from depression and anxiety for a large part of my life, as well as adolescent gran-mal seizures since I was fifteen years old. The seizures prevent me from being able to drive a car, which prevents me from from being able to get to and from a workplace easily.
Lacking regular funds/insurance coverage, and being anxious and depressed did lead to my neglecting my dental health, which simply exacerbated my anxiety. I suffered a huge panic attack after encountering some (actually relatively minor) dental pain a few days ago. I made an appointment at Aspen Dental for the next morning, which was impressively easy to do online and your staff here at Cox Creek Pkwy did not disappoint me whatsoever; service was extremely professional. Dr. Konradi and the dental hygienist couldn't have done a better job at reassuring me that my shortcomings can be overcome.
My blood pressure at the time was apparently extremely high, most likely a result of the panic attack I suffered the night before, compounded by a minor fever and a lack of sleep. I took my blood pressure this morning and it has thankfully returned to a normal level (111 over 76). I have already purchased the recommended electric toothbrush and a new pro-gum-health toothpaste. I have been instilled with a strong sense of hope already and I have no doubt anymore that I am capable of restoring my dental health. As much as I can, I thank you, and I am looking forward to my next visit whole-heartedly.
Sincerely,
Isaac E. Graves

text: Dr Dutton is easy to talk to, listens to my concerns. He makes me feel really comfortable and the staff is great and friendly. The office is always clean and they pay close attention to the COVID regulations. It’s always a great experience with dr Dutton.

name: Brian Nothnagle
text: I have been treated by Apex for over a year and wanted to wait a bit on a review. This is a great dentist and dental office. They're always on time friendly and he can do more than most dentists with the state of art equipment he has at his office. He did an extraction in his office saving me a lot of money if I had gone to a Maxillofacial surgeon. I have had several crowns and in process of an implant, no rework and no problems to date. Again, no waiting. And did I say the staff is friendly its a positive environment.

name: Dee Mo
text: Amazing team. They treat you like family. Always friendly and professional.

name: Donny Black
text: My daughter worked for him. When they hired her he knew she needed more training. When she would try to work he would huff and puff at her which made her more nervous instead of teaching her. When he let her go he said their personalities didn’t fit and she was to shaky. Wouldn’t u be shaky with someone like that??? He basically told her that her certificate she got hurt her more than helped. Now after years of wanting to be an assistant and go into dental hygiene she says she doesn’t want to because she feels like she can’t do it. He basically ruined her dream. I don’t feel like u should treat ur employees like that. We should uplift and not tear people down and ruin what they wanted to do with their life. He should have never hired her if he didn’t want to teach. His assistant would also yell at her and told her that’s how u learn. The assistant also told her to do something wrong and she got blamed so she told him it wasn’t her. We was told this was the real reason he let her go. I feel he owes her an apology and to tell her she shouldn’t give up on herself. How would he like it if it was his child???

name: Treacebaby
text: Staff was professional, friendly. Everything was explained well I felt time and care was shown throughout my appointment .

text: Very nice office and very friendly staff and very efficient

text: Awesome dentist and staff. Called yesterday and they said they could fit me in this morning at their other new location. Dr Watkins is awesome he pulled both teeth and stitched me up. Was done in under an hour!

text:
Best dentist 10/10 everyone should go here ❤
Everyone there is super nice and helpful. Best experience I've ever had at a dentist.

name: Hannah Bush
text: I could not have picked a better place! Ashley from the front desk made me comfortable and feel like apex really cared from the very beginning. She was professional, caring, and friendly! How many dentist offices can say they check on their patients in pain between the time you make the appointment and the actual date of the appointment? Apex can. Ashley took the time to text to check on me throughout the week and that really says something about the type of people they are.  Second, the dental assistant I had was phenomenal! Cora was so awesome and easy to work with, i think we laughed more than we did anything! She was so patient and gentle and it is so obvious she cares and loves what she does! She made me feel so relaxed, like we were old friends! She made the root canal experience almost fun if it wasn’t for the fact that i was there for a root canal! Dr. English made me feel as comfortable as I could have felt in an uncomfortable situation. He was very easy to get along with and has a great table side manner, not to mention he was quick and great at his job! I have plenty of dental work to look forward to in the future and I won’t go anywhere else as long as I can help it. Apex dental blew my mind away and there isn’t a better place to go in my opinion.

resp.text: Thank you Hannah. We are happy to hear that during these unusual times our staff came through! We look forward to seeing you and your family in the coming months. Welcome to the Apex Dental family.

name: Dianne Wills
text: Couldn't have been a better experience! My thanks to Dr. English and his staff!

name: John White RCDD
text: I found Dr. English and his team about two years ago. I will remain a faithful patient until he retires and then I’ll bug him to come back if I need a filling. Let me save you some time. Look no further, Dr. English and his team are by far the most professional and understanding dental practice in the country. I travel for hours to receive my dental care here. I’ve had cleanings to bridges to fillings and every single time was five stars. This man will not stop until it’s right - he takes no shortcuts and is as honest and as straightforward as is gets. I would put my life in this doctors hands and not have a worry in the world. He hand picks his team and chooses only the most motivated and brilliant techs and office staff. There are not enough stars available to rate the value and professionalism of this dental practice. Trust me when I tell you to put down your mobile device and make an appointment - you’ll be very happy you took my advice.

text: Apex Dental is amazing!!!! I actually called them on accident as I was in so much pain and clicked 'call Apex' instead of ******. Ashley answered and she was so awesome. The hygienists are very friendly. No one tells lame jokes while you're lying there with your mouth wide open so you don't have to worry about doing that awkward laugh thing. The office is clean and bright. I have had cleanings, a fill-in, a root canal and teeth whitening service (get the custom trays!!). I highly recommend Apex Dental.

name: Katherine Hardiman
text: Dr. English did a root canal for me a couple of weeks ago. Although a dental procedure is obviously not the most pleasant experience, he and his staff made me feel comfortable and helped calm my nerves. He was extremely thorough with great attention to detail, and he was not rushed at all, he took all the time he needed to do the job as perfectly as it could be done. The technology they have at the office is top of the line, and after only a few days they received my permanent crown and I was able to have it put on during my lunch break. I loved that I did not have to wait in the waiting room on either visit. I highly recommend this business and I am returning next week to begin annual cleanings!
