text: Pleasant atmosphere, friendly staff, and they did an excellent job. I did not feel the discomfort from the dental work that I have felt at visits with other practitioners.  Dr. English and Apex staff are the best!

name: Michelle Gilmore
text: Listen y'all, I normally don't leave reviews,  i let folks know when they do a great job while I'm there. Dr English and his ENTIRE staff are the most professional, kind, knowledgeable, and compassionate people I've encountered in my life! No lie, I'm a complete wimp when it comes to dentistry. I've suffered from dental anxiety all of my life. I've always opted for extractions over getting a filling, and i had to be put under anesthesia first. I was a true phobic, until yesterday. The second his staff called to confirm my appointment, i truly felt in her voice that i wasn't just some faceless voice over the phone. She was so genuine and could relate to my fears. Upon arrival, i was continously greeted by the most beautiful, empathetic, professional staff. Every single person was not only physically beautiful, but genuinely beautiful from the soul. Now, you can't learn that. Thats something thats ingrained deep within and it simply flows out when you're doing something you love.  I don't know about y'all,  but I've literally been around the world and unequivocally, I've yet to frequent an establishment where EVERYONE makes you feel, like you're the only person there! Got my teeth cleaned and didn't feel a thing! She was AMAZING! Never has this happened before, to me. My gums normally hurt for a few days. Yesterday, Dr English took my hand and he promised me that my procedures this morning wouldn't hurt. I was so very skeptical. When i walked in, i felt like a jitterbug! I was literally having a secret panic attack. Well, Dr. English and his staff had me covered. When i say, "yo, it didn't hurt"...what I mean is, "it really didn't hurt!" At one point, i felt a little pressure, but he was all over it in 2 seconds flat! Bottom line up front: Dr. English and his staff are all easy on the eyes, beautiful from the heart, extremely knowledgeable, professional,  and courteous.  I went back to work and told everyone i saw about them at Apex Dental in Madison,  Alabama! No, I'm not sponsored. Wasn't paid for this review, and my opinions are all my own. If you need quality dental work, want to experience pain free dental, and patronize an establishment that "brings customer service back", then look no further! They have it figured out! I love these guys! The entire staff rocks...everyone of them! Don't just take my word, please go see for yourselves.

name: Cindy Slovak
text: Dr.English and his crew have been our family's dentist  and practice for the long haul.  I can't say enough good things about them all. Ashley is amazing about letting you know when your appointment is and rescheduling to fit your busy life. Her sass and wit are nerve soothing. Susan, Felica, Lee, and Oliva are friendly, caring, and great at their jobs. It's like Professionalism and Great Bedside Manners had a baby and these girls are them lol. I usually hate dentists and put off going to see one to a crazy level of stupidity...but never once have I ever made to feel like a disgusting patient. None of my appointments have ever been painful or a nightmare. Dr.English is a wonderful dentist, his skill is definitely the Apex of dentistry. Love this place and highly recommend them!!!

name: Matrix Tools, LLC
text: DO NOT GO TO THIS DENTIST!!!!!!!  worst dentist experiences i've ever had in my life!!  first i got a bridge put in here and i had a migraine for a month..  then i reschedule my next appointment, and i'm perfectly happy with my appointment time..  for some reason they call me every day asking if I can come in earlier.  Finally one day I say, ok fine, what do you have today Ill see if i can make it.  They say 2:45, and I say ok.  I tell my boss and make all the arrangements to go to this early appointment just because they requested me to do so..  there is an accident on the way and it takes me longer to get there, i get there at 3:00 instead of 2:45, and they said because i was 15 minutes late they could not take me..  they actually had me wait in the lobby for 15 minutes before they called me back into an office room and explained to me why because i was a little late I lost my appointment.  So it took me 30 minutes to get there because of traffic, they had me wait for 15 minutes in the office, and they told me they couldn't help me at all...  the only reason i was in the office that day was because they requested me to come in for an earlier appointment.  it was a huge pain to ask off to get to their office and for them to put their time schedule far above my own time schedule was incredibly rude.  i will never never never go back.  horrible experience.  if you go here, you better never be late for an appointment and like migraine headaches.  i'm 35 years old i've been to many many dentists, the service i received at apex dental literally makes me sick. i've never been treated so badly in my life.

name: Sharee Sanders
text: They seemed nice. I had a problem with a tooth and am pregnant. They seemed like they were sympathetic and scheduled the next available they could. When I arrived, the dentist seemed extra friendly to everyone else. My 4 year old daughter was with me. They called me back and immediately tried to do the panaram xray. I'm pregnant and can only do a small xray for emergencies. They seemed confused and had to ask someone about it. Then they took me to my room and told my daughter (who is 4) that she had to stay 3 rooms away in someone's office of whom she has never met. She was scared. I had to take her and leave her. Then they seemed confused why my scared little girl wouldn't follow them back to my room and sounded exasperated. I went and got her (which was my intention from the beginning anyhow). Then they told me they wanted to pull two of my teeth and I said I had to think about that. Then a lady came in and yelled at her because her foot was on the wall. There wasn't anywhere for her to sit in the first place and they placed a 4 year old on a spinning stool that was against a wall. Dug! Then they came in and laid out all of their instruments to pull my teeth when I never agreed to that treatment.. Just an overall bad taste in my mouth visit.

text:
I contacted Cypress Creek Dentistry office online to set up an appointment as a new patient. Within 30 mins. Dr Kennedy’s front office was calling me to be seen. Jamie was very kind & professional & concerned I be seen that same day (3 days before the thanksgiving holiday) to ensure I didn’t have any trouble over the holiday weekend. Dr Kennedy and her hygienist, Stephanie worked me in for a quick X-ray & made me feel so at ease and comfortable. After discussing treatment plan I came back a week later  for a procedure. Dr Kennedy and her assistant again provided the utmost care and comfort making sure I was relaxed, free of pain, while enjoying the heated massage chair. I will recommend Dr Kennedy and her entire staff for your dental care. They have totally changed my fear and avoidance of the dentist. I wish I could give more than 5 stars because they exceed excellence in all areas.
Also, Dr Kennedy personally called/texted me the evening after my procedure to check on me. That in itself shows her genuine care for her patients. Very impressive and grateful to be a patient. Thank you Dr K & the entire staff at Cypress Creek.

Professional, courteous, friendly and genuine is how I would describe Dr. Kennedy and her staff. A special thank you to Karla for going the extra mile to take care of me, my health and my smile. It is comforting to know that I now have a Dentist in the area that I can trust and rely on to take good care me.

text: The staff was absolutely amazing.  I had an emergency they were able to get me in immediately.  I walked in to a warm, inviting, and comfortable atmosphere. I was very nervous and she was so kind and caring. She had me laughing and made my day so much better. I will definitely recommend Dr. Nguyen and Northcutt Dental.

text: Dr. Yarnell and staff are very friendly and good at what they do. They really make an effort to make sure you’re well taken care of and that you have a good experience when you’re there. Highly recommend!

text: Great dentist!  I HATE the dentist but Dr Gneun(?) (When) was amazing and her staff explained everything as they worked and put me completely at ease. So gentle and kind and personable. Great experience.

text: Staff is super friendly! My hygienist talked me through everything she was doing which I definitely appreciated. I’ll be returning soon!

text: The office is always clean and refreshments are provided in the lobby. The staff goes out of their way to make your experience a good one. They provided me with a warmed blanket and a remote to watch TV while my teeth were cleaned.

text: My first experience at Northcutt Dental was wonderful. Everyone was friendly and the dentist and and dental assistants took the time to get to know me and understand the problems I'm having with my mouth. Will definitely be back and recommend!

text:
I don't think I have ever felt comfortable going to a dentist, however I look forward to my next visit at Northcutt Dental in Helena!

I don't think this review on my most recent visit does this office and it's staff justice! Warm, welcoming, put-you-at-ease kind of place. They even brought me a warm gooey fresh baked chocolate chip cookie while waiting to be called!

If you're looking for a dentist in the area ... check out Northcutt Dental in Helena. You'll wonder why you didn't come here sooner!

name: Robin Crowder
text: I cannot say enough good things about Northcutt Dental they are AMAZING!!! Everyone is so sweet and knowledgeable. They truly make you at home!  They make sure you understand everything going on and take the time out to answer any and all questions you have. Dr. Yarnell is kind, caring and understanding. Rachael was my assistant and I can’t say enough good things about her!!! Best dental experience ever! They have definitely gained a patient for life!

name: Peggy Griffin
text: There is an incredible, personable staff to greet you the moment you step into a truly relaxing and beautiful office.  The technicians and doctors are well informed and diligent. The equipment is up to date; the experience is  not like being at the dentist. This is a truly good thing!

name: Kabeer Ahmed
text: I had to make a last minute appointment due to severe pain and they were open till 7pm on Tuesday. The service was excellent and Dr. Ward is the best. She explain everything in detail and gave me options. Also I love the fact that they discuss the cost. Going forward i will definitely use Northcutt Dental and recommend to everyone. They are the Best.

name: Heather Brandon
text: Magnificent. Dr. Yarnell and his team are so attentive and great when it comes to nervous patients who fear the dentist like me. I had two cavities filled and I didn't feel a thing. They had no qualms about my request for nitrous oxide and to bring my own music. Constantly checking on me and making sure I was at ease. Highly recommend

name: Dennis Cruz
text: Simply the best dental experience one could hope for. The team there is very professional, considerate and caring. The way they approach things will make one want to continue going there. We are very pleased with this practice.

name: Kabeer Ahmed
text: I had to make a last minute appointment due to severe pain and they were open till 7pm on Tuesday. The service was excellent and Dr. Ward is the best. text: Friendly and helpful in everyday. Love the look and feel of the office.Not like your everyday. Dentist office and staff go all out to make you feel comfortable. Will tell everyone about Northcutt Dental.

name: SFL SNOWY
text: The staff was great . Worked hard to get my insurance worked out. The reviews that says no pain is correct . I did not feel any pain when he injected me nor when he extracted the tooth.  . Everything went great .This my new dentist. Thank you guys.

name: Hayley Boteler
text: Very friendly staff and went over and beyond to make my visit very comfortable.

name: Chelsea Lucas
text: Wonderful staff and so friendly at the Northcutt Dental located in Helena! I typically dread going to the dentist but everyone made sure I was comfortable. They fully explained why I was having certain problems, their recommendation on treatment plans, and other benefits that could help my overall oral health. Definitely recommend this dental practice!!

name: Angel Tillman
text: I really wanted to like this dentist's office.  It's very efficient and clean.  The work is done promptly.  I did not care for the first hygienist I had, so I asked to have her replaced.  The second was much better and the third hygienist was the best I've ever had.  However, when I first switched to Northcutt, it was because my previous dentist retired.  I was told that a filling I had received needed to be replaced.  I was reluctant, because it wasn't giving me any pain or problems, but I had it replaced.  After the replacement, the dentist said he needed to replace his own work (no charge)  so he did.  Then I started having a lot of pain from the 2nd replacement.  He worked on it a 3rd time.  The last time I went in, he expressed that the whole tooth needed to be crowned - lest I eventually need a full root canal.  (this time charged of course)  Needless to say, I will have to be getting a second opinion.  I cannot have the same tooth worked on 5 times unless it truly is necessary.

name: Jody Glass
text: Great staff. Goes the extra mile to make you comfortable. Speaks with you through out the visit to keep you informed.

name: Moth and Wolf
text: I haven't been to a dentist in a long time. They took the time to explain to me what was going on, calmed my worries, and handled me with care. Couldn't recommend them enough.

name: Gene Horton
text:
Kind and gentle care. Very personable staff. And I didn't feel judged for not having taken better care of my dental health. They just wanted to help me get better.

Friendly staff from the telephone call through the stitches.

name: Tamika M. Arnold
text: The staff at Northcutt is always kind and courteous. They also do an amazing job explaining out of pocket cost that allow patients to plan better for future care.

name: Jeremy
text: One of the best dental business I have ever had the pleasure of being.

name: Matthew Stone
text: Had terrible experience with aspen dental. Went to Northcutt Dental and had the best experience.  All the staff is wonderful. They play Christian music and ask if you want to learn more about Christ on the initial paperwork. They are extremely dedicated to comfort for the patient. And they somehow cost less !!!!

name: Hazel Byerly
text: Great place to come if you need dental work done. The staff is nice and friendly and they take really good care of thier patients.

name: Destinee Hill
text: My first visit at Northcut Dental was amazing! All of the staff were very nice and made me feel comfortable.

name: Marsha Tatum
text:
When you enter Northcutt Dental Helena, it definitely is an experience. With the smell of fresh baked cookies & freshly brewed Kureg Coffee what’s not to like about that!
The Business Associate, at the front desk greet you by standing with a friendly welcome home smile, the Living Room is absolutely beautifully decorated and very clean! The whole office is state of the art!!
Everyone from the front to the back is AWESOME!!
Tyndall was my Hygienist. She was AWESOME! She was very thorough & and explained everything to me.
The Whole Team is Very sweet and knowledgeable.
Dr. Yarnell & Dr. Nguyen are both Great!
Everyone was genuine :)
If you are looking for a Dental Family, you should give Northcutt Dental a call today! :-)

text: Friendliest staff around!!!! Everyone from the front office staff, to the dental assistants and dentist were all so sweet and courteous. They take the time to evaluate your specific needs and provide you with a detailed treatment plan. A beautifully decorated office that offers extended hours on Tuesdays and also open on Fridays too!!   :)

name: Pete Forbes
text: Very nice professional staff. They explain the procedures as well as the insurance benefits and process. Warm and friendly people. Dr. Yarnell and his team are awesome! I highly recommend them!

text: Great, friendly and very professional team. Nice atmosphere, calming and relaxed. A great place for the whole family, games for the kids, and tv for everyone while you wait. The staff is very good and you really don't have a long wait time. I would recommend to everyone.

text: Great experience. Friendly staff, very comfortable ambiance, faith friendly. After 5:00 appts available during the week. Highly recommended.

text: My family and I absolutely love Northcutt Dental. My kids love their hygienist as well as the assistants! Dr. Yarnell does excellent work and the atmosphere in the office is always pleasant!!

name: Linda ingram
text: I have seen Northcutt Dental commercials for several years but this visit was even better than commercial. Staff was unbelievably welcoming and friendly yet, comfortably professional. I was offered bottled water, watched HGTV with no down time, received attention from at least 4 staffers who all called me by name including a pop in visit from Dr Gyuen  (sic) which was unexpected.  All I can say about Northcutt customer service is wow!

name: Kristy Sellers
text: They are just awesome!  Best dentist I've ever had.  They make you feel comfortable.   They're easy on your teeth.  I had 2 pretty good - sized cavities filled and i dont feel sore like you've been massacred.  They do an excellent job!   If you have anxiety regarding dentist,  you need to try them to try them:)

name: Renee Sloan
text: Amazing staff!  Very helpful, polite, and did wonderful with my 6 yr old when he was scared.

name: David Hernandez
text: Awesome and Friendly Staff. Very professional staff that works as a team. If you need a dentist and it’s an emergency this is the office to visit.

name: Crystal Dietz
text: Today was my first time to go to Northcutt Dental office. From the moment I walked in the door I felt welcomed the staff were so nice. My Family and I won't be going anywhere else but there. Thank you for all the information and wonderful experience.

name: Tammy
text: Everyone was nice and they were all very professional and the work I had to have done was excellent!

name: William Shannan Seelmann
text: The admin staff is friendly and the office is nice and clean. The porcelain crown I had done less than a year ago not only came off tonight but it also has a hole all the way through it. The assistant who adjusted it before it was cemented did not listen to anything I said when she was fitting and drilling on it. I told her the contacts were too tight, but she insisted on adjusting the occlusal (biting surface) until here we are less than a year later with a useless crown. Since we've already moved from Helena, I can't even get Northcutt Dental to make this right. Insurance only pays for 1 crown per tooth every 5 years... I would not recommend this place!

resp.text: I want to thank you for talking with us to discuss your issue. It is our goal to make sure our patients are raving fans of NDP and we want to do all that we can to address your needs upfront. We are sorry that you had this experience and hope you were pleased with our quick response & solution to your concern.

name: Gloria McGee
text: Dr. Ward and the staff at Northcutt are very professional and friendly. The office is very contemporary and welcoming. The staff are all very gentle when administering treatment.  I would highly recommend Northcutt to all for your dental needs.

name: Kakki Brown
text:
A great experience from the moment I walked through the doors! A professional and exceptionally friendly staff who answered all my questions and provided me information to help on future visits. I definitely recommend this Helena based dental practice  to anyone who wants affordable, professional dental care. Special thanks to Dr Yarnell, Tyndall, Sharon, Cynthia, and Katearia. (Hope I got spellings correct!)
Northcutt Dental has become my new dental "home."

name: Alan Farmer
text: The staff at the Helena location are awesome! I took my 16 year old son in for a check-up and cleaning and he really enjoyed it. I highly recommend Northcutt Dental in Helena!

text: Dr. Yarnell and staff are always very friendly and professional. I feel welcomed each time I have an appointment. My family and I are glad Northcutt opened in Helena.

text: Fantastic staff, the made going to the dentist as stress free as possible. It's nice to find such easy going folks to take care of my health.

name: Traci Rauccio
text: Absolutely best experience ever . I have a phobia of the dentist ...and the whole staff put me at ease and was patient with me. The dentist cares and is the first dentist to take my Concerns and fear seriously. I won't be going anywhere else.

name: Gene Darden
text: They are the best   informative, high tech, fun and knowledgable.  The staff rocks from front to back.

name: Zahir Merchant
text:
Stay away if you value your money.

They quoted me $17k for my dental work, went somewhere else (which had to redo my x-rays for free because the Northcutt ones were so poor in quality) and they quoted me for around $4k without my insurance, just around $1.5k with it.

The red flag for me to get a second opinion was when they kept pushing a $15 enamel toothpaste. If you look it up on Amazon, you can get the exact same toothpaste in a two pack for the same price.

If a dental office is willing to sell you toothpaste with a 100% markup, you have to imagine what else they're taking advantage of you on.

To be fair, the staff is friendly, and the office is very very nice with games for kids.

But this price gouging is ridiculous, and I think someone has to acknowledge it.

name: Leslie Miller Hoffman
text: Best dentist office I have ever visited! Staff is awesome!

name: Chris Hammond
text:
I've hated going to the dentist for years, but Dr. Yarnell at the Helena office and all of his staff are great.
Very nice atmosphere and friendly people.

name: bryon williams
text:
Northcutt Dental has the most attentive professional staff I have experienced ,
thanks Nicole an the rest of the staff

name: Bruce Anderson
text: No more pain

name: cherelle danae mesa
text: Very friendly staff! Clean office.

name: Tim Rohrbach
text: Short wait time, friendly staff,

name: Marlene Carver
text: Concerned, caring,  and GENTLE dental office.

name: Diann Bibb
text: First my initial appointment that I made online was for 9:30 then I received a call from aspen telling me my appointment is for 8:30 even though  I have the email confirming my time. Arrived at the location @8:20 when I finished it was 11:15 ridiculous will not be going back. Also any procedures you will need they require you to pay 60% of the cost upfront before services can even be performed.

resp.text: I am so sorry Diann, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Kevin Allen
text: Great service here today I will definitely choose Aspen dental again!

text: Need a tooth pulled? Don't come here, they'll just try and sell you something else and forget your tooth altogether. But making sure they bank the insurance for x-rays I'm sure.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Denn. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Karen Harris
text: Made an appointment for a cleaning and wasted an hour of my life! I should have walked out when the tech didn't seem to know what she was doing with the xrays.  It seems they are only concerned with upselling services and gettting you to agree to unnecessary treatment.  Needless to say, I walked out and refused any more services and still did not get my teeth clean.  Will not be going back nor recommending to any one.

resp.text: I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to expectations, Karen. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the Patient Satisfaction team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Renee Jefferson
text: I was searching for a new dentist office to bring my family. But, just from reading the reviews from the customers of Aspen Dental  help me to make my mind-up to never go to one of their offices. Thanks but no thanks!

name: Saoona Frazier
text: As a 1st time patient i waited 2 hours in the lobby an wasted over an hour in the back to only find out that the oral surgeon  despite me being in pain with a wisdom tooth only extract 2 or more teeth (time is money) an only be in office once a month an pick the patient he want to extract teeth the others be referred out are you a have to wait til the next month an hope he pick you then. The dental emergency an walk- in is a lie if you ask me because if nobody has cancelled their appointment you have waited for nothing in pain are not you won't be seen.  They didn't call my prescription in (im in pain) or give me the toothpaste they recommend me to use smh... I wouldn't recommend Aspen Dental 😡

resp.text: I am so sorry Saoona, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Aaliyah Boyen
text: I went in for a 1030 am appointment which they made for me when I called at 945 am. Then after my free consult they gave me a price for all work I need as well as the extraction which was the reason I even went. Made an appointment for 230pm same day to remove the tooth giving me so much pain. I waited hours the second time because someone in front of me had some issues so it wasn’t expected to wait that long and they sent me a gift card they are all really sweet people and get you in and out as quick as they can. I’m still shocked I went as a new patient and still got the tooth pulled same day. It’s the next day I’m in no pain at all don’t even need the pain pills the doc did a great job considering nothing hurts. I def recommend if you need something done quick

resp.text: Thank you, Aaliyah, for saying you will recommend us. This is the highest form of appreciation, from our patients, that we receive! We take patient satisfaction very seriously, thanks again. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Nick C
text: I was in there for almost three hours, and only seen by a doctor for about one minute. I had substantial waits for every step of the process, which was a very basic exam that didn't even include a cleaning. I was only seen by someone promptly after I stood up to leave! Staff were nice enough but their process in in shambles, and in terms of facilities the waiting room looked a lot nicer than the exam rooms.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Nick. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Carie Frost
text:
I will NOT recommend Aspen Dental. The front desk lady completely ignored me when I came into fill out my paperwork.
The x-ray tech student was poor. She did not know what she was doing except Pooking my in my mouth while taking my x-rays.
ASPEN DENTAL FAILED TO TELL ME ON MY FIRST VISIT ...there was NO CLEANING just xrays,and have dr look at your xrays. That is BALONEY.

THEN THEY over charge for services.
Now I have to take off another day just to get my teeth cleaned.

resp.text: Hi Carie, I'm so glad you've enjoyed your experience with the team. We appreciate your feedback about the Admin side of the care. I will share your thoughts with our team so that we can to improve the patient experience. The direct phone number is 1-866-767-0890. Be well. - Cindy ADMI

name: Tonya Cleveland
text:
I gave it an one star because I couldn’t give it ZERO! This place has HORRIBLE customer service and they will increase their fees without notifying you. The black lady who I suppose who is in charge is the pure example of a “Nasty Black Woman!” When I told her I wanted a refund she started tapping on table!
DON’T GO HERE!!!

resp.text: Hi Tonya, I'm sorry that you didn't have a positive experience. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. – Cindy, ADMI

name: Jaydev Amin
text: They never answer phone calls and if they do then place you on hold and never get back to you. Called them numerous times today to book appointment for their recommended treatment worth $1400 out of our pocket but I guess they don’t want our business. Tried calling before and had the same issue. Please get this fixed.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Jaydev. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Ronnie Wilkerson
text: Was pleased with service. They had to work her in because we only ask for appointment on Monday. Will use Aspen again

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Ronnie. Thanks for sharing! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Briana Butler
text: I went here on Monday October 12th, 2020 and I was very disappointed with the wait times and overall service. My appointment was for 9:30 and I arrived at 9:15am. I was not acknowledged when I walked through the door and when I went up to the counter I was met with attitude and a non-sanitized tablet to fill out patient info. In the time of Covid I was very uncomfortable being handed a tablet that someone else just returned a minute before me.... I completed the paperwork within 5 minutes but still had to wait from 9:20am until 10:45 am before I was seen! With no apologies or information given in between all the while people who came in 10, 15, and 20 minutes after me were taken in BEFORE ME. Mind you I did have an appointment I was not a walk in! Right as I was about to leave I was called up and the entire exam plus dentist overview was less than 30 minutes! so I waited over an hour to only be seen for 30 minutes.. The dentist went over my x-rays extremely quick and the exam was maybe 5 minutes. I had to bring up my issues the dentist did not even ask me.. I also think for what they did say was wrong they are very overpriced. Overall not impressed and I will be going to a different dental office.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Briana. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Richard Iyobebe
text: I wouldn’t recommend.  Very overpriced.  A local dentist would be more professional.

resp.text: Hi Richard, I’m really sorry that your experience didn’t live up to expectations. Aspen Dental practices do try to ensure their prices meet or beat market prices. If you would like to discuss the care plan you received during your visit, or if you need any additional care in the future, the team and I would still be happy to try to help. – Michelle, ADMI

name: Yiskah Lalit
text: Everyone is very kind and attentive. I have major anxiety and they were all nothing but patient and kept me updated and in general treated me very gently.

name: Jennifer S. S.

name: Jimmie Bell
text: I have not used Aspen Dental, but after reading the reviews, I will never go there...

resp.text: Hi, Jimmie I’m sorry that you opted out, of discovering what Aspen Dental is all about/or what we can do for you. Each person experiences life in their own way. Often times, a patient can come in with their own preconceived thoughts, as to how the outcome should be. However, when a dentist does the exam, and finds something different, they immediately feel upset. No one likes to get news of possible dental work that will need to be done. It's scary, and costly, we get that. Everyone has their own way of dealing with good and bad situations. We would hope that all our potential patients would rather make up their own decisions, based on their own experiences. You may be pleasantly surprised! Be well - Cindy, ADMI

text: My appointment was at 8:45 am. I didn’t leave the office until after 11:00. I was told prescriptions were sent to Walgreens. It’s 7:38 pm and I am still without pain meds & antibiotics. I tried calling back to the office numerous times but kept getting the automated system which sent me to the voicemail. I spoke with someone after 5:30 who called in the prescription. But they called it in to the wrong place. So at 7:15 I get a call stating I could pick it up at Walgreens. WRONG!!!! I am at Walgreens and still no medicine. WHY????? Because it was called in at CVS!!!!! So now I have to wait for CVS to back it out of their system so Walgreens can fill the prescription. And guess what, it’s pain meds but no antibiotics!!!! I’m done. It’s my first and last time using ASPEN Dental!!!

text: I do not recommend. I was financed to get my dental work done through a company that they use (Genesys) . I have been paying on this loan since February and finally opened a dispute with Genesys . I never received any dental work and they are now sending over a refund to Genesys . It is now August , they stated I used services and paid in Full in March 2020. They have sent Genesys a refund and it’s taking forever for the refund to process. I will never use them again. They have my utilization very high on my credit card so until they send Genesys the refund , I can’t do anything. They are a scam. Why would you pay yourself for services in full that a patient never received?

I then contacted one of Aspen Rep. and she told me she would reschedule my Appt. for 7/13/2020; I asked the Rep. if she could find me something soon since it had taken already a month to get a Appt. She then stated o no it’s going to be @ September because you are a new patient anyways and we have to reschedule our patients first. I then lol and stated that ok and very Unprofessional  of your Company to allow me to set appt. then they canceled it ( electronically) I then call and the Rep rescheduled me days later then my original appt. then realize I was a NP so pushed me back 2 more months. name: Abigail Kidd
text: I had an appointment scheduled with this dental office since March 2020. Understandably, my appointment was canceled mid-March due to COVID, and I was notified via automated voicemail. I called to reschedule, and they told me there were no available appointments until June 29th. My boyfriend received an appointment for June 11th, arrived 15 minutes early, approached the counter and was told his appointment had been canceled. They offered to reschedule and apologized but said there was nothing they could do, as his appointment had been given to someone else. He had done his paperwork by email and had confirmed his appointment as well. This was not an error on his end. Today, I arrived for my appointment after no communication from Aspen’s end for weeks. I approach the door and it is locked with a note saying the office is closed until July 13th. I was turned away by the lady working inside, while two other patients that had approached the front door were taken inside. I was contacted by one of their managers after I called corporate to explain my frustrations with being turned away after having my appointment for over two months now, and I was told that there was no doctor in office. She explained that the other patients were just “taken inside” and did not elaborate further as to why I wasn’t offered the same efforts. Not sure what exactly the issue is here, besides just poor communication, but I will never be returning. I have no issue with cancelations as I understand it is a very difficult time right now, but I still expect you as a business to have the courtesy to contact your patients and be respectful of their time.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Abigail. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Jim S.
text: The people are very nice, but the insurance is a constant battle. My insurance has no copay for routine cleanings but they keep wanting to charge me and then upcharge for "fluoride" and "cancer screening" which do very little if anything at all IMHO. The two times I have been, the dentist on call (different each time) spent maybe three minutes with me, looked in my mouth and xrays and that's all.They did not do any gum measurements not filling adhesion testing as I have always been used to in 30+ years of other dentists. Also entire visit took about 3 hours....easily double of any other experiences. I understand that this is "chain dentistry" so I knew there would be 'some' issues. But again the people are very nice, it just takes a long time and the billing is an issue.

C.J.J.

name: Barbra Crippen
text:
If it was possible, I'd give them a negative star rating!!

I took my aunt to Aspen Dental yesterday & feel that we have been totally messed up. She is a cancer patient undergoing chemo & has lost a lot of weight which we told them.
She has a set of dentures but the bottom plate has never been adjusted to fit well. First the technician who I guess makes the dentures, etc., came in & was able to make an adjustment that would have made them wearable till she had a new set made. When they started to make impressions none of the trays that hold the "goop" was small enough to fit in her mouth???? Never had that problem before.
They ended up using her dentures to make the impressions, getting the goop all over her, then giving her a towelette to clean up with that came from a container that was clearly marked "Do not use on skin".
When we got home & took the bottom denture out of it's baggie, it had been ground down till there was nothing but teeth sitting on a flat base. Called them today to tell them they needed to make her a temporary plate & was told they couldn't do that.  Needless to say we are not going to do business with them. I have been told that they will refund her deposit.

We're going to a "real dentist" tomorrow to start over.

name: nhoenshell
text: I've lived in montgomery for exactly a year now, and I finally managed to schedule a dentist appointment because I was definitely past due for a visit. It was a weird experience at Aspen Dental to be sure, and I cant help but feel as if I was swindled somehow. It was the longest and most expensive dental appointment I've ever had. Being a new patient, I expected extra steps like xrays, but the whole ordeal was weird and confusing from the beginning (starting with when I tried to confirm my appointment via email, which ended up being a phone call, and none of my information was correct in their system). After an awkward xray process, I was led to a room and sat in a chair for about 30 mins. The first obvious red flag that had me wondering if I was getting the wool pulled over my eyes was the TV they stuck in my face (attached to the chair) as the tech and dentist did "paperwork" and talked about teeth stuff amongst themselves behind me completely out of my field of vision. Then the dentist said I had gingivitis and two cavities-- which were a complete shock to me since I've never had any in my life and was experiencing nothing unusual in my mouth during my daily life, no pain or discomfort at all. The gingivitis thing I could understand, I guess (i mean it's a reversible condition from what I understand, so I thought it was weird for them to schedule a whole multi appointment treatment process that would take place throughout the month). I dont know anything about teeth, so you could tell me to open up, poke around in there with tools, and tell me it's a whole huge dangerous mess and I'd have to believe you, because what do I know? What I do know is that the visits to my old dentist were always straight forward and I understood everything they were doing because it was clearly explained and they didn't try to schedule 3 visits in a single month. After all that waiting, tv, and a brief examination, I find myself at the cashier's desk and absolutely no work was done on my teeth. I opted out for the 130$ smart brush that was included in my bill. And then they said they could probably fit me in today for my first treatment after I paid for a large sum that was ultimately un-itemized. The paperwork I received was not a receipt for what I paid for in that moment, but a breakdown of all the work they were going to do and how much it was going to cost me later. I agreed to have the first treatment done right away. Finally, I was going to receive some sort of treatment that was physical during this visit, but I didnt truly understand what I was paying for that warranted such a large bill when I was at the cashier's office. The treatment was no different than what any other dentist would do during a routine cleaning so I'm still not sure why it was so expensive. At the end of my visit, I walked away with a lot of fancy products and with the peace of mind that I didnt have mouth cancer...so, that's a relief. The staff was super friendly and kind, and I really appreciated Loretta. She was absolutely fantastic, but I'm not sure I want to go back to this place at least two more times in a single month just to be broke and confused again. I fully understand that I am dumb, but things just didnt add up.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information.  I would really like to speak with you.  Will you please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201152 — Julie, ADMI

name: N Timms
text:
Aspen Dental is the worst. I was quoted $832 by Tanietha to have two of my wisdom teeth extracted with oral surgery on 12/04/2018 and the woman sent my X-ray over to the dentist that would be doing it. And I was told by Tanietha that if they weren’t able to schedule me then they would call me to reschedule. So I went ahead and paid $832 for two of my wisdom teeth to get removed with oral surgery. And it was scheduled for the very next day but I was told that I had to go to the Prattville location. My mouth was hurting so bad that I didn’t mind going to get that relief.  I show up at 1:15 p.m. to my appointment that was supposed to be scheduled for 12/05/2018 at 1:45 p.m. and at first the woman couldn’t find me stating that my appointment was canceled or taken off the schedule. The woman behind the receptionist spoke up because she’s who the Montgomery office spoke to and said she would ask the dentist if he could do it.
The dentist said that he would be able to remove my teeth. So I sit down to make sure the paper work was okay and I was informed that I would have to pay an extra $850 on the spot because they would rather that I be put to sleep. I already paid in full the price that I was given without insurance and drove to the Prattville location. And I was not prepared to pay an additional extra $850 on the spot for a service that I already paid for. I just told them to refund me the money and now I have to find somewhere else because these people are not organized in the least bit. They felt more than happy to take my money but when it was time for the service...it’s oh no ma’am we need more money now. Ridiculous! I’m still waiting on my refund now.
I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ASPEN DENTAL.

name: Malika Rogers
text: I had an appointment for a exam and x ray. During the process I was asked if I had a tooth that was bothering me at the moment,  and i said yes. I asked if i could get it pulled that day. I was told to make another appointment to have it pulled.  During the process of going over the procedures that will be done, make sure you look at the prices. They tried to charge me $153 for a toothbrush. They are all about money. I wanted them to do certain things, but instead they claim other things needed to be done first. Yeah, of course so they can get more money.  They are very unprofessional,  talking about the patients in front of other patients. They gossiping about why this patient came back, and the response wasOh he's complaining about his dentures again. A woman came in to bring one of the staff members some fish, and when I tell you most of the staff got so loud and ghetto over some fish. MY GOODNESS,  even the doctor came out and joined in. Out of all the staff I encountered that day, Cynethia has the most professionalism and she does not fit in that group at all. Actually she should teach the regional manager Felicia some techniques.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience, Malika. I apprecaite your feedback and will certainly pass this along. Thank you. -- Kelsey, ADMI

text: Worst experience ever definitely would not recommend. On top of my cost of service being displayed for the entire waiting room to hear, i was refused service because i did not and could not proceed with the costly plan they so happen to say i needed. Which may have been true, but how can you refuse the service the patient/customer wants to cover youd bottom line. I never in my life heard of such a thing. If my insurance covers two free cleanings per year why are you forcing me to get a deep cleaning at this moment i cant afford it. If i had 200 to spend on a cleaning i wouldnt need insurance. Just awful!!

text: The first visit was not a great experience.  I spent the two hours to get forms completed. Then we get to the office and they "can't access it!"  So we HAD TO REFILL THIS SAME PAPERWORK OUT!  How inconvenient.  The commercials are giving us false information about their service.

name: PJ Bowdoin-Babbitt
text: I recently moved to Athens, AL and Dr. Beasley was my first try at finding a forever home for dentistry. Dr. Beasley and his entire team are extraordinarily 'GOOD". I am having a couple of implants along with normal care and cleanings at age 70.  I have had the anesthesia dentistry for the implants.  I am very pleased with Dr.. Beasley and his entire team, and I feel fortunate to have found them!

name: Allie Dowdy
text: Great experience and wonderful staff. They give the best teeth cleaning possible. I have a permanent retainer on my bottom teeth and every time I go any where other than here they rip it off but I’ve never had this problem here. They lady that cleaned my teeth was super friendly and despite how many patients they have still remembered me. Go to Beasley they will treat you like family

name: Linda Crump
text: From the receptionist at the front desk to the last person that scheduled my next appointment and everyone in between including Dr. Beasley himself; I was treated with such kindness and courtesy by all. All of my questions were answered by the dentist and or his team and I fully understood the next step of my treatment plan before my next appointment. There were no surprise costs which have been very fair so far. I really liked the fact that I could voice my dental concerns with his dentist, he listened to my concerns, gave me his thoughts as far as a treatment plan but was also willing to modify the plan to meet my needs.  My husband and I moved here from up north and have now found our dentist here in the south. Dr. Beasley was recommended to me by my co-worker and I am so glad she did; this is the dental practice I too will recommend.

name: Dr. C. Joseph Fifer
text:
These guys did great!
Everyone there does their best to create a courteous, professional atmosphere that puts one at ease with confidence in a good outcome.
The confidence is well placed!
Dr. Beasley knows what he's doing and how to get it done. No more pain and I can enjoy eating again!

name: Hope Sides
text: Everyone is always so nice and friendly when we go! Dr. Beasley is so good with my little ones especially!

name: Patricia Moody
text: Dr. Beasley & his staff have been my dental provider for a number of years. I have always been treated with the upmost respect, as well as the most wonderful, thoughtful care. Before finding this dental service, I have had a long lifetime of fear and dread of dentists. This fear kept me from seeking and receiving the care I desperately needed. Dr. Beasley has completely changed this and I actually look forward to my appointments. I highly recommend him and his staff to anyone, especially if you have had bad experiences in the past. He is wonderful. I am always pleased with the staff and services provided.

name: Carol Taylor
text:
I can not say enough good things about Dr. Beasley and his staff, and he has a large staff! From the front desk, to billing, to assistants, to the nurses....all the way to Dr. Beasley. I feel so taken care of.
Professionalism is the first thing you'll see and feel. Courtesy and kindness follows close the minute you walk in the door.
I am 64 years old and I have had so much dental work done in my lifetime that I have seen it all, the good the bad and the scary. Now at my age after all that dental work I went through, because of the ageing process I was in a place I needed to have dentures.
The dentist that removed my compromised teeth embarrassed me so bad I went home and actually cried. And it takes a lot to make me cry. I waited a year before I finally found Dr. Beasley on-line and booked an appointment. I did a lot of searching. From the minute I walked in the door of his office until today, I have been so grateful for dentist like Dr. Beasley.
I ended up having to have oral surgery to reshape the bone on my lower jaw so I would be able to get dentures that fit well. Dr. Beasley was able to do this in his office, with all the sedation I needed so I wouldn't feel a thing, and the staff I already trust. The cost was outrageously so minimal I don't know how he makes a profit.
"I FELT SO TAKEN CARE OF"  The morning of surgery he gave me antibiotics, something I knew I would need because of other health problems but didn't have to tell him, and as I said before all the sedation I needed or wanted. After surgery I was given medication to help the healing process, prescriptions for pain meds and meds to help the swelling.
Today I had the stitches removed in my mouth and will start the denture process. AGAIN NO PAIN!
I have no doubt Dr. Beasley and his staff will see to it that my dentures will be the best they can possible be for me!
In closing let me just say, first I'm not getting paid to write this review, they don't even know I'm writing it. I just know there are a lot of people out there that are just like me who have been embarrassed about their teeth. Fear of being embarrassed kept me from getting the dental help I needed.
Dr. Beasley won't make you feel anything but..."TAKEN CARE OF"!
His staff will be professional, kind and friendly.

Go online and look for his website like I did.... you'll see.
And...P.S....I am a Nurse of 29 years. But No one in Dr. Beasley's office knows that and they still treated me like the kind hearted professionals they are!

name: Shane Taylor
text: Absolutely the best Dentist I have been to. If you are like me and would rather do about anything else than go to the dentist then you have found your new dentist. They offer a very affordable cleaning and x-ray plan for people without dental insurance. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Give them a try if you are shopping for a new dentist.

text: Great group of people who work there!! The took time and didn’t rush as I’m afraid of going to the dentist! I highly recommend them!

text: Dr. Beasley and his staff are always friendly.  I have some serious dental issues due to autoimmune issues. Dr. Beasley is thorough, competent and explains everything. And keeps my teeth in decent shape.

text: Hands down, best dentist I've ever been to! They were super kind, explained everything upfront (costs and all!), and best of all they were super gentle. Worth the drive from Madison. Thank you for going above and beyond!

text: Very pleasant dental office. All the employees are very friendly and nice. Dr. Beasley is great.

I am thankful they were able to see me the same day and resolve my pain!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THEM!

name: Larry Thomas
text: Wendy and I have gone to Dr Beasley for more than 10 years. We’ve always been very pleased with his operation and all his staff. They genuinely care about our family and treat us like we are one of their family members. I’m using the PerioRestore gel ( based on Dr Beasley’s recommendation) on a daily basis and love the results. This product whitened my teeth but more importantly appears to slow down the problems I was having with tooth/gum decay. I highly recommend Dr Beasley to anyone that is looking for a dentist that goes the extra mile to ensure your family has fabulous dental health. I also appreciate the personal care and professional treatment by Whitney who has been Wendy and my dental hygienist for years. This permanent arrangement is so important to Wendy and I. Thanks

name: chris dugger
text: Absolutely excellent service on my first vist. I Called in a panic and and was about to be scheduled for that day. The person on the phone said there could be issues with my insurance. I told her nevermind then and thank you. I hung up and went on about my business. She called me back a whilke later and had spent time she did not need to spend and that is service you never see. This will be my dentist office for life just for that. Then foe probably an hour I got to simply talk about my care. They obliged courteosly. That is also something you never see. And I am astounded.

text:
Wow!!! I must say that this place is AMAZING!! Before my appointment, I had prayed and asked God to allow my experience to be pleasant because I had anxiety from my previous dental experiences, and then especially with Covid & everything going on in the world! Not only did He make my experience pleasant, but He superceded my expectations! Literally from the time I walked in the door until the time I walked out I was blown away at the hospitality, warm welcomes, and the feeling of actually being cared for and treated like they wanted to help!!! I finally found me a dentist where the atmosphere all around was AWESOME!!! Dr. Beasley, Whitney, and everyone else that I encountered, I personally want to say Thank You ALL!!!! My prayers have truly been answered!!! I would recommend this place over & over again!!!
Recap: I had to go again today to get an Extraction and a bone graph! Now as I stated previously that my experience was AMAZING and I didn't think that it could get any better BUT IT MOST DEFINITELY DID! I was a nervous wreck but KAYLA KAYLA KAYLA & DR. BEASLEY were Forreal my Angels on today!!! Y'all don't know the dental nightmares/hospital experiences and I mean Life & Death encounters that I have had!!!! Thank you all so much once again!!!! Like I said I would recommend this place over and over again!!!!

text: Friendly staff, lousy follow up.  Was told I would have a treatment plan and pricing that day. Then received a phone call telling me it would be the next day.  Have not heard another word until the text weeks later asking me to review the service.  Needless to say,  but I've gone elsewhere.

name: Dr J Wayne McCain
text: Excellent service, very skilled and professional organization. Highly recommended!

name: Justin Wyatt
text: So, this is going to be a long story. It started on my finals week for college. I started feeling pain from my tooth on a Monday night. I barely had any sleep from the pain. So, I looked for a dentist in Athens and found Dr. Beasley’s and it was highly rate as one of the best in Athens. I went to sign in. The usual information and what I was allergic to. Then I found out that my insurance expired a few months before this. So, I had to pay all out of pocket. I got check on with the nice ten out of ten assistant. Then, Dr. Beasley came in for a few and said I need a root canal. Lucky they were able to have me in that day. I came back for the surgery; it was just like usual dentist surgery. But, at the end of the process I felt even worse than I did coming in. I was dizzy and just feeling three times worse. The doctor said that was unusual. They said get my prescription and if I still fill worse to call them in the morning. I had to go do my piano exam. So, I had to go through that in pain. I had even less sleep then the night before. On Wednesday morning I call them and they told me to get this a anabolic and to come get the prescription. I went down there and got the paper. I when to the drug store and had to wait in line with really bad pain. The people near me ask if I was okay and I had to tell them I was in pain from a dentist surgery. I help EBC Athens with the media and since I am the one that knows video editing I had to get a video done by that Sunday. I went and started to edit the nativity video wile still in more pain then it was at the beginning. Got at least a good bit out of the way. Had to use some of that Oragel. I was in so much pain I was crying and felt like I had to go to the emergency room. Still had barely any sleep. Next morning I went back up there and told them how much pain I was in. I was even cry when I went in. They checked me again and said I need another root canal because the tooth right next to it was fused to the other one.  I said okay there’s not much I can do, and I was kind of annoyed because I knew that ment twice amount in the price. But I just need this pain to go away. I go through the surgery agin. They had some trouble with their x ray machine but I do not think it was their fault entirely. At the end of that surgery my nose started to bleed. And the doctor said again that’s unusual. I was thinking oh no not again. We know what happened the last time he said that. So, after that I got another prescription that they gave me. But at least I was finally able to feel some relief and able to go to sleep. Finally on Friday I had a playing exam for my jazz band on my vibraphone. And I notice I was swollen from the drugs. But it started once when I took the first prescription. I just didn’t notice until then. I called Dr. Beasley and he was quick to respond and it was on the weekend. So, come to find out I’m allergic to all the drugs they gave me. The reason was, they are related to the same drugs that I put on my form that I was allergic to. But after the last surgery to finish the route canals everything else is fine and everything’s good now. I most likely will not be coming back. Take of this what you will. I’m one of thousands of people that have came through. Plus, probable one of the few that decided to give a review. Everyone’s problem is always going to be different. Your situation most likely will not be the same as my situation. At the end I will say the assistance were great and the doctor answered my questions fast.

name: Brandy Jordan
text: I took my daughter for her first dental visit and she was terrified. They took the time to explain to her everything they were doing and all the tools they were going to use. She left with no fear and a smile on her face. I even transfered my son there. They are awsome. If I could give 10 stars I would.

Love this place. Kim, my hygienist is so caring, giving and kind.

My daughter hated our previous dentist and needless to say was very scared to go (she is 6) but Lindsey was amazing and very calming to my daughter and she can’t wait to go back.

name: Sharon Ludwig

Dr. Beasley and his staff have restored my confidence that dentistry work doesn't have to be painful! The entire office is amazing. I must give a special shout out to Ms. Whitney, Ms. Kim, and Suvannah. Whitney is a top performing dental hygienist that offers superb care. Ms. Kim is just a sweetheart and makes me feel at home. text: I absolutely love the young little girl at the front desk.  What impresses me about the Dr is how he talks to the staff. After my appt was complete, I was instructed to wait in the room until the 'check out ' area was clear.  I have been using Beasley Family Dentistry  for about a year & I am happy.

name: Stephen Usery
text:
Brad had to go back on a implant done by U.A.B. University.  Brad in 2019, found that one implant  did not look good.He advised  me to return to U.A.B. and have them consult  on that implant  to see if futher work is needed to be done. Took off work, went to the consultation  which took all of 10 minutes. I was advised that the implant was fine and it was a x-ray issue. Upon  returning to Brad's  office, I told him what I was told. Brad having complete  faith in the  U.A.B. answer Brad set in motion  the making of my teeth which took a couple of weeks to make sure all would be good. I got my teeth,Brad installed the teeth which looked awesome. After 2.5 years of surgery along  with other of procedures,  I thought my journey  was over.
Two weeks later, my left side of my faced swelled  up. Brad was on vacation  but called in medication to help me. After he returned, he told the office help to get me in the office ASAP. I went in, Brad found what he thought might be a problem in 2019 come to life in 2020. My implant had to be redone (meaning new bone was to added).
Today, I spent 2.5 hours in a chair ( I did like the gas) ,which Brad had to work on a implant that was now harder to work on. I missed work again and possibly two days because one  person did not respect his craft. I guess one could say this is happening  in all trades. As for me, Brad has giving me all he knows  in his training  and experience  to help me get through  this trauma.  This makes Brad Beasley a master of his craft and I say thank you and well done.
Oh yeah, after all this today I feel 👍 great.

name: Debra Blais
text: I went to Dr Beasley two weeks ago for an extraction with bone graft to prepare for an implant. Also was to have a possible root canal. He explained everything to me in detail and was so calm and reassuring it relieved a lot of my fears. I had already visited for a routine cleaning and check up earlier this spring. That was also pleasant and was the best cleaning I’ve experienced at any dentist. The staff is very efficient and friendly. The extraction and bone graft went very smooth and I did not experience any pain. Slept thru the entire process thanks to the detailed instruction and professional process that Dr Beasley prepares for his patients. Everything is healing nicely and I thank him and the staff for taking such good care of me!

name: Tony Anderson
text: Yes the girl that clean my teeth she did a real good job but as far as the dentist taking up time and I even told the two girls up front to call me back and see if he would work out something to help me out on the $1,600 to put a new crown on and build a tooth up I hadn't heard from him but I went to another dentist today and they drilled into the crown that had came all took the old tooth out bildo to stuff and put the crown back on and the dentis Beasley told me that I couldn't be saved that it needed to be pulled and I had a another Crown to be replaced and another feeling that needs to be filled but I know they all in it to make money but anyway I Won't Go Back

resp.text: Mr. Anderson the tooth you are referring to and that Dr. Beasley saw you for was in fact non-restorable. Most of it had broken off into your crown. While another dentist may have been able to reattach your original crown back on to your tooth don't count it a success too fast. When a tooth is broken off at the gum line no cement is strong enough to hold a crown on for long in that situation. We pray that when your crown comes off again that you don't aspirate it down into a lung. Also, Dr. Beasley did not recommend a new crown for this tooth...he recommended that you remove the tooth and replace it. Best of luck to you sir.

name: Erin McCulley
text: My father has been in terrible pain but is very uncomfortable with the idea of going to the dentist - not only is it terrifying but his teeth are in very bad shape. On top of this he has no insurance and very little money. I called everyone in Huntsville and then found Dr. Beasley in Athens. Literally every person on his staff was sweet, helpful, and reassuring. They got us in right away, and when we called because it was a longer drive  than we had expected and we were late, we were told "No problem. Just drive safely and we'll see you when we see you." There was no wait time to speak of, and they were so efficient. Someone was in the room with us the entire time. My father was shocked, saying he couldn't feel any pain whatsoever, neither with the injection nor the extraction. Everyone was sympathetic to our needs and very helpful. Dr. Beasley even stayed to answer all our dental questions, and was very personable. The entire bill for consultation, x-rays, extraction and take home supplies was $177 - less than they quoted me on the phone. I can not recommend them enough.

name: Jo Lievsay
text: My Husband went to Dr. Beasley who removed a his back molar.  My husband's tongue became irritated.  Dr. Beasley tried two separate treatments which didn't work.  The last time we saw Dr. Beasley, he suggested a biopsy to determine if it was cancer.  I asked if there was a possibility that some bone fragments were causing the irritation.  He checked and low and behold, there were two bone fragments rubbing against the tongue.  Once the bone fragments were removed, the tongue healed and we haven't been back since.  The Staff were nice, kind and thoughtful.

resp.text: Mrs. Lievsay our office is happy and thankful that your husband only had a rough area after an extraction irritating his tongue and nothing more serious. The procedure you speak of happened over 19 months ago from the date of your Google review. Because of his concern for his patients and for the level of care he wants to provide in his practice, Dr. Beasley sees his patients sometimes for multiple follow-ups after oral surgery. As you know, Mr. Lievsay does not communicate the nature of his dental problems very well. Therefore many times you would accompany him in the treatment room. In reviewing our notes, Dr. Beasley continued to see Mr. Lievsay in the office for 10 additional visits over a 2 month period after his extractions to be sure that everything healed well and that he was happy.  Our team wishes you and Mr. Lievsay well!

text:
Dr. Beasley is the best dentist in N. AL in my opinion! He has been my dentist for several years and the quality of service that you receive when you visit his office is outstanding from the time you walk in the reception area to the time you are finished with your visit. The front office ladies are some of the most friendly people I've ever worked with and also work around my schedule for whatever fits my needs.

I used to have fears & anxiety when it comes to my teeth and dentists in general, but thanks to the sedation dentistry options, I no longer have to fear routine or extensive dental procedures that would otherwise be quite traumatic for me. I've had everything from teeth whitening to root canals and crowns and Dr. Beasley really is a master of the art of dentistry and an overall great doctor who actually cares about his patients' comfort.  If you have ever had fears of the dentist then he is the one to help get you through it. I suffered chronic fear from dental  procedures in the past with other dentists, but luckily I can now handle it with dignity thanks to the staff and services offered through Dr. Beasley  I will always give them my business.

text: I went there had teeth cleaned and fillings... went other time had x rays and a tooth pulled always paid cash.. Last time i went i got Teeth Whitening strips application to take home i paid cash again before my surgery date they send me a bill saying i didnt pay for the Whitening treatment which i called up there.. Talk to her and even she said we normally font let customers leave without paying for it.. they send my 218. Bill to a collection agency and they are threatening my credit this is by far the worst dentist place u can go..and further more everyone that knows me knows i pay my debts so thats really bad dentist office u have there no telling how many others are out there like me

resp.text: Mr. Russell we are sorry that you felt as if you had to write a bad review about our office due to your unpaid and overdue balance. We do see that you have a history of posting bad reviews for multiple other businesses so this seems to be a rather common practice for you. Regardless, since you choose to communicate in this manner we will reply with an explanation from our point of view. First, the treatment you speak of was performed back in January of 2018 and your procedures we billed to your dental insurance company for payment. The balance of what your dental insurance company didn't pay is your responsibility.  Over the past 7 months we have documented several attempts to contact you regarding your balance both by phone and by mail. You received at least 4 months of statements in the mail. You were also sent a final notice letter which stated if you did not contact us to make payment arrangements your account would be turned over for collections and that this could affect your credit. You still did not contact our office. We then had no choice but to pass your account on to a collection agency. Ignoring collection calls and statements in the mail doesn't make the bill go away Mr. Russell. For anyone reading this, our office is happy to make monthly payment arrangements to help our patients when an insurance company pays less than estimated. Please visit us at www.BeasleyDentistry.com. Beasley Dentistry is the winner of the 2017 and 2018 Athens News Courier "Best Dental Office" Readers Poll.
